loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat de plastique

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the KDC borrower group in Kiboriloni, Kilimanjaro. She is 39 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 4 children. Her children are aged 13,11,7, and 4 years old. She also cares for other 2 dependents.

Elizabeth has owned a tailoring business for 3 years. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Elizabeth`s second loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more materials for her business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Elizabeth hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more materilas

loans.name: Skylight Group

texts.en:
The Skylight Group is new to SMEP, and all fifteen members have requested their first loans of either Ksh 15,000 or Ksh 20,000.

The Organizing Secretary of Skylight Group is Violet N., who owns Ghemt Hardware store in Githunguri, a growing trading center outside Nairobi. Violet has run this business for the past eight months, selling electronic goods and building materials such as cable, bulbs, pipes, cement and nails. Previously, Violet was employed as a cashier for three years, and used her savings to open the hardware store.

Violet has requested a loan to purchase more expensive materials such as cable, cement and paint to sell. She would like to one day be a wholesaler of electrical goods and other hardware.

Violet is married, and is the mother of two children: a 12-year-old girl and a 7-year-old boy. She describes herself as principled. She believes in herself and achieves whatever she puts her heart into.

The other members of the Skylight group own a diverse set of businesses including a cereal shop, a restaurant, a grocery, and a clothing shop. In addition, some members transport water and buy/sell plots of land.

loans.use: To increase her stock and expand her business

loans.name: Rokia

texts.fr:
Madame Rokia Cissé  est âgée de 48  ans, mariée et  mère de 5 enfants. Elle vit dans une famille polygame avec son mari, sa coépouse et leurs enfants au  quartier Hamdallaye B de la ville de  Ségou (4ème région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas été l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle commença dès son enfance à faire le petit commerce auprès de sa maman avec la vente de gâteaux, de condiments alimentaires etc. Nanties d’expériences de plusieurs années passées dans ce commerce d’articles divers, elle décida de se spécialiser dans le commerce de pagnes depuis maintenant 6 ans. Elle maîtrise parfaitement ce créneau et est très sollicitée. 
Dans le souci de maintenir sa clientèle et de réaliser plus de bénéfices, elle fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 30 mois. Après 3 prêts solidaires et 1 prêt individuel tous correctement bien remboursés, elle est à son 2ème prêt individuel.
Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 1 balle de pagnes wax (qui équivaut à 50 pièces de pagnes wax soit 100 complets). Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako auprès des grossistes. Madame  Rokia Cissé  vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000 FCFA, qui lui permettra de faire face à ses besoins (achat d’habits, chaussures) et d’aider son mari dans la prise en charge des dépenses de la famille. 
Son ambition est de construire une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
Ms Rokia Cissé, age 48, is married and the mother of five children.  She lives in a polygamous family with her husband, her co-wife, and their children in the Hamdallaye B district of the city of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Not having been to school due to societal reasons, she started early in her childhood working at a small business with her mother selling cakes, condiments, etc.  Bestowed with several years of experienced in this business of selling various goods, she decided to become specialized in the commerce of pagnes (colorful West African cloth) six years ago now.  She has an excellent command of this niche and is much in demand.  Concerned about maintaining her customers and making bigger profits, she turned towards Soro Yiriwaso.  She has had an associated with this micro-finance institution for 30 months  After three solidarity loans and an individual loan, all properly repaid, she is now on her second individual loan. She intends to use this loan to buy a bale of Wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth), equivalent to 50 bolts of cloth, or about 100 outfits.  She stocks up in Bamako from wholesale vendors.  Sales are made to customers composed of men and women, cash or credit accepted.  With this loan, she plans to realize a monthly profit of 75,000 francs CFA that will enable her to address her needs (buying clothing, shoes) and to help her husband to cover family expenses.  Her ambition is to build a house.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Josephina

texts.en:
Josephina is a member of the Majengo borrower group in Kiboriloni, Kilimanjaro. She is 46 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 4 children. Her children are 24,16,13 and 9 years old.

Josephina has owned a food business for  7  years,  she works 10 hours a day and earns a monthly profit approximately 300,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Josephina`s  second loan from BRAC_Tanzania. She requested the amount of 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more commodities.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Josephina hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities to her business

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Fatoumata D.  N° 2 est âgée de 37 ans,  célibataire  et  mère d’un enfant. Elle vit avec son enfant  au  quartier ATTBOUGOU de Ségou (4ème région administrative de la république du Mali).
Commis de l’administration publique, elle est secrétaire de direction dans un service publique. Parallèlement à ses obligations professionnelles, elle mène des activités commerciales avec la vente de l’encens et des habits depuis 14 ans et jouit d’une grande notoriété. Ses clients, innombrables sont composés majoritairement de fonctionnaires. Elle reçoit de la commande venant de l’intérieur du pays et de l’extérieur. Elle est sollicitée lors des mariages car sa marchandise est très prisée par les nouveaux mariés.
Le  processus de préparation de cette matière si douce et si sensationnelle est la suivante : il faut 2 kg de  magnonkisèni (plante exotique) assaisonnée de parfums et eaux de Cologne (30 bouteilles)  pendant un mois afin d’avoir une bonne senteur. 
Dans le souci d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et de faire face à la demande clientèle, elle fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle  est en relation  depuis 36 mois. Après 4 prêts solidaires et 1 prêt individuel  tous correctement bien remboursés, elle  est à son 2ème  prêt individuel. 
Elle compte l’utiliser pour acheter, 10 kg de graine d’encens (magnonkisèni), et 5 complets de bazins moins riches et des habits confectionnés en wax à l’approche des fêtes. 
Elle s’approvisionne sur place au grand marché de Ségou et  vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée exclusivement de femmes pour l’encens, de femmes et d’hommes pour les habits. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75.000FCFA qui servira à se prendre en charge et investir le reste dans ses activités.
Son ambition est de construire une maison à usage afin de la mettre en  location.
texts.en:
Fatoumata D. N° 2 is 37 years old, unmarried, and the mother of one child, with whom she lives in the ATTBOUGOU district of Ségou (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). A representative of the administration, she is a personal assistant of the management in a public agency. Concurrent with her professional obligations, she has been running a business selling incenses and clothing for fourteen years and enjoys great recognition. Her countless customers are composed mostly of civil servants. She receives orders both domestic and foreign. She is in demand for marriages because her merchandise is highly prized by newlyweds. Here is the process of making this exquisite and sensational product: you need 2 kg of magnonkisèni (an exotic plant) seasoned with perfumes and eaux de cologne (30 bottles) for a month in order to have a nice scent. Concerned about increasing her sales and about coping with customer demands, Fatoumata turned towards Soro Yiriwaso. She has been associated with this micro-finance institution for 36 months. After four solidarity loans and an individual loan, all properly repaid, she is now on her second individual loan. As the holidays approach, she intends to use the loan to buy 10 kg of incense seeds (magnonkisèni), five outfits made of ’less-rich’ damask, and some clothing made of ‘wax’ cloth. She stocks up locally at the big market of Ségou and accepts cash or credit in her sales to customers, who are composed exclusively of women for the incense. And for the clothing, they are both women and men. Fatoumata plans on realizing a monthly profit of 75,000 francs CFA that will be use to support herself, and the rest will be invested in her businesses. Her ambition is to build a house for renting out.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua F. is married and has two children. She has completed junior high school. Ekua sells fish. She goes to the cold store and buys frozen fish which she fries for sale at Abrodzirum near Shama-Kedzi. She has been doing this since 2004. Her husband is a farmer. Ekua uses her profits to help pay for school fees and utility bills.

Ekua will use the loan to purchase more frozen fish to fry and sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to save money towards the building of a new house.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen fish to fry and sell.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama H. is married and has three children. She has no educational background.  Ama has been in business since 2001, buying frozen fish and then reselling it at Abrodzirum near Shama-kedzi. Her husband is in farming.  Ama uses her income to help feed and educate her children.  Ama will use the loan to expand her business by purchasing more fish to resell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to save money to further her children’s education.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing more fish for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Achat d'engrais et  d'intrants agricoles

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is a member of the Kidumu borrower group in Kiboriloni,Kilimanjaro. She is 32  year old woman, she is married and a mother of 1 child. Her child is 9 years old.

Ester has owned a clothing business selling clothes for 10 years, she works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit approximately 160,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Ester`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania. She requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale.


With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Ester hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow corn

loans.name: Honorine's Group

texts.fr: K. Honorine Afi est une femme de 47 ans  mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de plastiques(cuvettes,gobelets,pots et bassines)à kpalimé. Avec ce prêt, Afi voudrait élargir son étalage en achetant en gros des plastiques de lomé pour revendre à kpalimé. Dans l’avenir, elle aimerait être une grossiste.
texts.en:
K. Honorine Afi is a 47-year-old woman who is married and the mother of four children. She is a retailer of plastic tubs in Kpalimé. With this loan, she would like to enlarge her display by buying plastic items wholesale in order to come to Kpalimé to resell them. In the future, Afi would like to become a wholesale merchant.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: achat de  diverses sortes de plastiques

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret A. sells gari (roasted cassava). She goes to the farms to buy cassava and processes it into gari at Abrodzirum near shama-kedzi.

Margaret has received junior high education. She is divorced and has three children. Her husband is into farming. Margaret is responsible for the payment of school fees and the settlement of bills.

Margaret’s loan will enable her to increase her capital to purchase more cassava to make gari. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save for her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava to make more gari

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en: W. Mathew is a man of forty-eight years old, married to one wife with six children of which four are still studying that is three in secondary level and one in primary level. He has an engineering workshop in Mutesa Loyal University which he has been running for over twenty years. He is using the loan for purchasing more metallic materials, vanish, and other machines to expand his business. He is a hardworking man whose dream is to open up more engineering workshop branches in different districts since his business is doing well with customers from different districts. He also wants to start up a technical school of training students that is to equip them with the same skills of engineering so that they can be able to with him in different branches which he is hopping to set up.

loans.use: purchasing more metallic materials, vanish, and other machines to expand his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To hire labor and to buy manure

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia D. is a seamstress; cloths are brought by people and make them into dresses at Abrodzirum near shama-kedzi.  Lydia has received junior high school education.  She is married and has one child. Her husband is a mason. Lydia has been a seamstress since1999. She supports in the payment of fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more cloths, fabric and other sewing supplies for the sewing.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards the child’s education.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more cloths, fabric and other sewing supplies for the sewing.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy farm supllies and equipment for market gardening

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow corn

loans.name: Ekwa

texts.en:
Ekwa A. is married and has no children. She has no educational background.  Ekwa sells bags of roasted groundnuts and periwinkles.  She goes to the seashore and buys the periwinkles for sale at Abrodzirum, near Shama-Kedzi, which she has been doing since 1969. 

Ekwa uses her income to pay fees and utility bills.  She will use the loan to purchase more groundnuts and periwinkles to sell. With increased profits from her expanded business, Ekwa plans to save for the education of grandchildren.

loans.use: Ekwa will use the loan to purchase more groundnut and periwinkles for sale.

loans.name: John

texts.en: L. John is thirty years old, married with only two children. He stays in Bukulula Kasasa west that is Masaka district and running his business of brick lying from Mukoko village Along Lukaya to Masaka road four kilo meter. He started this business in the year 2000 that is nine (9 years). He is using the loan purposely to boost his business that is adding capital to purchase firewood since it is the major factor for the business to proper and paying labor wage to those who help him out. His future hopes are prospering and be a successful man in future.

loans.use: Purposely to boost his business that is adding capital to purchase firewood since it is the major factor for the business to proper and paying labor wage to those who help him out.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali K. is a man of thirty-eight years old, married with three children whom one is studying and two are still young. Ali has a retail shop located in Kitaka local council Nyendo and he has been operating his business for six years. He is using the loan purposely for buying retail items such as bags of maize flour, sugar, beans and so forth. She wants to purchase a second hand fridge for cold soft drinks. This will help her business to expand. Ali’s future hopes are to purchase a plot of land, set up rental houses which may support his family and educate his children in future.

loans.use: Purposely for buying retail items such as bags of maize flour, sugar, beans and so forth.

loans.name: Gie Foulacounda Group

texts.fr:
Nous sommes un groupe de jeune femmes qui habitent l'écovillage de Faoune et qui souhaitent faire du  commerce de produits cosmétiques et d'articles de maisons qui intéressent les femmes de notre village.
Nous avons déjà de l'expérience pour gérer un prêt, car nous avons déjà bénéficié d'un crédit alloué par le SEM FUND, que nous avons intégralement rembourser dans les délais requis par les bailleurs. Notre village est situé sur une zone d'accès difficile. Ce qui rend difficile l'accès à certains types de provisions comme les produits cosmétiques, qui sont très prisés par les femmes et aussi des produits de consommations courante.

loans.use: Achat et vente de produits de maison

loans.name: Franklin Antonio

texts.es: Franklin Antonio L.  Sánchez tiene 30 años de edad, con 2 hijos menores de edad los que ha logrado mantener de la manera mas digna que esta a su alcance. ofreciendo sus servicios con su triciclo transportando a las personas hasta el lugar que se le indica, muchas veces le ha ido un poco mal pero gracias a Dios nunca se ha acostado sin comer que es lo mas importante, al principio le trabajo a un empleador el cual lo explotaba pero con un poco de ahorro logro comprar su propio triciclo. su meta es comprar al menos 10 triciclos y poder emplear a otros, para esto el necesita un financiamiento y por el momento con este dinero que se le conceda, piensa comprar 2 triciclos y empezar a cumplir su sueño.
texts.en:
Franklin Antonio is 30 years old, with 2 young children who he has managed to maintain in the most dignified manner he possibly could. He offers tricycle services, transporting people wherever they wish to go. Often, things have gone badly for him but, thank God, he has never lacked food, which is the most important thing.

At first, Franklin worked for an employer who exploited him but with a little savings, he managed to buy his own tricycle. His goal is to buy at least 10 tricycles and to employ others. For this, he needs financing. For the moment, with this loan, he wishes to buy 2 tricycles and begin to realize his dream.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY TWO TRICYCLES TO TRANSPORT CUSTOMERS

loans.name: Help Yourself #1 Group

texts.en:
Help Yourself #1 is a group of five borrowers. It is led by John K., who lives in remote Kolahu city in rural Lofa county, the breadbasket of Liberia. John is 37 years old, married, with four children, ages seven to thirteen. He also takes care of two children orphaned in the war. John is a high school graduate, but his eldest is only in fourth grade because school was closed during the war. 

For the past five years, John has been producing and selling soap to the farming community from his temporary market stall alongside approximately one hundred other vendors of various trades. He is requesting a loan to purchase more raw materials (caustic soda, oil, pans, etc.) to increase his inventory sufficiently so he can serve more customers. 

With his profits John dreams of first creating a larger market stall, then ultimately building a permanent shop. His greater profits would allow him to invest in the future of his children, especially in their schooling, which he was fortunate enough to complete.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials--caustic soda, oil and pans--for his soapmaking business

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.es: Don Bonifacio M. tiene la edad de 54 años en los que desde joven ha estado trabajando en la venta de lotería convencional y con la ayuda de su esposa logro establecer un pequeño negocio de una pulpería en su vivienda. Para esto es importante señalar que Fundación León 2000 ha sido su mano amiga en varias ocasiones concediéndole créditos para llegar a establece este negocio. Para seguir fortaleciendo la pulpería que tiene en su hogar se Bonifacio precisa de un financiamiento y de esta manera invertir en el comprando materia como es aceite, arroz, frijoles, pan, detergentes, jabón, consomé, y otros productos que necesita tener de venta. Es por eso que el solicita a esta institución un financiamiento con el cual ya esta contando para lograr las metas que se propuso para este año.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Better World #1 Group

texts.en:
Better World #1 is a group of five borrowers, led by Jarmie Alfred, living in Kolahu, Lofa County, Liberia.

Jarmie is 38 years old and married with three children aged 5-25, and one grandchild. Only one of her children is in school; the others were required to work or beg during the war. Jarmie was unable to attend school because, although she enjoyed it, the cultural norm was for girls to rely on their husbands to provide, and therefore school was considered unnecessary. Jarmie lives in remote Kolahu in rural Lofa County, the breadbasket of Liberia.

Jarmie’s business is dry goods, including spices, soup cubes, matches, palm oil, rice, flour, etc. She buys wholesale from nearby Guinea and sells in a temporary market stall alongside approximately one hundred other vendors of various trades. She has run her business for three years and is successful because her customers like her personality and work ethic.

Jarmie is taking the loan to increase her inventory of rice, beans, and oil which sell well in this season. Her dream is to grow her business so she can one day have a bigger table in the market and ultimately to have her own shop. With the profits from her business Jarmie dreams of building her own house.

loans.use: To purchase rice, beans, and oil for her business

loans.name: Gie Farancounda Group

texts.fr: Nous sommes des habitants de l'écovilage de Faoune et nous souhaitons lutter contre l'exode rurale des jeunes en créant un grand jardin de maraîchage dans notre village.Cela nous permettra d'employer des jeunes du village. Nous habitons une zone essentiellement agricole et voulons profiter de la bonne pluviométrie de cette année pour produire des légumes que nous allons ensuite vendre dans les grandes villes du pays. C'est la première fois que nous sommes venus solliciter un prêt auprès de votre institution. Nous sommes confiants en notre capacité de production pour rembourser à temps les prêts qui nous seront alloués.
texts.en:
We are residents of the eco-village Faoune, and we wish to fight the rural exodus of young people by creating a large farm for market-gardening in our village. This will enable us to employ village youngsters. We live in an essentially agricultural area and want to take advantage of the good rainfall measurements for this year in order to produce vegetables that we are then going to sell in the nation’s large cities. This is the first time we’ve come to request a loan from your institution. We are confident in our production capacity for repaying on time the loans that will be granted us.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy market-gardening supplies and equipment

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en: Iyabo sells kitchen utensils. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. She is 38years old and married with 4 children. She has been in the business for years. She is requesting for the loan amount of N60, 000 to purchase more kitchen utensils to sells. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kitchen utensils

loans.name: Donato

texts.es: LA SEÑOR DONATO Q. TIENE LA ACTIVIDAD DE CONFECCION DE CHAMARRAS Y SACONES PARA DAMAS DE DIFERENTES TALLAS. EL SEÑOR ES VIUDO TIENE DOS HIJAS, QUE AUN ESTAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR, PESE A ESO LE COLABORAN CON LA CONFECCION. REQUIERE EL CREDITO PARA COMPRAR UNA MAQUINA DE COSER DE MEDIO USO, ASI TENER MAYOR MARGEN DE GANANCIA.
texts.en:
Mr. Donato Q. is in the business of making jackets and coats for women of various sizes. He is a widower and has two daughters, who are still school-aged and thus help him with clothing production. He requests a loan for the purchase of a used sewing machine, which will improve his profit margin.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a used sewing machine

loans.name: Grace Adeola

texts.en: Grace sells kerosene. She is 48, married and has 3 children. She has been in the business for a long time. She hopes for a loan of N30, 000 to purchase more kerosene to sell. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase kerosene to sell

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: La señora Maria Auxiliadora P. tiene 43 años de edad, de los cuales 28 de estos ha vivido trabajando, hoy en día ella se dedica a la venta de comida, el negocio está ubicado en su propia vivienda pues a ella le gusta estar al lado de sus hijos. Quienes aun están adolescentes y necesitan en cada momento su orientación, a través de esta actividad Maria ha podido sostener a su familia. Gracias a Dios estos últimos tiempos su venta ha estado incrementando por lo cual ella solicita un financiamiento para poder comprar materia prima como lo es granos básicos, gaseosas, leña, carnes entre otras cosas que utiliza para echar a andar su pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Auxiliadora P. is 43 years old, and has been working for 28 of those years. Currently she earns money selling food out of her house because she likes being close to her children, who are still adolescents and need her guidance. Through this business, Maria has been able to support her family. Recently, thanks to God, her sales have been increasing, and for this reason she needs this loan to be able to buy raw materials such as basic grains, sodas, firewood, and meats, among other things that she uses to keep her business running.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw foods and supplies

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana A. sells sarongs and she is also a tailor in her community in Sapele, Delta state, Nigeria. She is 60, married and has 3 children. She hopes for a loan of N60, 000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet   sells planks. She is 50 years old and married with 4 children. She has been in the business for sometime now. She is requesting for the loan amount of N50, 000 to purchase more planks to sells. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Mission Group

texts.en:
A. O. is 41, married and has two children, 25 and 20.  He has a clothing business that he started 6 years ago.  He works every day from 6am until 6pm and is able to earn a monthly profit of around $420. 

This will be A.’s eighth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase his business. He also bought essentials for his son who was going to the university, bought land, and paid for home expenses. He repaid all previous loans. He will use the 8th loan to increase his stock. 
	
A. will share this loan with his loan group, Mission, which totals 16 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, A. is standing in the back, 2nd from the left, in a green and white shirt.

loans.use: To increase his stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat de ciment pour la construction

loans.name: Kemi

texts.en: Kemi sells provisions and food. She is 41, married and has 2 children. She has been in the business for some time now. She is requesting a loan of N100, 000 to purchase more food to sell. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn A. sells sarongs and baby things like bottles, diapers, nappies, creams, etc. She is 40, married and has 4 children. She is requesting a loan of N60, 000 to purchase more sarongs and baby things to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and baby things

loans.name: Freddy Daniel

texts.es: Freddy Daniel A. es un joven emprendedor de 23 años de edad, con un hijo que es la persona más importante de su existencia. él y su esposa han podido auto mantenerse con muchos esfuerzos pues él estuvo trabajando como albañil el cual es un trabajo muy pesado, pero con mucho entusiasmo decidió guardar dinero en cada pago que recibía y empezó a comprar cerdos para engorde el cual ha sido un negocio rentable. pues sus ingresos han sido más altos, sin embargo el está necesitando un financiamiento para ampliar  él lugarcito donde tiene a los cerdos y empezar a comprar más cerdos .el sueño más anhelado es tener una vida cómoda y dándole a su familia la manutención que se merecen y vivir junto a ellos sin preocupaciones económicas.
texts.en:
Freddy Daniel A. is a young, 23-year-old entrepreneur who has a child who is the most important person in his life. He and his wife have been able to support themselves through a lot of hard work. Freddy worked in the construction industry, which was a very hard job, but eagerly decided to save a little money from each wage that he received and began to buy pigs to raise, a venture that has proved profitable. Although he is earning more money now, Freddy needs this loan to extend the area where he keeps the pigs and to purchase more to raise. His greatest wishes are to have a comfortable life, provide his family with the support they deserve, and live together with them without economic concerns.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity is 28 and single. She has been selling food for some time now. She is hoping for a loan of N50, 000 to purchase more food to sell. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 36, married and has one child. She has been selling motor parts for years. She is requesting a loan of N100, 000 to purchase more motor parts to sell. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase motor parts to sell

loans.name: Tinuke

texts.en: Tinuke is 42, married and has 4 chidlren. She has been selling sraongs for some time now. She hopes a loan of N60, 000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase sarongs to sell

loans.name: Madoty

texts.en: Madoty sells provisions, drinks and juice in her shop. Madoty is 50 and has 5 children. Madoty is very enthusiastic about the growth of her business and that of her family. She hopes for a loan of N100, 000 to purchase more provisions, drinks and juice to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, drinks and juice to sell

loans.name: Eric

texts.en: Eric S. is married and has one child. He has received tertiary education.  Eric makes and sells palm kernel oil and foodstuffs such as plantain, cassava, cocoyam, etc., at Elmina near Ntsinman.  He has done this since 2006. His wife is a trader and a farmer.  Eric uses his income to pay fees and utility bills.  Eric will use the loan to purchase more palm kernel nuts. With the new profits from his expanded business, Eric plans to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To purchase more palm kernel nuts.

loans.name: Fumilayo

texts.en: Fumilayo sells wine, drinks and juice. She sells both wholesale and retail. Fumilayo is 37, married and has one child. Fumilayo hopes for a loan of N100, 000 to purchase more juice, drinks and wine to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more wine, drinks and juice

loans.name: Gie Saré Doro Group

texts.fr: Nous sommes des habitants de l'écovillage de Saré Doré, qui fait partie de Colufifa et nous sommes dans une zone enclavée, difficile d'accès, car les routes sont impraticable, surtout en période hivernale. C'est pour cela que nous sommes venues solliciter un prêt auprès de votre institution, afin de pouvoir faire face à des difficultés de ravitaillement que connaissent las populations de notre écovillage. Ce stock nous permettra d'avoir sur place une quantité importante de produits de première nécessité. Ainsi nous faciliterons la tâche à tous les riverains qui souhaitent acquérir des produits d'utilité quotidienne et qui ne souffrirons pas le calvaire pour pouvoir se les procurer.
texts.en:
We are residents of the eco-village Saré Doré, which is part of Colufifa. And we are in an isolated area, difficult to reach, because the roads are practically impassable during winter time. This is why we have come to apply for a loan from your institution, so as to be able to cope with supply problems that people are experiencing in our eco-village. This stock of supplies will allow us locally to have significant quantities of basic necessities. And so, we will facilitate the task for all those who live by the water and who wish to acquire every-day goods but who won’t put up with the ordeal of getting supplies.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy domestic goods and foodstuff

loans.name: Yaw

texts.en: Yaw is thirty-one-years old. He is married and has two daughters who are all still in school. He works very hard to provide for his family. Yaw lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Oda, which is in the Eastern region of Ghana. He is a sprayer. He sprays all kinds of furniture for carpenters, churches, and so on. He has a workshop in his community and procures paints and other materials from Accra. He has been in business for five years, and he wants a loan to buy materials in bulk to expand his business.

loans.use: Buy work materials

loans.name: Alamiro

texts.es:
Alamiro tiene 32 años de edad, es casado, y vive junto a su esposa y sus cuatro hijos en el caserío El Progreso, distrito de Lagunas, ubicado a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Hace dos años que se dedica a la ganadería, posee cuatro vacas lecheras que cría con mucho esfuerzo, ya que son la única fuente de ingreso económico diario de su familia; la leche producida por sus animales la vende diariamente a una empresa acopiadora de la zona, que le compra el producto a 0.90 nuevos soles el litro.

Alamiro desea comprar otra vaca para aumentar su producción y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, por este motivo se encuentra solicitando a nuestra Institución un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le sirvan para completar el dinero que necesita para adquirir otra vaca que le ayude a seguir sacando adelante a los suyos.

Su mayor anhelo es construir una casa de material noble, ya que la que tiene es de adobe (material rústico cuyo principal componente es el barro) y no les ofrece la seguridad necesaria ante las fuertes lluvias que se presentan en el lugar durante la temporada de verano.

Esta es la cuarta vez que Alamiro trabaja con nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos por lo que es considerado como un buen cliente.
texts.en:
Alamiro is 32 years old, married, and lives with his wife and four children in the village of El Progreso, in the Lagunas district, located 40 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Two years ago Alamiro got into the cattle farming business. Currently, he owns four milk cows that he raised with a lot of hard work. They are the only source of daily income for the family. The milk produced by the animals he sells daily to a local stocking company, that buys it for .90 nuevos soles each liter.

Alamiro wants to purchase another cow to increase his production and improve the quality of life of his family. For these reasons he is asking our Institution for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles that will allow him to acquire the new cow and will help support his family.

His greatist wish is to build a house with good materials, as his current home is build of adobe (a country material composed mainly of mud) and does not offer the necessary protection against the strong rains that come during the summer.

This is the fourth time Alamiro has worked with our Institution and, as he has always been punctual and responsible with the payments, he is considered a good client.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a milk cow.

loans.name: Koffivi

texts.fr: D. Koffivi est homme de 36 ans marié et père de 2 enfants. Il habite à kpalimé. Avec ce prêt, il veut acheter du ciment pour la construction d’une maison qu’il va louer plus tard.  Il voudrait mettre ses frais de location de coté, pour que dans l’avenir ses enfants puisse aller à l’université de lomé.
texts.en:
Koffivi D. is 36 years old, married and the father of two children. He lives in Kpalimé. He will use this loan to buy cement for the construction of a house that he will rent out. He wants to save the income from the rent, so that in future his children can study at the University in Lomé.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cement for the construction of a house

loans.name: Gie Mayor Group

texts.fr: Nous sommes venus pour demander le renouvellement du prêt numéro 25243, dont nous avons fini le remboursement depuis fort longtemps. Nous attendions le moment propice pour nous remettre au travail que nous avions suspendu pour faire les travaux champêtres, qui se font traditionnellement pendant l'hivernage dans notre pays.maintenant, nous voulons reprendre les activité pour lesquelles vous nous avez donné un premier financement(réf:25243). il faut dire au passage, que nous sommes très satisfaites du premier prêt qui nous à aider à pouvoir faire face aux difficultés liées à l'hivernage. Maintenant que nous sommes plus expérimentés, nous allons acheter des produits dont les populations ont vraiment besoins, puisque maintenant nous connaissons leurs besoins.
texts.en:
We came to request for renewal of loan number 25243 of which we finished repayment a long time ago. We have been waiting for the right moment to go back to work that we suspended in order to do our farm work which is done traditionally during the raining season in our country. We now want to resume the business for which you gave us the first financing (ref: 25243). It must be said, by the way, that we are pleased with the first loan which helped us to be able to meet the difficulties associated with the farming season . Now that we are more experienced, we will purchase items that the people really want, since we know their needs

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of domeatic products and foodstuffs

loans.name: Clifford

texts.en: Clifford A. sells palm kernel oil and foodstuffs such as plantain and cassava at Elmina near Ntsinman.  Clifford has received a senior-high-school education.  He is married and has five dependents. His wife is a trader and a farmer. Clifford has been selling palm kernel oil and foodstuffs since 1989. He is responsible for paying school fees and for general family expenses. This loan will be used to buy spare parts for his machine and to buy more palm kernel nuts to make oil. He hopes to use the new profits from the business to invest in his children's education.

loans.use: To buy spare machine parts and more palm kernel nuts

loans.name: Action Group #1

texts.en:
Action Group #1 is a group of 5 borrowers, led by Vincent F., living in Kolahu, Lofa County, Liberia.  John is 55 years old, married, with 9 children, aged 3-20, and also takes care of children orphaned in the war.  All his children are in school.  John is a high school graduate and lives in remote Kolahu city in rural Lofa county, the breadbasket of Liberia. 

John’s business is preparing and selling dried meat, important in Liberia since most don’t have refrigerators.  He sells the meat to the farming community from his temporary market stall alongside approximately 100 other vendors of various trades.  He has been running his business for 1 year.   He’s taking a loan to purchase additional meat and also bags to transport it.  With the profits he dreams of first having a larger market stall and ultimately building a more permanent shop, and investing in the future of his children, especially school which he was fortunate to complete.

loans.use: Purchase 1 carton of meat and bags for reselling

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy supplies in bulk

loans.name: Kassim

texts.en: Kassim T. is a building contractor and she also sells bags of cements and blocks. She has been in this business for four years. T. hopes for the loan amount of N140, 000 to purchase more bags of cement to sell. T. is married with 2 children and she is 40 years old. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of cement

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: le labour et l’achat d’intrants

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 36, married and has one daughter who is out of school. She works very hard to support her husband and help provide for the family. She lives with her daughter and husband in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. Mary is a food vendor. She cooks and sells rice and stew on the street in her community in the mornings. She buys her raw materials from Kumasi. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Hope

texts.en: Hope s 45, married and has 6 children. She has been selling food for some time now. She hopes for a loan f N100, 000 to purchase more food to sell. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food stuff to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow corn

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Monsieur Adama D. est âgé de 38 ans et  père de 2 enfants. Il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans une famille monogame dans le  quartier Hérémakono Nord de Bougouni troisième région administrative de la république du Mali.
N’ayant pas fréquenté le système scolaire pour des raisons sociales, Monsieur Adama D. a tenté plusieurs activités économiques notamment, la vente des habits , des chaussures, des tasses etc, mais sans succès. Alors décida de s’initier à l’achat vente d’articles divers de boutique. Nanti de 2 ans d’expériences dans cette activité, il maitrise bien  les tenant et aboutissant du commerce général, qu’il a appris auprès de son grand frère.
 Pour améliorer son activité, Monsieur Adama D. décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter des articles divers pour sa boutique. Il est à son deuxième prêt individuel, après avoir remboursé par anticipation le premier prêt.  Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali.) auprès des grossistes et vend en détail, au comptant et à crédit dans sa boutique à une clientèle  composée de la population locale.
 Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Adama D. compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 52 500 FCFA qi servira à  agrandir sa boutique et à assurer certaines dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Adama D. is 38 years old and the father of two children. He lives with his wife and children in a monogamous household in the neighborhood of Hérémakono, north of Bougouni in the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali. Adama could not attend school for social reasons. He tried several business activities, notably trading in clothes, shoes and cups, but without success. Then he decided to learn about trading in sundries. His elder brother taught him the ins and outs of a general store, and now he has two years of experience in this activity. To improve his business, Adama decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso to buy various items for his store. This is his second individual loan, after having paid off his first loan in advance. He gets his supplies from wholesalers in Bamako, the capital city of the Republic of Mali, and sells retail (cash and credit) to customers living in his neighborhood. With this loan, Adama expects to make a profit of 52,500 CFA francs (US$117) a month, which he will use to expand his store and provide for some needs of his family.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various items for his store

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua is forty – nine years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, three sons and two daughters who are all still in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. Akua lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a trader. She runs a cold store business.  She supplies to food vendors and chop bar operators in her community. Akua procures the goods from nearby towns. She has been in business for fifteen years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Ousmane D. est âgé de 26 ans et vit dans une famille monogame avec ses 2 enfants et sa femme  dans le  quartier Torakabougou  de la  ville de Bougouni,  troisième région administrative de la république du Mali.
N’ayant pas fréquenté le système scolaire pour des raisons familiales, très vite il commença les activités économiques notamment la vente d’articles divers au niveau d’une boutique. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son père qui fut un commerçant.
 Avec une expérience de 6 ans, Ousmane D. maîtrise son activité et est très sollicité par une clientèle de tout genre.
Afin  d’agrandir sa boutique, Monsieur Ousmane D. décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso  avec qui il est à son premier  prêt qui sera utilisé pour acheter des articles divers pour sa boutique.
Il s’approvisionne à Bamako(capitale de la république du Mali) auprès des grossistes et effectue sa vente dans sa boutique sise à Torokabougou, son quartier de résidence.
 Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Ousmane D. compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 42 500 FCFA. 
Avec ce bénéfice il envisage de commencer la construction sa maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
Ousmane D. is 26 years old and lives in a monogamous family with his two children and his wife in the neighborhood of Torakabougou in the city of Bougouni, third administrative region of the Republic of Mali. Ousmane could not attend school for family reasons. He started trading at a very young age, notably selling sundries in his store. He learnt his business skills from his father, who was also a trader. Now, with his six years of experience, Ousmane masters his trade and serves a large diversified clientele. To expand his store, Ousmane decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso to be granted his first loan. He will use it to buy various articles for his store. He gets his supplies from wholesalers in Bamako, the capital city of the Republic of Mali, and sells retail in his store located in his neighborhood of Torakabougou. With this loan, Ousmane expects to make a profit of 42,500 CFA francs (US$95) a month, which he will use to begin the construction of his house for residential use.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various articles for his store

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 54, married and has a son and a daughter who are both in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. They live in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. Esther is a trader. She trades in secondhand textiles – clothes for unisex, bed sheets, etc. She hawks and treks to sell in other communities. She procures bales of secondhand textiles from Accra. Esther has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy secondhand textiles

loans.name: Gie Pakao Group

texts.fr: Nous venons pour la première fois solliciter un prêt dans votre institution. Nous sommes un groupe de femmes qui habite une zone enclavée avec des difficultés pour y accéder. C'est d'ailleurs pourquoi nous n'avons jamais reçu de financement ou de prêt des institutions classiques qui opèrent dans notre zone. Seul le SEM nous a parlé de vous et de votre grandeur en acceptant de financer les villages reculés comme le nôtre. C'est pour cela que nous fondons espoir dans ce prêt qui va nous permettre de travailler et de sortir de la misère dans laquelle nous sommes restées si longtemps. Nous avons pourtant une réelle capacité de production qui ne demande qu'à être soutenu et nous sommes sur de nous en sortir la tête haute. Ce prêt nous permettra de nous équiper en marchandise dont les populations ont besoin et qu'elles trouvent difficilement, sinon à prix de sacrifices énormes vu l'enclavement de notre village.
texts.en:
For the first time, we've come to request a loan from your institution. We are a group of women who live in an isolated area with some access problems. Moreover, this is why we have never received financing or loans from the classic institutions that operate in our area. Only SEM has spoken of you and your grandeur in being willing to finance remote villages like ours. And so, our hopes are founded on this loan, which will enable us to work and to lift ourselves out of the poverty in which we've remained for so long. Yet we have a real production capacity that only requires some support, and we are sure of making it through with our heads held high. This loan will allow us to supply ourselves with merchandise that the people need and have trouble finding, in any case at an enormous sacrifice, given the isolation of our village.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food items and housewares

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To prepare and serve meals

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice sells provisions and food. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. She is 41, married and has 5 children. She has been in the business for the past 4 years. She is requesting a loan of N50, 000 to purchase more foodstuff and provisions to sell. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: du labour pour travailler le champ

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia is 40, married and has three sons and three daughters; all are in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. They live in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a trader. and runs a provision store. Her store is by the roadside in her community. Afia procures her raw materials from nearby towns at moderate prices. She has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy provision

loans.name: Mamary

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mamary C. est un célibataire de 30 ans qui vit chez ses parents dans une grande famille polygame dans le quartier Hérémakono-Nord de Bougouni.(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali)
Après les études secondaires avec comme spécialité la comptabilité, il est resté pendant des années sans emploi. Il a tenté plusieurs activités sans réussite et finit par décider de s’installer dans l’aviculture qu’il a appris auprès de son ami.
Avec une expérience de 2 ans  il maîtrise bien son activité. 
Dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires, Monsieur Mamary C. décide de rejoindre  Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter de la nourriture, des médicaments et des poussins pour préparer la relève des sujets en voie de vieillissement. Il est à son premier prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso.
Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni et à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali). Les œufs son vendus, au comptant, en détail et souvent en gros, au marché , à la maison à une clientèle de large gamme constituée de  propriétaires de boutiques, d’alimentations et de  restaurants sans oublier quelques consommateurs. 
Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Mamary C. compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 64 500 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour agrandir son entreprise.

loans.use: Achat de nourritures, médicaments et poussins.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en: Helena A. is married and has four children. She has received schooling through senior high.  Helena sells maize, she buys maize at the market and resells them at Elmina near Abreshia, which she has been doing since 2004. Her husband is a trade.  Helena uses her income to support the husband in the payment of fees.  Helena will use the loan to enable her buy more maize in big sacks to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Helena plans to save to educate her children.

loans.use: Helena will use the loan to enable her buy more maize in big sacks to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a warehouse and charcoal

loans.name: Funmi

texts.en: Funmi is 55 years old and she is a widow with six children. She sells provisions and foodstuffs. She hopes for the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 50, married and has four sons and two daughters who are all in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. they live in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. Mary is a trader who trades in secondhand textiles – clothes for unisex, bed sheets, etc. She hawks and treks to sell in other communities. She procures bales of secondhand textiles from Accra. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy secondhand textiles

loans.use: To supplement the sales of basic needs products.

loans.use: To support the harvest of cotton and corn.

loans.name: Keji

texts.en: Keji O. has a poultry farm and a fish pond where she rears birds and fish to make a living. She is 39 years old and married with 5 children. Keji hopes for the loan amount of N140, 000 to purchase poultry feeds and fingerlings. She is indeed grateful to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry feeds and fingerlings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana A. sells both fresh fish and smoked fish. She goes to the shore, buys from the fishermen, sells some fish while it's fresh, and smokes some to sell in El Mina near Abreshia.  Nana has received a senior high school education.  She is married and has six dependents. Her husband is a farmer. Nana has been selling fish since 1971. She helps her husband pay their fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more fish for to process and sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Growing sweet potatoes

loans.name: Gie Djinany Group

texts.fr: Nous sommes dans un écovillage qui est sur une route passante et qui peut nous permettre de développer une activité commerciale très lucrative. Nous sommes situées sur la route nationale qui relie la région sud et le nord. Donc nous sommes venues solliciter ce prêt pour pouvoir disposer d'un fonds suffisant qui nous permet de pouvoir acheter à grande quantité des produits transformés dans les villages avoisinant pour les revendre au passagers qui empruntent tous les jours la route nationale pour se rendre dans les différentes villes du pays.Cette activité va nous aider à soutenir nos familles et nos enfants dans leur scolarité et les soins;
texts.en:
We are in an eco-village on a busy road and that would allow us to develop a very lucrative business. We are located on the main highway linking the south to the north. And so we’ve come to requesting this loan to have at our disposal sufficient funds allowing us to buy a large quantity of processed goods from the neighboring villages in order to resell to travelers, who follow the main highway every day to go to different cities in the country. This business will help us to support our families and our children in their schooling and medical treatments.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and market seafood and forest products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow corn and peanuts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Culture des arachides

loans.name: Hae Bofo Group

texts.en: Mary is 55, divorced and has three children. She works very hard to be able to provide for the family. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. Mary is a trader and the leader of a trust bank group called “Hae Bofo”, which literally means creator of light. The members in this group are mainly engaged in trading activities. They normally sell in their community market and trek to sell in other communities as well. They procure their stocks from Accra and nearby towns. The experience these traders have amassed over the years has given them the urge to expand their business scope, hence the need for the loan to buy goods in bulk to realize this dream. The group leader, Mary, is on the left in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Gbemisola

texts.en: Gbemisola is 44 years old and married with four children. She has a grocery store where she sells provisions like noodles, toothpaste, detergent, etc. Gbemisola hopes for the loan amount of N120, 000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To ensure schooling costs are covered for his children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow yams

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock up on fish

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina is forty – six years old. She is divorced and has given birth to two children, a son and a daughter who are both in school. She works very hard to be able to provide for the family. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. Georgina is a trader. She runs a provision store. Her store is by the road side in her community. She procures her goods from nearby towns at moderate prices. Georgina has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy provision

loans.name: Gie Kégnéto Group

texts.fr: Nous sommes des habitants d'un village de producteurs de fruits et légumes. C'est pour cela que nous sommes venus solliciter un prêt prêt pour nous lancer dans la production maraîchère qui est une activité que nous avons toujours mené dans notre écovillage. Nous savons que nous pouvons produire beaucoup de légumes si nous bénéficions de soutien et d'appui. C'est la raison pour la quelle nous sommes venus solliciter auprès de votre institution un prêt, afin de pouvoir acheter des intrants avec du matériel de jardinage pour que nous puissions nous atteler au travail dès la fin de l'hivernage. Nous sommes conscient que cette activité peut être très rentable pour nous et aussi pour les populations locales.
texts.en:
We are residents of a village of fruit and vegetable producers. This is why we’ve come to request a loan for launching our market-gardening production, which is work that we’ve always managed in our eco-village. We know we can produce a lot of vegetables if we were to obtain backing and support. These are the reasons behind our loan application with your institution, so that we can buy fertilizers, along with supplies and equipment, for gardening. We could then really tackle our work as soon as winter is over. We are conscious of the fact that this business can be very profitable for us and also for local populations.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and equipment plus fertilizers for market gardening

loans.name: Remember Me #1 Group

texts.en:
Remember Me #1 is a group of 5 borrowers, led by Mamakor F., living in Kolahu, Lofa County, Liberia.  Mamakor is 31, married, and has two children, ages 5 to 8; both are in school.  Mamaker also cares for 2 children orphaned in the war.  Mamakor  was unable to attend school although she enjoyed it, because the cultural norm was for girls to rely on their husbands to provide, and therefore school was considered unnecessary.  She lives in remote Kolahu city in rural Lofa county, the breadbasket of Liberia. 

Mamakor’s business is retail clothing, including slippers, shirts, pants, etc which she buys wholesale from nearby Guinea and sells in a temporary market stall alongside approximately 100 other vendors of various trades.  She has run her business for 6 years and is successful because her customers like her personality and work ethic.  She’s taking the loan to increase her inventory of slippers and pants, which sell well in the rainy season.  Her dream is to grow her business so she can one day have the biggest table in the market.  With the profits from her business Mamakor dreams of building her own house.

loans.use: Purchase inventory of slippers and pants

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is forty – four years old. She is widowed and has given birth to two children, a son and a daughter who are both in school. She works very hard to be able to provide for the family. Abena lives with her children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a trader. She runs a provision store. Her store is by the road side in her community. Abena procures her raw materials from nearby towns at moderate prices. She has been in business for twelve years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy provision

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: stockage du mais

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy some manure

loans.name: Try And See #1 Group

texts.en:
Try and See #1 is a group of 5 borrowers, led by Musu F., living in Kolahu, Lofa County, Liberia.  Musu is 38, married and has 4 children, ages 2-10.  All of her children are in school.  Musu also cares for her niece who was orphaned in the war.  Musu  was unable to attend school although she enjoyed it, because the cultural norm was for girls to rely on their husbands to provide, and therefore school was considered unnecessary.  She lives in remote Kolahu city in rural Lofa county, the breadbasket of Liberia. 

Musu’s business is a cookshop, a form of fast-food roadside café for workers in the fields and other general laborers.  She has run her business for 10 years and is successful because her customers like her personality and work ethic – she stays open long hours for them – and the way she prepares the food.  She’s taking the loan to increase her food stores of rice, oil, and meat to meet the demand of the growing economy.  Her dream is to grow her business so she can one day have a real restaurant in town.  With the profits from her business Musu dreams of building her own house and sending her kids to college.

loans.use: To increase foodstores of rice, oil, and meet

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Storage of corn

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es:
Brígida está casada, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace un año tiene un restaurante de comida oriental, puesto que después de más de 10 años de experiencia en diversos negocios, ha decidido que ésta es la mejor opción para generarse mejores recursos económicos. Para ello, todos los días su esposo y sus hijos la apoyan en la atención de establecimiento, mientras ella prepara los alimentos, combinado finamente los ingredientes adecuados a fin de que los platos sean exquisitos. Ahora Brígida ha decidido implementar y mejorar la decoración de su local; por otro lado, su deseo a futuro es tener un restaurante campestre para que ofrezca sus comidas a los turistas. 
Esta es la segunda vez que  está solicitando un préstamo con MFP y se siente muy a gusto de ser parte de su banco comunal porque le permite tener ahorros. El dinero que ahora viene solicitando será destinado a la compra de utensilios para su restaurante, además de manteles nuevos e ingredientes (arroz y condimentos) en grandes cantidades.
texts.en:
Brígida lives with her husband and their children in her own house. She has had an oriental food restaurant for one year. After having over ten years of experience in various businesses, she decided that her restaurant was the best choice to generate income. Everyday her husband and children help her take care of the establishment while she prepares the food. She carefully combines the ingredients to make her dishes exquisite. Now Brígida has decided to set up and improve the decoration of her business. Her future wish is to have a countryside restaurant so that she could sell her food to the tourists. This is the second time she has asked for a loan from MFP. She feels very good being a part of her community bank because it allows her to have savings. The money she is now asking for is to buy utensils for her restaurant. She will also buy new tablecloths and ingredients (rice and condiments) in large quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy utensils and ingredients for her food

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys tiene 39 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en la casa de su padres. Desde hace 6 años elabora panes en el horno artesanal de la familia, todas las tardes se encarga de amasar y coser los panes para que después, por la noche y madrugada, los venda ambulatoriamente en las principales avenidas de su ciudad. De esta manera, trabaja incansablemente a fin de obtener las ganancias que compensen su arduo esfuerzo, así como el de sus hijos y familiares, quienes también trabajan en esta tarea. Gladys desea para su futuro tener un horno panadero industrial, donde pueda elaborar pasteles y otras variedades de panes para extender sus posibilidades de venta. Este es su 9no préstamo con MFP, ella es una de las personas más activas de su banco comunal y se siente muy contenta de ser parte de ese grupo. El dinero que ahora solicita será invertido en la compra de harina, al por mayor, para seguir produciendo más panes.
texts.en:
Gladys is 39 years old, and lives with her two children in her parent's house. For 6 years she has baked bread in her family's traditional wood-fired oven. Each afternoon, she is in charge of kneading and forming the breads so that later, during the night and dawn, they can be sold on the streets of her city. In this manner, she works tirelessly in order to obtain the earnings that compensate her arduous work as well as that of her children and other family members who also work in this business. Gladys would like to have an industrial oven in the future, with which she could bake cakes and other varieties of breads to increase her potential sales. This will be her 9th loan from MFP, she is one of the most active persons in her communal bank, and she feels very content to be a part of this group. The loan that she is requesting now will be used to purchase flour wholesale, so that she can continue producing bread.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy ingredients to use in the baking of bread

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina tiene 32 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en una casa arrendada. Desde hace un año y medio tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, donde ofrece los productos básicos comestibles y debido a la buena ubicación de su establecimiento sus ventas se mantienen estables. Adicionalmente, por la mañana, Karina es profesora de una escuela de su localidad, por lo que contrata a una persona para que atienda su tienda, pero por la tarde ella se  encarga personalmente. A pesar de las dificultades de su tiempo limitado con su profesión y la atención de sus hijos, ella continúa con su trabajo porque desea mejorar la situación económica de su familia, pues sus intenciones son de implementar su negocio con otros productos no comestibles requeridos por sus vecinos; como útiles de escritorio, diversos adornos, etc. 
Esta es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito con MFP, por lo que menciona que ser parte de un banco comunal le ha permitido crecer como persona conociendo del trabajo en grupo. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra de mercadería en bebidas gaseosas y abarrotes por sacos.
texts.en:
Katrina, 32, lives with her husband and their two children in a rented house. She has had a grocery store in her house for one and a half years. She sells basic food products. Due to the good location of her establishment, her sales remain stable. Also, in the mornings Katrina works as a teacher at a school in her town. Therefore, she hires someone to work at the store, but in the afternoons she personally runs the store. In spite of the difficulties of her limited time in her profession and taking care of her children, she continues with her work because she wants to improve the family’s economic situation. Her intentions are to set up her store with other non-food products like desk supplies and different decorations, etc. that her neighbors need. This is the fourth time she has asked for a loan with MFP. Being part of a community bank has allowed her to grow as a person knowing how to work in a group. She will use the money she is asking for to buy merchandise like soft drinks and sacks of groceries.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Serious Business People Group

texts.en:
Serious Business People is a group of 5 borrowers, led by Famata A., living in Kolahu, Lofa County, Liberia.  Famata is 43, married and has 3 children, from newborn to  3.  Famata was unable to attend school although she enjoyed it, because the cultural norm was for girls to rely on their husbands to provide, and therefore school was considered unnecessary.  She lives in remote Kolahu city in rural Lofa county, the breadbasket of Liberia. 

Famata’s business is retail dry goods, including biscuits, salt, maggi cubes (soup product), and macaroni, which she buys wholesale from nearby Guinea and sells in a temporary market stall alongside approximately 100 other vendors of various trades.  She has run her business for 3 years and is successful because her customers like her personality and work ethic.  She’s taking the loan to increase her inventory of things that sell well in the rainy season.  Her dream is to grow her business so she can one day have the biggest table in the market.  With the profits from her business Famata dreams of building her own house.

loans.use: Purchase biscuits, salt, and maggi cubes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat de poisson

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: growing corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: du labour et des engrais

loans.name: Xenia

texts.es: Xenia tiene 34 años, vive en la casa de sus padres, con ellos y sus sobrinos. Desde hace más de 3 años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y joyas a sus compañeras de trabajo, pues ella es profesora en una escuela de su localidad. Con sus clientes, Xenia pacta un acuerdo de pago al crédito y según lo convenido, ella les entrega el producto y posteriormente les cobra. De este modo, aparte de su remuneración como docente, obtiene las ganancias que necesita para  solventar sus gastos personales y de su familia. Su deseo a futuro es seguir dedicándose a la venta de cosméticos, pero en un local estable con una decoración atractiva y en una zona comercial de su ciudad. Esta es la quinta vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es una de las integrantes que promueve la responsabilidad en su banco comunal y esta vez renueva su compromiso de trabajo y puntualidad en sus pagos. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra de  productos de belleza para incrementar sus ventas.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth es una mujer muy trabajadora y amorosa. Vive en su casa propia, la cual comparte con sus hijos y nietos, a quienes tiene un gran cariño, y lo que más desea es vivir una vida en armonía y en unión con todos los miembros de su familia. Desde hace 20 años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, actividad que realiza junto a un grupo de amigas que incorporó para incrementar sus ventas y llegar a diversos lugares de su distrito, lo cual hace rentable su actividad económica y le da la oportunidad de ganar premios dentro de la empresa de belleza como una de las mejores vendedoras. Lo que le agrada de su trabajo es vender y mientras pueda hacerlo seguirá visitando a sus clientes, aunque las deudas de algunos de ellos la perjudiquen en algunos momentos, pero logra superar esas dificultades. De esta forma viene trabajando para lograr sus más ansiados deseos de adquirir un local o un puesto en el mercado de su localidad para ofertar los productos de belleza que tiene en stock y sobre todo de tener un espacio propicio para realizar sus ventas y tener contacto frecuente con sus clientes. Ella es una de las líderes de su banco comunal, este sería su crédito 29 con Microfinanzas PRISMA y en todo este tiempo se ha ganado la amistad de sus compañeras, a quienes les contagia sus ganas de progresar. Con los tres mil soles que solicita comprará más productos de belleza para aumentar su mercadería.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a very hard working and loving woman. She lives in her own house, which she shares with her children and grandchildren for whom she has great affection. What she wishes for the most is to live a life in harmony and union with all of the members of her family. She has been selling cosmetics for 20 years. She does this with a group of friends who joined together to increase their sales and go to different places in her district. This makes her business profitable and gives her the chance to win prizes like being one of the best sellers within the beauty company. What she likes about her work is selling. While she is still able to do so, she will continue visiting her customers. Although the debts of some of her customers are sometimes detrimental, she has been able to overcome these difficulties. She works in this manner to achieve her most yearned for wish, which is to get a location or stall in a market in her town. That is where she would sell the beauty products she has in stock. Above all, she wants to have a space of her own to make her sales and have frequent contact with her customers. She is one of the leaders in her community bank. This will be her 29th loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. In all of this time she has gained the friendship of her colleagues; she infects them with her desire to progress. She will use the 3,000 PEN she is asking for to buy more beauty products to increase her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Raquel Armanda

texts.es: Este prestamo se utilizará para surtir el negocio de frutas y verduras que tiene en el mercado y para la compra de más medicina natural.

loans.use: Surtir más su negocio de verduras y de venta de medicina natural

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda tiene 34 años, su carisma y buen humor le dieron L. oportunidad de trabajar, y así brindar a su esposo y a sus dos hijos el apoyo económico que requerían dentro de casa. L. costura es una actividad que le apasiona y L. cual realiza hace más de 15 años, tiempo en que su madre le viene enseñando diversas formas y diseños de prendas Sin embargo, Hilda nació con una gran habilidad en las manos y siempre presenta nuevos modelos de prendas, los cuales son solicitadas por sus clientes muy a menudo. Lo beneficioso de esta actividad es que también invierte en L. compra de lanas para luego venderlas a precios que duplican su capital, pero lo que más le agrada de su trabajo son las bordados que realiza, a pesar de las consecuencias que podría presentar en su visión durante el tiempo, pues necesita de gran precisión para realizarlos. Pero sus ganas de progresar L. motivan a mejorar el taller que está implementando y que a futuro será el lugar donde trabaje junto a un grupo de colaboradores.
Hilda ya tiene 29 préstamos en Microfinanzas PRISMA  y eso muestra su grado de compromiso con su banco comunal, del cual no desea salir, pues tiene presente que es una muy buena alternativa de desarrollo. Los 2800 soles que solicita los invertirá en L. compra de lanas e hilos para continuar tejiendo sus sueños.

loans.use: Compra de material textil

loans.name: Yisela

texts.es: Yisela tiene 40 años, es una mujer muy alegre y emprendedora. Vive en la casa de sus padres en compañía de su pareja y su pequeña hija de 10 años, por quien trabaja con esmero para darles una vida cómoda y feliz. Su trabajo como vendedora de ropa lo realiza en las calles de su ciudad todas las mañanas a partir de las 9, hora que sale de casa con la esperanza de obtener las ganancias necesarias. Para lograrlo, no sólo ofrece prendas de calidad, sino que también una gran sonrisa; actitud que agrada mucho a las personas quienes se contagian de su buen ánimo. Lo que más le agrada de su trabajo es la venta de ropa para niños, pues los pequeños son muy exigentes y la animan a mejorar la calidad de su mercadería. En los 5 años que lleva trabajando, considera que  permanecer de pie y caminar largas cuadras para vender es lo más difícil de su negocio. Sus planes a futuro son de invertir en la compra de un puesto estable donde venda diversas prendas especialmente para niños. Yisela viene trabajando 29 créditos con Microfinanzas PRISMA y en todos estos años ha demostrado ser una persona cumplida en sus pagos y querida dentro de su banco comunal, donde le tienen una gran estima. Con los 1400 soles que solicita podrá adquirir la mercadería necesaria para la nueva temporada que se avizora.
texts.en:
Yisela, 40, is a very happy and enterprising woman. She lives in her parents’ house with her significant other and her ten year old daughter. She works with such effort in order to give them a comfortable and happy life. She works selling clothes on the streets of the city every morning. She leaves home at nine with the hope of getting the needed income. To do this, she not only offers quality items of clothing, but she also offers a big smile. This attitude pleases a lot of people, and her good mood is contagious. What she likes most about her work is selling children’s clothes. The little ones are very demanding, and they encourage her to improve the quality of her merchandise. In the five years she has been working, she considers being on foot all day and walking long blocks to sell is the most difficult part of her business. Her future plans are to buy a stable stall where she can sell different articles of clothing, especially for children. Yisela has worked with 29 loans from Microfinanzas PRISMA. In all of those years she has shown herself to be a person who makes her payments. She is well liked within her community bank, where they hold her in high esteem. She will use the 1,400 PEN that she is asking for to buy the merchandise she needs for the new season that is approaching.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Tahir
