texts.en: For 12 years, Tahir A. has dedicated himself to raising cattle to support his humble and reliant family. It’s important to note that the granting of this loan will not only benefit him but also his dearest parents. The agriculture business is labor intensive and demanding because it requires sun exposure, the physical exertion of moving animals, as well as the work it takes to tend to various crops. Tahir has turned to AqroInvest Credit Union for a loan of 2000 USD to purchase calves to raise.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer for the crop

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba N. is a widow with five dependents. She has no education. Aba has been selling palm oil, gari (fried cassava), and groundnuts at Elmina near Ntenman since 1989.  Aba uses her income to pay school fees and general expenses of the family. Aba will use the loan to purchase more palm nuts for oils and gari. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more of the seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Crisanto

texts.es:
A sus 58 años, Crisanto viene trabajando muy duro, vive con su esposa y sus 5 hijos en su casa propia. Su hijo mayor ya vive fuera, independientemente. Él es agricultor, y mientras sus operarios cosechan la papa, su esposa cose los sacos, él los transporta en sus burros hasta su casa, a una distancia de 40 minutos de camino. Posteriormente, todos los miércoles a las 4 de la mañana se ubica en una de las esquinas del mercado de mayorista de Tarma para su comercialización. En este mercado todos los años  negocia sus cosechas, reuniendo buen dinero y aunque tiene dificultades cuando bajan los precios, Crisanto no se desanima, por lo contrario, es un reto, pues alterna sus siembras de papa con las de olluco, ya que algunas temporadas vendió este otro producto al triple de su precio. Por ello alegremente trabaja con ambos, ya que gracias a sus cultivos pudo educar a todos sus hijos.
Siendo éste su décimo préstamo con MFP, se siente con la misma responsabilidad de pagar todas sus cuotas oportunamente, como cuando tuvo sus primeros créditos. Para ello, cada cosecha guarda dinero y a veces prefiere pre cancelar porque no quiere perjudicar a su banco comunal, al que estima mucho. Crisanto utilizará el dinero que solicita en el preparado de su chacra y en la compra de fertilizantes químicos.

loans.use: Compra de fertilizantes

loans.name: Maïmouna

texts.fr: Maïmouna D., 57 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants en charge est membre du Banc Villageois de BELFORT depuis 7 ans et demis. C'est une femme très dynamique et très travailleuse. Elle a bénéficié de 15 prêts au niveau de son Banc Villageois et les a toujours remboursés sans problème. Avec son crédit elle commercialise du miel et de l'huile de palme. Les bénéfices qui découlent de son activité lui permettent de participer aux dépenses quotidiennes et soins médicaux de la famille et d'assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.

loans.use: Renforcer son activité de commerce

loans.name: Sakhavat

texts.en:
Sakhavat J. is 58 years old, is married, and has three children. He has devoted his life to agricultural work and on market days he brings his products to the market.

The harvest is what Sakhavat enjoys the most and he devotes a lot of time to sorting the different crops, such as fruits and vegetables, that he will sell because the price will depend on their size and quality. Agriculture is full of satisfaction for him and his family - even more when the produce sells for a good price at the market. That is his motivation to continue planting. With this loan of  $2000 USD he will buy seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants for his farm.

Sakhavat is very grateful to those who support him because they allow him to provide well-being to his family.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Elvia

texts.es:
Elvia es una madre muy responsable de 36 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su pareja y sus 3 hijos. Ella se dedica diariamente al pastoreo de sus 200 ovejas, labor ardua, pero a la vez le gusta y es muy gratificante, ya que cada semana o quince días vende entre 4 ó 6 ovejas entre 80 y 120 soles, según el tamaño y si es macho el precio es mayor. Para ello, los compradores van hasta su casa para escoger al animal que necesiten. Por otro lado, su esposo reúne el guano de estos animales para utilizarlo en sus chacras de papa y olluco, y debido al uso de abono natural, sus productos son muy demandados, pues son más agradables. Es por ello que Elvia y su esposo trabajan muy contentos con sus labores agrícolas y ganaderas.
El deseo de esta trabajadora madre es de seguir trabajando con su banco comunal, es por ello que incursiona en su décimo préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA. Para lo cual, el dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de algunos insumos químicos para sus cultivos de papa, también comprará carneros machos para mejorar la raza de sus animales
texts.en:
Elvia is a very responsible mother, 36 years old, who lives in her own home together with her husband and their three children. She spends each day taking care of their flock of 200 sheep. This is arduous work, but she finds it enjoyable and very satisfying, because every week or two she is able to sell 4 to 6 sheep for 80 to 120 soles, depending on the animals' size and sex (males sell for a higher price). For these transactions, buyers come to her home and choose the animal they want. Her husband also collects the animals' droppings and uses them on their small farm, where they grow potatoes and ulluco [a root vegetable]. Thanks to the use of this natural fertilizer, their products taste better and therefore are in great demand. Because of all this, Elvia and her husband are very happy with their work in farming and ranching. The desire of this hard-working mother is to continue working with her communal bank, and thus she is entering into her tenth loan with the PRISMA microfinance organization. With the funds she is requesting, she will buy some chemical supplies for the potato farm, and she will also buy rams to raise the quality of her livestock.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies and breeding rams

loans.name: Agababa

texts.en: Agababa A.  is very demanding in his work, having been a farmer since childhood. Today, as a head of household, he works tirelessly to generate a stable income to provide adequate living conditions for his five children and his wife. He works caring for his animals, getting up very early to gather grasses so he can keep his livestock well-fed. Agababa sells both the milk they produce, as well as their meat. He is seeking this current loan for the purchase of additional cows for expanding his business. Please help support Agababa’s efforts so he can continue to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase four cattle

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es:
Fidel es un alegre padre de 26 años, actualmente vive con su pareja y madre de su único hijo, en  la casa de sus padres. Él heredó unas chacras temporales (según tiempo de lluvia) en su pueblo, pero sólo produce papas y ollucos una vez al año, por lo tanto decidió sembrar más papa en el pueblo de su esposa (a 2 horas en auto) por ser terrenos de regadío y puede generarse mayores ingresos. Precisamente durante los ajetreos de su última cosecha sufrió un accidente automovilístico, sin lamentables consecuencias; aun así, al día siguiente terminó de cosechar. Fidel comercializa sus productos ubicándose a un costado del mercado mayorista de la ciudad, donde en un lapso de dos horas logra vender todo su producto y se va muy contento, con su dinero, a casa. Ahora Fidel confía que sembrando en las chacras de su esposa y en las suyas, su economía va a mejorar mucho y eso lo entusiasma para seguir esforzándose en su labor como agricultor.
Este es su décimo préstamo con MFP y aun más que en los anteriores, tiene anhelos de prosperar y crecer mediante sus cultivos, por eso recurre a un crédito y al apoyo de su banco comunal. Por lo que el dinero que solicita lo piensa utilizar en la compra de insumos químicos para su próxima siembra de papas.
texts.en:
Fidel is a happy 26 year old father, currently living with his wife and their only son in his parents' house. He inherited some seasonal farm plots (depending on the rainy season) in his village, but they only produce potatoes and ollucos once a year. Because of this, he decided to plant more potatoes in his wife's town (2 hours away by car) since it is irrigated land and he can generate higher earnings. Right in the middle of the busy spell of his last harvest he suffered a car accident. It was not very grave, but he was still able to finish harvesting the following day. Fidel sells his products next to the city's wholesale market, where, in a span of two hours, he can sell all his produce and return home very happily with his money. Now Fidel trusts that farming his wife's land and his own will greatly improve his economic status and this encourages him to keep putting forth effort at his job as a farmer.

This is his tenth loan with MFP and now he has an even greater desire to prosper and grow through his harvests. For this reason he is turning to a loan and the support of his community bank. He plans to use the money to buy chemicals for his next potato crop.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chemicals for his farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farm supplies for crop

loans.name: Tania Escarlet

texts.es: La joven Tania F. de 22 años de edad, reside en Ciudad Sandino en la capital de Managua, casada y con una linda bebe de 7meses. Tiene una pulpería que inicio con liquidación de su trabajo anterior, laboraba en una joyería pero por las ventas bajas se hizo recorte de personal. Fue que pensó en poner su propio negocio lo cual le seria mas beneficioso ya que podría cuidar a su bebe y no tener que pagar a terceras personas. Sus planes es mejorar la infraestructura de su casa, incrementar las ventas, es por eso con este préstamo invertirá en la compra de granos básicos, carnes, productos lácteos, golosinas y otros productos que le generen mayores ganancias. Da las gracias Afodenic por la oportunidad mediante este financiamiento lo cual será de mucho beneficio por que lograra captar clientes nuevos y mantener su clientela con las ventas surtida.
texts.en:
Young Tania F. is 22 years old and lives in Sandino City in the capital of Managua; she is married with a beautiful seven-month-old baby. She owns a neighborhood store that she opened with the severance pay from her previous job, working in a jewelry store that downsized due to low sales. Starting her own business just seemed like the best idea, since she could care for her baby and not have to pay a third party to do so. Her plan is to improve the infrastructure of her house and increase sales. For this reason, she will invest this loan in the purchase of staple grains, meat, dairy products, candy, and other products that will generate more revenue. She thanks AFODENIC for this opportunity, which provides financing that will be of great assistance in meeting her goals of attracting new customers and retaining her clientele with the items stocked.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy staple grains, candy, and dairy products

loans.name: Natiq

texts.en: Natiq K. is 43 years old. He is married and the father of 2 children. Natiq is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and to educate his children. Natiq is an enterprising man who constantly tries to do things better and to improve, day after day. He works hard in his fields, where he spends as much time as possible providing the necessary care, fertilizing his land and spraying to prevent the diseases that might affect his yields. Natiq needs seeds and fertilizers to continue his difficult work, tending his crops, so that they can be taken to the capital for sale. This is why he's applying for a loan of 2000 USD. Let's be the ones who reach out our hands to help Natiq

loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Jilmer

texts.es:
Jilmer tiene 29 años, vive con su pareja y madre de su hijo. Por el momento habitan en la casa de sus suegros. Desde pequeño se dedica a la siembra de papa de diversas  variedades, pero la papa llamada “de color” es su preferida, pues le resulta más rentable porque logra vender cada saco entre 70 y 80 soles, mientras que las papas “blancas”, aunque tengan buen tamaño se valorizan a sólo 30 soles por saco. Pero la debilidad de la papa de color es que es muy delicada en el proceso de su desarrollo y debido a las heladas (clima muy frío) pueden sufrir pérdidas. Sin embargo, esta temporada Jilmer  está muy contento, pues la temida helada no afectó sus papas, las cuales se desarrollaron de gran tamaño, para ello alquiló burros de carga para transportar sus sacos desde los cerros empinados donde las sembró. Una vez reunidas en su casa las lleva al mercado mayorista de la ciudad (al más concurrido), donde demoran algo más de 2 horas en terminar de venderlas y con esas ganancias puede solventar las necesidades de su familia. 
Para Jilmer, este es su décimo préstamo con MFP y debido a que aun no llega la temporada de siembra, no tiene necesidad de una mayor inversión, pero él no quiere dejar de ahorrar en su banco comunal, por lo que solicita una pequeña cantidad de dinero, con el que aprovechará en comprar un burro de carga.
texts.en:
Jilmer is 29 years old and lives with his partner, his son’s mother. For the time being they live with his in-laws. Ever since he was little, Jilmer has grown several varieties of potatoes. The potato called “de color” is his favorite and is profitable because it sells at 70 to 80 soles per sack, while the white potatoes, even though they are big; only sell for 30 a sack. But the problem with the colored potatoes is that they are very sensitive while growing and can be easily lost when it freezes. However, this season, Jilmer is very happy because the cold season did not affect his potatoes and they grew big. He rented pack-donkeys to transport his sacks form the hills forested with pine trees where he grew them. Once they were home, he brought them to the busiest wholesale market in town where it took just over 2 hours to sell them. He is able to take care of his family’s needs with what he earned. This is Jilmer’s tenth loan with MFP. Since it is not time to plant yet, he doesn’t need a big loan, but he does not want to stop saving with his communal bank, so he’s asking for a small loan to buy a pack donkey with.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a pack donkey

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat de poisson

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou S., 56 ans est veuve et vit avec ses 3 enfants en charge. C'est une femme très dynamique et pleine de volonté. Depuis 8 ans elle est membre du Banc Villageois de BELFORT et y a bénéficié de 16 prêts qu'elle a remboursé toujours avec succès. Elle est vendeuse de légumes au marché et son crédit lui permet de faire la promotion de son activité et de se faire des bénéfices afin de pouvoir prendre en charge ses enfants.

loans.use: Renforcer son activité de commerce

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing fish

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Doña Maria Elena de 44 años de edad, casada, reside en el barrio Memorial Sandino en la capital Managua, con dos hijos de 13 y 15 años de edad, estudian en el colegio del barrio, su esposo trabaja en servicios de seguridad, sus planes  es poder terminar de construir su casa, ella laborar en un centro de comidas rápida en Tip Top pero su salario es bajo lo cual no ha podido realizar sus proyecto y lo ha logrado a través de préstamo que le ha financiado Afodenic, con esta préstamo comprara materiales de construcción para terminar de construir un cuarto en donde pueda gozar de mejores condiciones su familia. lo que mas desea es poder encontrar otro trabajo donde tenga mejores ingresos ya que la canasta alimenticia esta cara, y no suben el salario lo que impide mejorar el nivel de vida. Da las gracias a la institución por hacer posible las mejoras a su vivienda.

loans.use: Comprar materiales de construccion para hacer cuartos

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort A. is single and has six dependants. She has received no educational background.  Comfort sells palm oil she goes to the market and buys palm nuts and process it into palm oil at Elmina near Ntsinman, which she has been doing since 2002. Comfort uses her income to pay school fees and settlement of utility bills.  Comfort will use the loan to purchase more palm nuts for oil and boxes of soap for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Comfort plans to save to educate her children.

loans.use: Comfort will use the loan to purchase more palm nuts for oil and boxes of soap for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy fabric to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Rodolfo De Jesus

texts.es: El señor Rodolfo de Jesús G. de 47 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador, se desempeña como guarda de seguridad desde hace ocho años, sus deseos es poder tener mejor salario para realizar mejores inversiones a su casa. Reside en el bario Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, su esposa tiene dos hijos de 14 y19 años de edad que estudian, su hijo mayor trabaja en la mac Donal y estudia en la universidad por la noche lo cual es de gran ayuda, ya que por falta económica muchos hijos no logran terminar de estudiar. Con este crédito  es su décimo ciclo en Afodenic y ha logrado hacer mejoras en su casa ya que es la única forma mediante el financiamiento. Con este crédito comprara materiales de construcción para hacer un aumento en el cuarto. Da las gracias a la institución por los beneficios logrados.
texts.en:
Mr. Rodolfo de Jesús Gaitanis is 47 years old and a hard worker. He has worked as a security guard for eight years. He would like to have a better salary so he can make greater improvements to his home. He lives in the Memorila Sandino neighborhood in the capital, Managua. They have two children, ages, 14 and 19, who are students. His eldest son works at MacDonalds (which is a tremendous help because many kids can’t finish school for economic reasons) and goes to college at night. This is his tenth loan with Afodenic and he has already been able to make several improvements to his home with these loans since they are the only way he could do it. He plans to buy building materials with this loan to build another bedroom. He is grateful for this institution and the benefits he has received.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase building materials to add a room

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina B. sells kenkey. She buys maize, processes it into dough, and wraps it in corn husk, boils it, and then sells at Elmina near Ntenman. Sabina has received a senior high school education. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a fitter. Sabina has been selling kenkey since 2000. She uses the profits from her business to pay her children's school fees and the family's utility bills. 

She will use her loan to buy palm oil, maize and palm nuts for kenkey. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest in her child’s education.

loans.use: To buy palm oil, maize and palm nuts for kenkey.

loans.name: Elsa Maria

texts.es: Doña Elsa Gomes de 66 años de edad, reside en el barrio Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, viuda y sus hijos son casados su negocio es una pequeña pulpería en donde vende variedad de productos, lleva ocho años administrando este negocio, pues gracias ahorros y con prestamos a logrado aumentar las ventas. Sus planes es poder terminar de hacer mejoras a su casa y seguir aumentado su inventario, es su tercer ciclo en Afodenic y comprara granos básicos, frutas, verduras para dar un buen servicio a sus clientes a si como la captación de nuevos clientes lo cual se beneficiara con las ganancias.
texts.en:
Ms. Elsa G. is 66 years old and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood in the capital, Managua. She is a widow with married children. She has a small store in the front of her house where she sells a variety of products. She has been running this business for eight years and thanks to her savings, and to loans, she has been able to increase her sales. She hopes to do some home improvement and continue to increase her inventory. This is her third loan with Afodenic. She will buy: basic grains, fruits, and vegetables to provide her customers with good service and hopes to get new customers. All of this will help her to increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of basic grains, fruits, and vegetables

loans.name: Sergyi

texts.en:
Sergyi is married and has two children. His family is an average Ukrainian family trying to survive in the midst of a difficult global financial situation. Sergyi is a small market vendor, and sells women’s outer clothing in the central marketplace in his home town of Belaya Tserkov. Sergyi has been in the trade for nine years. He has established good contacts with his suppliers, and he buys his inventory from Ukrainian manufacturers. This helps him keep his prices low and attract more customers. Sergyi currently has about 24,000 Grivnyas invested in his business.

Sergyi is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to restock his merchandise for the fall season, and his sales will increase as a result. He is very energetic and full of expansion ideas. Sergyi is very grateful for financial assistance which has become a helpful tool in his entrepreneurial endeavors.

loans.use: To purchase and restock merchandise

loans.name: Nijat

texts.en: Since he was very young, Nijat A. has dedicated himself to the raising of livestock. He is married. His wife also helps him with the business. Nijat needs to purchase calves. He raises the calves and then sells them to farmers, who then resupply the small livestock breeders with calves. To acquire the animals, Nijat has come to AqroInvest Credit Union for a loan to purchase the calves. In this way, he can continue to maintain his dear home.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Mirmehti

texts.en: Mirmehti R.  owns a small parcel of land. He is 53 years old and has two loving children. Mirmehti dreams of building a good life for his family. He wants his children to graduate college because this will allow them to find better jobs in the future. His wife is a teacher. Together, they work very hard to sustain their family. Mirmehti is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides because this will definitely help him improve his yield.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Sebastian De Jesus

texts.es: El señor Sebastián de 38 años de edad, casado, con residencia en el Reparto Shick en la capital de Managua, con cinco hijos que le tiene su esposa de 2,14,20,22 y uno de 4 meses. Su negocio es la venta de artesanía en donde vende una variedad de productos como: chapas, pulsera anillos, collares y mucho más, negocio que inicio con ahorros de su trabajo anterior ya que vendía en los eventos con la cervecería. Desde joven trabaja para apoyar a su familia ya que se caso a temprana edad, pero gracias a Dios ha sobresalido adelante, el vende ambulante se pone todos los días en una parada de buses es un lugar céntrico y le ayuda  a vender mucho ya que vende son productos bonitos y accesibles de precios y que muchos de los Nicaragüenses usamos. Con este préstamo  comprara, materia prima para elaborar sus productos y seguir vendiendo, lo cual espera captar clientes nuevos como seguir dando un buen servicio. Da las gracias a la institución por la oportunidad  de este financiamiento que es de mucha importancia para las familias nicaragüenses.

loans.use: Comprar materiales como: madeja, piedras preciosas, y  otros productos

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase four cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase more goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase more goods

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia D. is married and has one child. She has received senior high school education. Emilia makes and sells palm oil and palm kernel oil. She goes to the farmers to buy palm nuts and process them into oils at Elmina near Ntsinman, which she has been doing since 2006. Her husband is a petty trader.

Emilia uses her income to help her husband with the payment of fees and utility bills. Emilia will use the loan to purchase more palm fruit for her oil production. With the new profits from her expanded business, Emilia plans to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: purchase more palm fruit for her oil production

loans.name: Azad

texts.en:
Azad S. is a married man responsible for three children. For ten years, he has been selling basic foodstuffs in his grocery located in the central market. He began his business with 200 USD that he had saved over a long period of time. It is necessary to note that Azad is a strong and hard-working man. He knows how to respond to the call of being a father who supports his three children who study in elementary school.

Currently Azad is requesting a loan of 2000 USD. He is counting on your help and thanks all of you sincerely!

loans.use: purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase additional items to sell to increase income

loans.name: Fakhraddin

texts.en:
Fakhraddin A. has always been a hard-working man who has made sure from a young age that his family never went hungry. He is married with three children.

Fourteen years ago, and with a starting capital of only $100, Fakhraddin started a grocery store selling different kinds of foodstuffs. Thanks to his perseverance and dedication, his business has expanded and now his whole family is involved.

Today, Fakhraddin needs to increase the range of goods he sells. For this purpose he is requesting a loan of 2,000 USD. He is ready to work even harder and to make sacrifices to achieve his goal of becoming a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: To increase his range of goods

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A. is a widow and has six dependents. She has received a senior high school education.

Comfort sells palm oil. She buys palm fruit from the farmers and processes it into oil for sale at Elmina near Ntsinman, which she has been doing since 1999. Comfort uses her income to pay school fees and to settle utility bills.

Comfort will use the loan to buy more palm fruits for the making of palm oil. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more palms fruits for making palm oil

loans.name: Natiq

texts.en:
Natiq Q. is married with three children. He has always been a hard-working man who has made sure, from a young age, that his family never goes without their daily bread.

Natiq has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuffs. Thanks to his perseverance and dedication, he began this enterprise ten years ago with a starting capital of $200. Over time he expanded his business and now it has become domestic as his family helps him with the business.

Today, Natiq needs to buy additional foodstuffs to increase the range of his goods. For this purpose, he is requesting a loan of 2,000 USD. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Deylin Del Socorro

texts.es: Deylin de 28 años de edad es soltera, tiene 3 niños, labora como docente en el MINED de Santo Tomas desde hace 8 años, esta solicitando su 3er credito para seguir mejorando su vivienda, pues anteriormente ya habia sido beneficiada con el fondo KIVA, y ahora desea seguir contando con el mismo apoyo, pues desea cambiar el techo a su casa que se encuentra en mal estado y que con el credito anterior no logro cambiar, ademas si el credito lo permite pretende levantar una pared que esta en espera y acondicionar un cuarto y asi dar mayor comodidad a su familia.  El deseo de Deylin es seguir contando con el apoyo de AFODENIC y continuar mejorando su casa, pues es el patrimonio que dejara a sus hijos.

loans.use: Cambio de techo y levantar una pared

loans.name: Mildred Del Rosario

texts.es: Mildred es casada, tiene 39 años dee dad, labora en el Colegio Sna Francisco desde hace 22 años como maestra de primaria, cuenta con el apoyo de su marido quien asume los gastos del hogar, esta solicitando su credito Nº 7 para levantar 2 paredes, comprar zinc y perlines y brindar mejor comodidad al pequeño taller de motocicletas de su marido que tienen en el patio, pues actualmente es un pequeño cuartito forrado con tablas y zin en mal estado, y cuando llueve se le moja la mayoria de los equipos, los repuestos y otras piezas que cambia.  El mayor sueño de Mildred es seguir mejorando su casa para dar mejor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Mildred is 39 and married. She has worked in the San Francisco School for 22 years as a primary school teacher. She has support from her husband; he takes on the household expenses. She is asking for her seventh loan in order to raise two walls and buy zinc and beams. She wants to make her husband’s small motorcycle shop, which they have on the patio, more comfortable. It is currently a small room covered with boards and zinc, which is in bad condition. When it rains, most of the equipment, spare parts, and other pieces he changes get wet. Mildred’s biggest dream is to continue improving her house to make her family more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy zinc and beams

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es: Juan Ramon de 32 años de edad es casado, tiene 2 niños (una de 2 años y la otra de 9 años) trabaja como despachador de farmacia para el Hospital Asuncion de Juigalpa desde hace 9 años, habita en casa de sus padres, los que le han dado un cuarto para que viva con su familia, esta solicitando su 10mo credito para arreglarlo y darle mayor comodidad e independencia a su esposa e hijos, instalando el servicio de energia electrica y ademas levantando una pared para terminar un cuarto que desea anexar, cuenta con  la mayoria de los materiales, solo le falta comprar el cemento y la mano de obra para concluir la obra.  El mayor sueño de Juan Ramon es poder brindar comodidad a sus pequeños y a su esposa que trabaja como enfermera en el Hospital y que ademas lo apoya con los gastos y con este proyecto.
texts.en:
Juan Ramon is 32 years old, married, and has 2 daughters (one is 2 years old and the other 9). He has worked as a dispatcher at Hospital Asuncion de Juigalpa for 9 years. They live with his parents who have given him and his family a room to live in. He is asking for a loan so he can fix up their living space -- making it more comfortable for his wife and children. He wants to install electricity and build a wall for an additional room. He has most of the materials and only needs to buy cement and labor to finish the project. Juan’s greatest wish is to provide a comfortable space for his daughters and wife (who is a nurse in the same hospital and who helps out with expenses).

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a wall and install electricity

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris A. sells palm oil and soup at Elmina near Ntsinman. Doris has received vocational school education. She is married and has six dependants. Her husband is a teacher.

Doris has been selling palm oil and soup since 2004. She uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fess and utility bills.

Doris’s loan will be used to buy more palm nuts for oil and to prepare soup. She hopes to use the new profits from the business to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more palm nuts for oil and to prepare soup

loans.name: Oscar Manuel

texts.es: Oscar Manuel de 22 años es soltero, no tiene hijos, trabaja en el Hospital Asuncion de Juigalpa en el area de admision y archivo, vive en casa de su mamá quien es auxiliar de enfermera, su mamá logro construir su casa por medio de un proyecto con el INBUR, pero aun faltan algunos detalles para la seguridad de la casa, por lo que Oscar esta solicitando su primer credito con eldeseo apoyar a su mamá comprando los protectores de las ventanas y la puerta de hierro en la entrada, pues como en el dia la casa pasa sola desean asegurarla para que no lleguen los amigos de lo ajeno y se lleven las pocas cosas que con su trabajo han logrado obtener.  En el futuro desea seguir apoyando a su mamá y mejorar su casa en la medida de sus posibilidades.
texts.en:
Twenty-two-year-old Oscar Manuel is single and has no children. He works in admissions and records in the Juigalpa Hospital Asuncion. He lives in a house with his mother, who is a nurse's assistant. His mother built her house through an INBUR project, but the house still lacks some security items. Oscar is requesting his first loan from the desire to help his mother buy protection for the windows and the iron door of the entrance. The house is vacant during the day, and he wishes to secure it against thieves that would steal the few things that he has been able to obtain through his work. In the future, he wishes to continue helping his mother and improving her house as much as he possibly can.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install home security items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase more food goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase food stuff

loans.name: Luisa Yajaira

texts.es: Luisa Yajaira de 35 años es casada, tiene 2 niñas, una de 9 años estudiando la primaria y otra de 12 años en la secundaria, trababa en la Escuela Tierno Galvan como docente desde hace 17 años, cuenta con el apoyo de su marido quien asume con los gastos del hogar; esta solicitando su 7mo credito para la compra de 2 portones y ponerlos en la entrada del patio para brindar mayor seguridad a su familia, pues actualmente esta entrada esta cerrada con tablas que no son seguras.  El mayor sueño de Luisa es continuar mejorando su casa para darle mejores comodidades a sus hijas, pues es el patrimonio que tienen para dejarles.
texts.en:
Luisa Yajaira is 35 years old and married. She has two girls, one, 9 years old, who is studying in elementary school and the other, 12 years old, in secondary school. Luisa works in the Tierno Galvan School, where she has taught for 17 years. Her husband helps to pay the expenses of their home. She is requesting her seventh loan in order to buy two large doors and mount them at the entrance to her patio. The doors will make her home more secure; now this entrance is boarded up and is not secure. The biggest dream of Luisa is to continue improving her house and thereby give a more comfortable house to her girls, for this is the patrimony that they have to give them.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and installation of doors

loans.name: Cuestion De Fe Group

texts.es:
Virginia C. de 40 años, elabora pan desde hace 4 años, tiene su taller en su domicilio, donde tiene un pequeño horno y trabaja junto sus hijos. Todos los días se levanta a  las 3 de la mañana para embolsar su producto y llevar a diferentes pueblos  como Batallas, Vilaqui, Curva, en esta oportunidad necesita el préstamo para comprar azúcar.
Sandra M. de 21 años vende condimentos en la feria “16 de julio”, ella aprendió esta actividad  de su madre, viaja a Desaguadero  para comprar su mercadería  como el ají, comino y ajo.
Las demás integrantes también tienen su propio negocio como la venta de ropa, comida, costura de ropa y todas necesitan el préstamo para comprar materia prima (tela), insumos (azúcar, papa) y mercadería (faldas).

loans.use: COMPRA DE MATERIA PRIMA, MERCADERIA E INSUMOS

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary K. is married and has three children. She has received schooling through junior high school.  Mary sells bathroom slippers, underwear, plastic bowls ECT, and by hocking around Elmina, which he has been doing since2006. Her husband is a carpenter.  Mary uses her income to support the payment of school fess and utility bills. Mary will use the loan to purchase more of plastic bowls, bathroom slippers and others for sale. With the new profits from his expanded business, Mary plans to save to educate her children.

loans.use: Mary will use the loan to purchase more of plastic bowls, bathroom slippers and others for sale.

loans.name: Xiomara Agustina

texts.es: Xiomara Agustina de 42 años de edad es soltera, trabaja como despendienta en la Miscelanea El Carmen en Juigalpa desde hace 6 años, tiene 2 hijos mayores, la hija esta en segundo año de la universidad, y le ayudan con los gastos.  Xiomara con el credito anterior fue beneficiada con el fondo kiva y logró construir un cuarto el cual no pudo concluir totalmente, por lo que esta solicitando su 5to credito para seguir mejorando su casa y lograr poner el techo, el piso y las puertas de ese cuarto y brindarle mejor comodidad a su familia, ademas manifiesta que si el dinero ajusta terminaria la sala a la que aun le falta levantar 2 paredes y ponerle el piso.   El mayor sueño de Xiomara es seguir mejorando su vivienda para sus hijos, y refiere sentirse muy agradecida con AFODENIC, pues con los creditos que le han otorgado ha logrado poco a poco construir su casa.
texts.en:
Xiomara Agustina is 42 years old and a single mother of 2 adult children. Her daughter is a second year college student and helps with the expenses. Xiomara has been working as a shop assistant at “El Carmen” General Store in Juigalpa for 6 years. She previously benefited from a Kiva loan which she used to build a room, but was not able to completely finish it. For this reason, she is requesting her 5th loan to continue her home improvements and add a ceiling, floor, and doors to the room in order to make it more comfortable for her family. If there is any money left over, she will finish the living room which is lacking 2 walls and a floor.

Xiomara’s greatest dream is to continue improving her home for her children. She is very grateful to AFODENIC for the loans they have provided, which has allowed her to gradually build her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Add a ceiling & floor to a room

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia A. is married and has one child. She has received schooling through junior high school. Her husband is a farmer.

Patricia sells groceries like milk and sugar at Elmina near Abreshia, which she has been doing since 2007. She uses her income to support the payment of fees and utility bills.

Patricia will use the loan to buy more groceries to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Martha Patricia

texts.es: Martha Patricia de 33 años es casada,  tiene una hija de 14 años de edad estudiando la secundaria, es maestra de educacion primaria, pero actualmente no esta trabajando porque se acaba de trasladar a su casa en Juigalpa, pues con su marido adquirieron una vivienda en el Residencial Bosques de Juigalpan a la que desean realizar algunas mejoras, por lo que esta solicitando su primer credito para ponerle ceramica a su casa, pues el piso es embaldosado, ademas desea darle seguridad a la casa poniendo protectores metalicos y si el credito da ponerle azulejos al baños de la casa.  Su esposo esta trabajando en el extranjero y mensualmente le envia dinero para los gastos del hogar y para el pago de la vivienda, ademas enviara para el pago del credito que se le otorgue.  Martha Patricia sueña en el futuro poder seguir mejorando su casa haciendo un cuarto para mayor privacidad y construir la cocina para que la sala sea mas amplia.
texts.en:
Martha Patricia is 33 years old, married, and has a 14 year old daughter in high school. She is an elementary school teacher, but is not currently working because her family just moved to Juigalpa. Her husband bought their house in the residential development of Bosques de Juigalpan, and they wish to make some improvements.

Martha Patricia is requesting her first loan and wants to complete the ceramic tiling in her house because the floors are already finished. She will purchase tiles for her bathroom and install metal guards to provide security for her home.

Martha Patricia’s husband works abroad and sends money for the family’s living expenses and house payments. Part of that money will also be used to repay this loan. She dreams of continuing the improvements to her house by adding a room for greater privacy and building a kitchen that has more space.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ceramic tiles & metal guards

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah B. is a hairdresser and sells hair products like wigs, weave-ons and other hair products at Elmina near Abreshia. She is married and has one child.  Her husband is a teacher. She received schooling through junior high school. Sarah has been in this business since 2005. She uses her income to help pay school fees and utility bills. Sarah will use this loan to purchase more, and a greater variety of, hair products for the styles of her customers. Sarah plans to save the new profits from her expanded business to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase hair products

loans.name: Cerafina Filomena

texts.es:
La señora Cerafina es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 48 años de edad, estado civil casada y es madre de 03 hijos (solo uno esta a su cargo), estudio educación primaria incompleta (2do grado), vive en el Barrio Asunción Jr. Zepita 444.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 10 años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invirtió comprando golosinas para su negocio. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de chocolates, galletas, dulces, yogures, chisitios, etc. Cerafina compra sus productos en Puno y Desaguadero y los vende en su puesto del mercado en Juli.

Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y ampliar su casa construyendo un segundo piso.

A ella le gustan las reuniones y los desembolsos.
texts.en:
Sra. Cerafina is a member of the Communal Bank “Santa Rosa de Lima”, which is located in the District of Juli, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 48 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children (only 1 is still a dependent). She has a 2nd grade education and lives in the neighborhood of Asunción Jr. Zepita 444.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 10 years. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy candy for her business.

At the moment, she is requesting another loan of 300 soles to buy chocolates, cookies, candy, yogurt, cheese flavored snacks, etc. Cerafina purchases her products in Puno and Desaguadero and sells them from her stall in the Juli Market. She dreams of improving her business and expanding her house by adding a second floor.

She enjoys her Communal Bank meetings and her loan disbursements.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chocolates, cookies, candy, yogurt, cheese flavored snacks, etc.

loans.name: Lady

texts.es: La sra. Lady trabaja mucho tiempo en la institución, anteriormente con su actividad de manualidades en porcelana, ahora se dedica a la venta de plantas medicinales que trae de los Yungas de La Paz, ya que su familia es de allá. Es una joven muy trabajadora y emprendedora, es casada y junto a su esposo anhelan tener su propio departamento ya que ahora vive en casa de sus suegros, no tiene hijos, quieren esperar a estar más estables y así poder darles todo lo mejor. Es una cliente muy responsable y puntual, el crédito lo invertirá en la cancelación de la compra de un terreno en la localidad de Caranavi (Sud Yungas) para así poder ser productora de plantas medicinales.
texts.en:
Lady has worked for a long time, before in porcelain handicrafts and now selling medicinal plants that she brings from the warm valleys of Bolivia since her family lives there. She is a very hardworking and enterprising young woman. Lady is married, and she and her husband would very much like their own apartment since they currently live with her husband's parents. They do not have children because they want to wait until they are more stable and able to give their children all the best. Lady is a very responsible and punctual customer, and with her loan she will invest in paying off the balance for a plot of land in the town of Caranavi in the southern warm valleys region in order to then be able to be a producer of medicinal plants.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paying off the balance on the purchase of a plot of land

loans.name: Rosamery

texts.es:
La señora Rosmery es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 26 años de edad, estado civil conviviente y es madre de 01 hijo, estudio educación superior administración técnica, vive en el Barrio Asunción Chinchaya 549.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 6 años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invirtió en su negocio de venta de chifles. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de betunes, champús, detergentes, papel suave, escobillas, cojines de lejía, hilos, jabones.

Su sueño es construir su casa ya que cuenta con el terreno.

A ella le gustan los encuentros deportivos.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosmery is a member of the Communal Bank “Santa Rosa de Lima”, which is located in the District of Juli, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 26 years old, in a common law marriage, and has one child. She completed her education in technical administration. Sra. Rosmery lives in the neighborhood of Asunción Chinchaya 549.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for the past 6 years. Her first loan of 300 soles was invested into her business selling plantain chips.

At the moment, she is requesting a loan of 800 soles to buy shoe polish, shampoos, detergents, tissue paper, brushes, bleach pads, dental floss and soap. Sra. Rosmery dreams of building her house on her land. She enjoys participating in sporting events.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shoe polish, shampoos, detergents, tissue paper, brushes, bleach pads, dental floss and soap

loans.name: Fabiana

texts.es:
La señora Fabiana es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 53 años de edad, estado civil soltera y es madre de 01 hijo, estudio educación secundaria completa, vive en el Barrio Asunción Jr. Asunción 419.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 3 años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invirtió comprando golosinas. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de galletas, dulces, yogures, chisitios, gaseosas, etc., para venderlo en su tienda.

Su deseo es mejorar y surtir mejor su tienda.

A ella le gustan las facilidades en los pagos.

loans.use: Para la compra de galletas, dulces, yogures, chisitios, gaseosas, etc.,

loans.name: Benita

texts.es:
La señora Benita es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 43 años de edad, estado civil soltera y es madre de 02 hijos (uno solo a su cargo), estudio educación secundaria completa, vive en el Barrio Asunción.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 2 años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invirtió comprando lanas para la elaboración de sus bordados. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de lanas de colores para elaborar sus bordados y poderlos vender, nos cuenta que sufrió un incendio y se quedo prácticamente sin nada por eso esta volviendo a empezar con sus bordados.

Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y contar con mayor capital para salir adelante.

A ella le gustan los ahorros, las reuniones y los desembolsos.
texts.en:
Sra. Benita is a member of the Communal Bank “Santa Rosa de Lima”, which is located in the District of Juli, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 43 years old, single, and the mother of 2 children (1 is still a dependent). She has a high school education and lives in the neighborhood of Asunción.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for the past 2 years. Her initial loan of 300 soles was used to buy wool for making her embroideries.

This time she is requesting another loan of 300 soles to purchase different colors of wool for her embroideries, which she will sell later. Sra. Benita told us that she recently suffered from a fire and was practically left with nothing. For this reason, she is trying to restart her embroidery business.

Her dream is to improve her business and obtain more capital so that she can succeed. She enjoys her savings, the Communal Bank meetings, and her loan disbursements.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool in different colors

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
La señora Zoila es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa D. Lima”  que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Juli, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 60 años D. edad, estado civil casada y es madre D. 03 hijos (solo uno esta a su cargo), estudio educación secundaria completa, vive en el Barrio Asunción.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 10 años,  su préstamo inicial fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invirtió en la compra D. ganado menor. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo D. S/. 1600.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra D. ganado mayor para venderlo en las ferias zonales.

Su sueño es continuar trabajando.

A ella le gusta la puntualidad y las reuniones.

loans.use: Para la compra de ganado vacuno.

loans.name: Maday

texts.es:
La señora Maday es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 33 años de edad, estado civil soltera y es madre de 01 hijo, estudio educación superior Inicial, vive en el Barrio Tupac Amaru  Pasaje Velasco.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 6 años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invirtió en la compra de ganado menor. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 2300.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra cabezas de ovinos, también va a comprar lanas de colores para la elaboración de sus bordados.

Su sueño es poder ejercer su profesión.

A ella le gustan las reuniones y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Sra. Maday is a member of the Communal Bank “Santa Rosa de Lima”, which is located in the District of Juli, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 33 years old, single, and the mother of 1 child. She has taken some introductory college courses. Sra. Maday lives in the neighborhood of Tupac Amaru Pasaje Velasco.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for the past 6 years. Her initial loan of 300 soles was used to buy small livestock.

This time she is requesting a loan of 2300 soles to purchase heads of sheep. She will also buy wool in different colors for making embroideries.

Sra. Maday dreams of continuing with her work. She enjoys her Communal Bank meetings and the timeliness of her loans.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep & wool in different colors for making embroideries

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
La señora Paula es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 51 años de edad, estado civil casada y es madre de 06 hijos (solo 2 están a su cargo), estudio educación primaria incompleta (3do grado), vive en el Barrio Tupac Amaru  Av. Alfonso Ugarte 707.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 3 años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invirtió en la compra de ovinos y cerdos. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 850.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de ovinos y algunos chanchos para engorde, también se dedica a la artesanía en  bordado en bayeta.

Su sueño es continuar trabajando.

A ella le gustan las reuniones y los ahorros.
texts.en:
Paula is a member of the communal bank “Santa Rosa de Lima” that is located in the Juli district, Chucuito province, Puno. She is 51 years old, married, and is the mother of 6 children (only 2 are currently in her care). She completed only 3 years of primary education, and lives in the neighborhood Tupac Amaru Av. Alfonso Ugarte 707. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos organization for 3 years, her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, which she used to purchase sheep and pigs. She is currently requesting a loan of 850 nuevos soles to purchase more sheep and some pigs to fatten. She also does cloth embroidery. Her dream is to continue working. She enjoys saving, and attending the meetings of her communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase sheep and pigs

loans.name: Salome

texts.es: LA SEÑORA, SALOME M. M. , ES UNA CLIENTE ANTIGUA QUE TRABAJA  EN LA INSTITUCION MAS DE CINCO AÑOS SIN CAMBIAR A OTRAS INSTITUCIONES ES DECIR ES UNA CLIENTE FIEL. ELLA TIENE UNA CARNICERIA, DONDE EL ESPOSO LE AYUDA CUANDO TIENE MOMENTOS LIBRES, YA QUE EL ES ALBAÑIL CONTRATISTA. LOS TRES HIJOS AUN ESTUDIAN, PERO TAMBIEN COLABORAN CON EL NEGOCIO DE LA MAMA. ELLA INVERTIRA ESTE CREDITO PARA COMPRAR MAS CARNE PARA VENDER EN SU CARNICERIA.
texts.en:
Mrs. Salome M. M. is an old client of Emprender, having worked with them for more than five years without changing to other institutions. That is to say, she is a faithful client. She has a butcher shop, which her husband herlps her with in his free time, since he is a building contractor. Her three children are students but they also help out her business. She will use this loan to buy more meat to sell in her butcher shop.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy meat for butcher shop

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
La señora Rosalia es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 49 años de edad, estado civil casada y es madre de 06 hijos (4 están a su cargo), estudio educación primaria completa, vive en el Barrio Tupac Amaru Jr. Condorena s/n.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 10 años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invirtió comprando bayetas y lanas  de colores. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de lanas de colores y bayeta para elaborar bordados.

Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y poner un puesto de venta de lanas.

A ella le gustan las reuniones.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosalia is a member of the Communal Bank “Santa Rosa de Lima”, which is located in the District of Juli, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 49 years old, married, and the mother of 6 children (4 are still dependents). She has an elementary school education and lives in the neighborhood of Barrio Tupac Amaru Jr. Condorena.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for the past 10 years. Her initial loan of 300 soles was used to buy flannel and wool in different colors.

This time she is requesting a loan of 500 soles to buy wool in different colors and flannel for making embroideries. Sra. Rosalia dreams of improving her business and opening a vending post so that she can sell wool. She enjoys her Communal Bank meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flannel & wool in different colors

loans.name: Sol De Verano_Kantutas Group

texts.es: Cinco son las integrantes del grupo Sol de Verano Kantutitas, que pertenecen al Centro Focal Juan Pablo II,Benita de 38 años se dedica a vender muebles, tiene su puesto propio en la feria "16 de Julio", Lizzeth de 28 años vende juguetes en la "Garita de Lima", Irma de 36 años vende muñecos de yeso y Rosario y Florencia dan productos al crédito. Todas necesitan el préstamo para comprar mercadería y seguir operando ens us negocios.
texts.en:
There are five members of the Sol de Verano Kantutitas group who belong to the Juan Pablo II Focal Center. Benita, 38 years old, works selling furniture and has her own stand at the "16th of July" market. Lizzeth, 28 years old, sells toys at the "Garita de Lima" market. Irma, 36 years old, sells plaster figurines, and Rosario and Florencia offer products on credit. All of these women need the loan to purchase merchandise and to continue operating their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
La señora Concepción es socia del Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazareth”, ubicado en el Centro poblado de López del distrito de Ilave, provincia de el Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 51 años de edad, es casada y madre de 6 hijos, ella estudio primaria incompleta (2 do grado), y  vive  en la parcialidad de Jamachi.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 6 meses, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para la compra de ovinos.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, Dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganado ovino.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le gustan los ahorros.
texts.en:
Sra. Concepción is a member of the Communal Bank “Jesús de Nazareth”, which is located in the central village of López in the District of Ilave, Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 51 years old, married, and the mother of 6 children. Sra. Concepción has a 2nd grade education and lives in the parish of Jamachi. She started working with Manuela Ramos 6 months ago. Her first loan in the amount of 500 soles was used as capital to buy sheep. She is requesting another loan in the amount of 500 soles that will be invested in the purchase of additional sheep. Sra. Concepción hopes to continue working. She enjoys her savings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Lidia es socia del Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazareth”, ubicado en el Centro poblado de López del distrito de Ilave, provincia de el Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 35 años de edad, es casada y madre de 7 hijos, estudio primaria completa, y  vive  en la comunidad de López.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 6 meses, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para la compra de ovinos.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, Dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganado ovino y porcino para mejorarlos y luego venderlos en las ferias semanales de Ilave, la Sra. Lidia también se dedica a la chacra.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando para educar a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las charlas.

loans.use: Para la compra de ganado ovinos.

loans.name: Asunta

texts.es:
Asunta es socia del Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazareth”, ubicado en el Centro poblado de López del distrito de Ilave, provincia de el Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos, ella estudio secundaria completa, y  vive  en la comunidad de J. Yanapa.

Inicia su Trabajo con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo es de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que le servirá como capital para la compra de ovinos y gallinas.

Su deseo trabajar para ayudar a su familia.

A ella le gustan las facilidades en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Asunta is a member of the Communal Bank, “Jesus de Nazareth,” located in the populated center of Lopez in Ilave, and the Collao province in the district of Puno. She is 19 years old, unmarried and has no children. Asunta competed her secondary studies and lives in the J. Yanapa community. She is just beginning her participation with the Manuela Ramos Movement, and this is her first loan of 500.00 PEN ($175). These funds will be used as capital for the purchase sheep and hens. Her desire is to work to help her family. She appreciates the opportunity for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sheep and hens.

loans.name: Nancy Emma

texts.es: LA SEÑORA, NANCY EMMA M., DESTINARA SU CREDITO PARA COMPRA DE MERCADERIA EN CHOMPAS Y LA REFACCION DE SU  CASA. LA SRA. NANCY, CONJUNTAMMENTE SU ESPOSO SON LOS PILARES DE LA FAMILIA, YA QUE DE ELLOS DEPENDE EL BIENESTAR DE LA FAMILIA.  TIENEN 4 HIJOS, DOS DE ELLOS ESTUDIAN EL LA UNIVERSIDAD, LOS OTROS ASISTEN AL COLEGIO. ELLOS COLABORAN CON SUS PADRES, YA SEA EN EL NEGOCIO DE LA MADRE O EN EL NEGOCIO DEL PADRE.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nancy’s loan will be used to buy merchandise such as sweaters and to repair her house. Mrs. Nancy, together with her husband, is the pillar of the family. The welfare of their family depends upon them. They have four children. Two of them are studying in the university and two attend high school. The children work with their parents, sometimes in their mother’s business and sometimes in their father’s business.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will invest in the purchase of tires and the rest will be used to buy sweaters.

loans.name: Sol De Verano_Media Lina Group

texts.es: Seis son los integrantes del grupo Sol de verano_Media Luna, son un grupo unido y alegre. Beatriz de 52 años vende fideo, arroz, azúcar en la Zona Garita, Charo de 29 años vende verduras en la Max Paredez, Noemí de 18 años elabora muñecos, Eusebio de 62 años vende ropa en difernetes ferias y Victoria y Evelin venden productos al crédito. Todas necesitan del préstamo para comprar mercadería y ofrecer productos variados  a sus clientes.
texts.en:
There are six members of the group “Sol de Verano, Media Luna” (Summer Sun, Half Moon). They are a united and happy group. Beatrice, 52 years old, sells rice and sugar in the Garita Zone. Charo, 29 years old, sells vegetables in the “Max Paredez”. Noemî, eighteen years old, makes dolls. Eusebio, 62 years old, sells clothes in different fairs and Victoria and Evelin sell products on credit. All of them need a loan to buy merchandise and to offer a variety to their customers.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
Rosalía tiene 43 años de edad, es casada, y vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el centro poblado menor Enrique López Albújar, ubicado en la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 15 años tiene un pequeño puesto en el Mercado José Balta, ubicado en una de las principales avenidas de Chiclayo, allí ejerce el oficio de costurera y trabaja todos los días con la finalidad de apoyar al sostenimiento económico de su familia.

Ella trabaja en base a pedidos, aunque también confecciona diversas prendas de vestir que luego vende a sus clientes, el fruto de este trabajo lo invierte en la compra de más material para seguir confeccionando prendas.

Su más grande anhelo es poder crear un taller en donde sólo se dedique a la confección de prendas, y conforme vaya creciendo, emplear a otras mujeres que, como ella, comparten la misma necesidad de trabajo y las aptitudes y creatividad necesarias para progresar dentro de este tipo de negocio.

Sus dos hijos se encuentran estudiando y el deseo de brindarles un futuro mejor le motiva   a seguir luchando por lograr sus sueños y sacar adelante a su familia. Por este motivo se encuentra solicitando a nuestra Institución un crédito de 1800 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más material para seguir confeccionando prendas de vestir.

Rosalía ya ha venido trabajando con nosotros durante tres años y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos por lo que es considerada una buena cliente.
texts.en:
Rosalía is 43 years old, married, and lives with her husband and two children in the centre of Enrique Lopéz Albújar, a small village located in the city of Chiclayo. For the last 15 years Rosalía has had a small stall in the José Balta market, located in one of the principal avenues of Chiclayo. She works there every day as a seamstress to support the economic upkeep of her family. Although she works principally from orders, she also makes various items of clothing which she later sells to her customers. She invests the fruit of her work in more material to continue making clothes. Rosalía's greatest wish is to build a workshop where she could just concentrate on making clothes, and as her business grows, employ other women who, just like her, share the same need to work and the necessary aptitude and creativity to progress with this type of business. Both her children are currently studying and the desire to give them a better future motivates Rosalía to continue fighting to achieve her dreams and keep her family going. For this reason she is applying for a loan of 1800 nuevos soles which she intends to invest in more material to continue making items of clothing. Rosalía has already worked with Kiva's partner institution for 3 years and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility in her repayments, for which she is considered to be a good client.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase material to make clothes

loans.name: Gladys Jackeline

texts.es:
Gladys es casada, tiene 38 años D. edad y vive junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos en la urbanización Santo Toribio, distrito D. José Leonardo Ortiz, ubicado a cinco minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

DesD. hace más D. 15 años tiene un pequeño puesto D. venta D. carne D. aves D. corral (pollo, gallina y pato) en el Mercado Atusparias (uno D. los principales centros D. abastecimiento del distrito D. José Leonardo Ortiz), compra su mercadería en el mercado Moshoqueque (el principal mercado mayorista D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo) y atienD. en su puesto todos los dias desD. muy temprano en la mañana.

Su más granD. anhelo es crear junto a su marido un restaurante especializado en pollo y así lograr que su familia tenga la calidad D. vida que ella desea, es por ello que se encuentra solicitando a nuestra Institución un crédito D. 800 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra D. más mercadería para mantener su negocio y poco a poco, con su  esfuerzo, lograr su sueño.

Gladys es una madre muy responsable, se da el tiempo suficiente para atender su negocio y a sus menores hijos, tres D. los cuales se encuentran estudiando en un colegio D. la zona; por otro lado ya ha trabajado con nosotros anteriormente en cuatro oportunidades demostrando responsabilidad y puntualidad, por lo que es considerada una cliente excelente.
texts.en:
Gladys is married, 38 years of age, and lives with her husband and four children in the estate of Santo Toribio in the district of José Leonardo Ortiz, located five minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For more than 15 years she has had a small stall selling poultry (chicken and duck) in the Atusparias market (one of the principal supply centres in the José Leonardo Ortiz district). She sells her goods in the Moshoqueque market (the main wholesale market in Chiclayo) and runs her stall every day, starting very early in the morning. Her greatest wish is to create a restaurant with her husband that specialises in chicken and in doing so achieve the quality of life that she desires for her family. It is because of this that she is applying for a loan of 800 nuevos soles that she intends to invest in the purchase of more goods to maintain her business and bit by bit, with her efforts, achieve her dream. Gladys is a very responsible mother; she manages her time sufficiently to attend to her business and her youngest children, three of whom are studying in a college in the area. She has already worked with Kiva´s field partner on four separate occasions demonstrating both responsibility and punctuality, for which she is considered to be an excellent client.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase poultry to sell

loans.name: Saulo

texts.es:
El señor Saulo S. y su esposa la señora Marcela Vidaurri tiene tienen un hijo pequeño a quien le quieren dar lo mejor y su seguridad. 
El señor S. está solicitando un crédito para pagar un enganche de una vivienda ya que actual mente están viviendo en casa de su suegra, y el desea darles su propio patrimonio ha su familia. 
Don Saulo trabaja en la construcción y la señora Marcela de dedica a vender ropa usada y nueva en diferentes partes de la ciudad, estos son los ingresos que tiene para la familia y con el cual una parte será para pagar el crédito.
Cuando realizamos la visita a la casa del señor Saulo el no se encontraba estaba en su trabaja, y quien nos atendió fue la señora Marcela quien es la persona que aparece en la foto.
texts.en:
Saulo S. and his wife, Marcela Vidaurri, have a small son whom they want to provide with the best and keep safe. Saulo is requesting a loan so that he can make a down payment on a house. His family is currently living in his mother-in-law’s house, and he wants to provide them with their own property. Saulo works in construction and Marcela makes a living selling both new and second-hand clothing in different parts of the city; these are the family’s sources of income, and a portion of it will be used to repay this loan. When we made the visit to Saulo’s house we were not able to meet with him, since he was at work. We instead met with Marcela, and she is the person who appears in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the down payment on a government house

loans.name: Lisette

texts.es:
Lisette tiene 30 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en una casa arrendada. Desde hace varios años atrás se dedica a la elaboración y venta de panes. Para ello, usa el honro de un familiar y se instala en la esquina de su casa para su comercialización. Adicionalmente, al terminar la venta de sus panes, el resto del día se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, estos productos los ofrece a sus vecinas y amistades a través de un catálogo, para luego acordar una fecha de pago (al crédito) según la necesidad de su cliente. Con estos negocios Lisette sostiene la economía familiar y su deseo es continuar dedicándose al comercio, pero ir incrementando sus ventas.   
Esta es la cuarta oportunidad que tiene un préstamo con MFP y se siente muy comprometida en ser una integrante de su banco comunal puntual en sus pagos, también está decidida a ser una persona proactiva. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra de cosméticos, al por mayor. Además, también adquirirá harina, manteca y levadura; ingredientes primordiales para la elaboración de sus panes.

loans.use: Incremento de su mercadería y compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de panes

loans.name: Ernestina Elizabeth

texts.en:
Previous loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=95974&_tpos=f&_tpg=h.  Erenestina is a member of the Valley Roses village bank.
She is a 39-year-old single mother with a 20 year-old child who studies abroad. She makes her living selling clothes on credit. Her husband works fixing door locks. She lives with her parents and misses her child a lot but understands the importance of becoming a professional outside the country. 
Ernistina needs a new loan of 1400 soles to buy more clothes to sell. Her dream is to keep on working and to eventually have her own shop in the market.

loans.use: buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Irma Concepcion

texts.en:
Irma is a member of the Valley Roses village bank. Sixty years old and married, she has two grown children who are employed living on the second floor of her house.  Irma studied in her district’s local parish and works in a bakery where she makes candy, alfajores (small cookies), cakes, and all other types of treats.  Previously, she maD. toys but  stopped because there was fierce competition and instead put her efforts into baking and making wood handicrafts. 

Irma needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy paint, paintbrushes, resin, and varnish. Her dream is to have her own shop in the market so that she can sell her goods with her husband, who is retired. 

Previous loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=96274&_tpos=f&_tpg=h.

loans.use: To buy paint, paintbrushes, resin, and varnish

loans.name: Ynes

texts.en:
Ynes is a member of the Valley Roses village bank. Thirty-eight-years-old, she lives with her partner and has an 11-year-old son attending private school. Ynes has started a new business in a northern part of Lima called Huacho where she is raising six bulls and some cattle. Her aunt has some land there and has given her a corral in order to help support more animals. Ynes has decided to use that land to fatten her bulls. Her aunt is responsible for the feeding, nutrition, and vaccination of the animals. Ynes travels to Huacho on the weekends where she still sells clothes at local fairs. 

Ynes needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy sports clothes and jeans to sell. Her dream is to grow her cattle business and to own another clothes stand. 

Previous loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=95977&_tpos=f&_tpg=h.

loans.use: To buy sports clothes and jeans to sell

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana Maria es soltera, de 42 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos, la mayor de 19 años y el menor de 13, ambos estudiando, vive en el Municipio de Cuapa, labora para el MINED desempeñandose como maestra de primaria con 22 años de servicio, con sus creditos ha logrado dar mejores condiciones a su casa y fue beneficiada con el fondo kiva, esta solicitando su 12vo credito y espera que AFODENIC y KIVA la siga apoyando para lograr la construccion de un cuarto en su casa y contar con mayor comodidad para sus hijos, pues ambos necesitan tener privacidad, y de esta manera mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana Maria is single, 42 years old and has 2 children. The eldest is 19 years old and the youngest 13, both of whom study. She lives in the municipality of Cuapa and works for the institute MINED, where she holds a position as a primary school teacher with 22 years of service. With her previous loans she has benefited from Kiva funds by improving the conditions of her house. She is applying for her twelfth loan and hopes that both AFODENIC and Kiva continue supporting her so that she can construct a bedroom in her house and provide the best of comfort for her children, as both of them need their privacy. In this way she can improve the quality of life of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a bedroom

loans.name: Susana Elisbeth

texts.es:
Susana tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres y sus tres hermanos en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, ubicado a cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace un año, gracias a sus ahorros y al apoyo de sus padres, ha creado una pequeña bodega – tienda dentro del mercado José Balta, un mercado de la ciudad de Chiclayo, donde vende artículos de primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, aceite), abarrotes y golosinas.

Ella atiende en su puesto todas las mañanas y parte de la tarde, y durante la noche, estudia Inglés en un instituto de la ciudad, lo recaudado en su negocio lo utiliza para pagarse sus estudios y para apoyar en casa con la educación de sus tres hermanos.

Susana desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, por este motivo se encuentra solictando por primera vez a nuestra Institución un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Su mas grande anhelo es seguir ayudando a sus hermanos y hacer crecer su negocio para tener, en el futuro, una fuente de ingreso económico estable para sustentar a su familia.

Ella es muy conocida y estimada por sus vecinos, tanto de su barrio como del mercado, los que la consideran una chica alegre y optimista.
texts.en:
Susana is 19 years old, single, and lives with her parents and three siblings in the José Leonardo Ortiz district, located 5 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. For the past year, thanks to the help from her parents, she has created and run a small store inside the José Balta market, which is a market in Chiclayo where she sells necessities such as rice, sugar, and cooking oil. She also sells groceries and little candies. Susana stays with her shop every morning, part of the afternoon and through the night. She studies English in a city institute, and uses what she makes from her business to pay for her classes and to support her household and especially the education of her three siblings. Susana wishes to expand her business by buying a larger variety of products to offer to her clients, and for this reason she is asking for 1000 soles (Peruvian currency) that would help her accomplish her goal. Her greatest longing is to keep helping her siblings, and grow her business to have, in the future, a stable source of income to support her family. She is very well known and esteemed by her neighbors, so much that the vendors around her consider her a very happy and optimistic girl.

Translated from Spanish by Mitchell Usher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying necessities and groceries to sell

loans.name: 28 - Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
"TRân Kiều Thị T. (188) is a 58 year-old female living in the town of T. Hoá.  TRân is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 28 Nam Ngạn (17.08.28).


TRân is married and has 2 adult -aged children.  To making a living, TRân shares & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business with another people in her family.
