Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng. 4. Đinh Thị T. (20213030024) là 36 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng. 5. Đỗ Thị T. (20213030025) là 21 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.

Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products

loans.name: Sokpah Group

texts.en:
Sokpah is a group of five borrowers, led by Mamadee D., living in Kolahu, Lofa County, Liberia.

Mamadee is 48 years old and is married with seven children ages 10 to 22. All his children are in school, and Mamadee himself is a high school graduate. He lives in the remote town of Kolahu in rural Lofa County, the breadbasket of Liberia. 

Mamadee’s business is wholesale wood for construction, which he buys wholesale locally and saws into pieces for use in various projects around Lofa County in the reconstruction efforts after the war. He has run his business for three years and is successful because of the way he treats his employees and customers.

Mamadee is taking this loan to purchase gasoline and engine oil to run the saw. His dream is to expand his business and, with the profits, complete his house and send his children to university, which he was unable to attend.

loans.use: To purchase gasoline and engine oil for his saw

loans.name: Khairullo

texts.en: Khairullo is 33 years old, is married, and lives with wife and three children. He is a very hard-worker and works cultivating potatoes, an activity which he has practiced for three years. He enjoys his work for the contact with nature and also because potatoes sell very well in the markets and are valued within his community. Currently, Khairullo needs a loan of 3,500 Somoni for his business. With this loan he will buy seed and fertilizer to improve his farming and to get better production. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Nurali

texts.en:
H. Nurali is a diligent and tenacious farmer, who strives to meet his family’s needs. His wife does not work and thus he carries the burden alone through his farming income to meet his family’s needs. Nurali works on a farm owned by his parents. His harvests are sometimes not maximized because his cultivation method and seeds are not the best. Better farming supplies, seeds and fertilizer require a larger capital which he didn’t have. Nurali is now relieved that IMON International is helping him get a loan he needs to improve his farming. This loan will be used to buy superior seeds, organic fertilizers and pesticides. Nurali is waiting for his next harvest which he hopes to yield better results from his previous harvests. He will use his farming income to support his children’s educational needs and if there is still some money left he really hopes to fix his unfinished house.

loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Furkat

texts.en:
M. Furkat is 25 years old and lives with his parents. He has dedicated himself to farming potato for more than 6 years. He enjoys being a farmer and finds harvesting his crops especially gratifying. On the other hand, the most tedious part of farming is the preparation of land for planting and protecting crop from insects that spoil his harvest. At the same time Furkat is engaged in the business of raising cattle. This is his fifth loan from IMON International. He will use the money to buy seeds, fertilizer for his plots and also young cattle. Furkat sincerely thankful to all lenders who support him.

loans.use: Purchasing seed, fertilizer and young cattle

loans.name: God Gift #1 Group

texts.en:
God Gift #1, led by Maijai S., is a group of five borrowers living in Kolahu, Lofa County, Liberia.

Maijai is 31 years old and is single with three children, age 7 to 13, all of whom are in school. Maijai was unable to attend school because, although she enjoyed it, the cultural norm was for girls to rely on their husbands to provide, and therefore school was considered unnecessary. She lives in remote city of Kolahu in rural Lofa County, the breadbasket of Liberia.

Maijai’s business is retail clothing, including slippers, shirts, pants, underwear, etc., which she buys wholesale from nearby Guinea and sells in a temporary market stall on the Kolahu-Foya highway. She has run her business for three years and is successful because of her business and financial skills.

Maijai is taking the loan to increase her inventory of clothing which sells well in the rainy season. Her dream is to grow her business so she can one day have the biggest table in the central market. With the profits from her business Maijai dreams of building her own house.

loans.use: To purchase slippers, pants, and shirts for her inventory

loans.name: Hands Together Group

texts.en:
Hands Together, led by Njabeh S., is a group of five borrowers living in Kolahu, Lofa County, Liberia.

Njabeh is 50 years old and is married with four children, age 22 to 30. Njabeh was unable to attend school because, although she enjoyed it, the cultural norm was for girls to rely on their husbands to provide, and therefore school was considered unnecessary. She lives in the remote city of Kolahu in rural Lofa County, the breadbasket of Liberia.

Njabeh’s business is retail clothing, including slippers, shirts, pants, underwear, etc., which she buys wholesale from nearby Guinea and sells in a temporary market stall on the Kolahu-Foya highway. She has run her business for four years and is successful because of the way she treats her customers.

Njabeh is taking the loan to increase her inventory of clothing which sells well in the rainy season. Her dream is to grow her business so that she can one day have the biggest table in the central market. With the profits from her business she dreams of building her own house.

loans.use: To purchase pants, underwear, and shirts for her inventory

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Madina

texts.en: Madina is an extremely diligent and experienced woman, well trained in her agricultural endeavor. It is for this reason that, with much effort, she is able to produce vegetables which she then sells to wholesale merchants who take their products to all the markets in the region. This activity allowed her to improve her living and to support her children with school expenses. Currently, Madina needs a substantial increase in her investment capital and she appeals to your generous hearts to increase her production. loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr: Yao D. est un jeune homme âgé de 31 ans marié et père d’un enfant. Il est électricien à Lomé, quartier awatame. Il fait  son deuxième crédit à FECECAV. Avec ce crédit il voudrait acheter certains outils de travail afin de  pouvoir travailler en toute quiétude.  Il espère que ce crédit lui permettra d’augmenter ses bénéfices. Avec ces bénéfices, il veut  assurer le bien-être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Yao D. is a young man who is 31 years old, married, and the father of one child. He is an electrician in the Awatame district of Lome. This is his second loan through FECECAV (Kiva Field Partner). With this loan he would like to purchase tools so that he will be able to work comfortably. He hopes that this loan will translate into greater earnings. With his improved earnings he wants to provide for the well-being of his family.

Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a battery and a charger.

loans.name: Nisolat

texts.en:
Nisolat is a humble mother who, with much effort, works on her land, growing carrots and potatoes to later sell in the markets of the closest towns or to traders from the same area. Her responsibilities as a mother have encouraged her to pursue farming activities to continue growing the best vegetables in the area. At the same time, she raises cattle with the help of her husband and children.

Now, Nisolat wishes to expand her business and to buy seeds and fertilizer for growing winter wheat.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Erkinjon

texts.en: S. Erkinjon is a 50-year-old farmer, married with four children. His wife is a housewife and this leaves him as sole breadwinner. Erkinjon has been farming for the last thirteen years growing potatoes on his piece of land. At the same time he raises cattle. He would like to adopt new farming technology to boost his agricultural yield. He needs to be able to meet the financial responsibility of educating his younger children who are all in school and to maintain his family but he lacks the capital. Erkinjon requests a 2,650 USD loan to be used for purchasing seeds and fertilizer for growing potatoes. He’ll also spend part of the loan on purchasing young cattle. He is very responsible and promises to repay the loan on time. loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Jobir

texts.en: T. Jobir is 35 years old and the father of four children who are attending the local school. His wife is a housekeeper. Jobir owns a field for cultivating vegetables in order to earn a living. On this plantation, he now cannot do any planting because he does not have enough money for seeds and fertilizer. In order to deal with this problem, he decided to ask for a loan of 2,500 Somoni to buy necessary supplies. He counts on this opportunity to obtain a better yield, in order to improve the living conditions of his family. loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Think About Me #1 Group

texts.en:
Think About Me #1, led by Moijama K., is a group of five borrowers living in Kolahu, Lofa County, Liberia.

Moijama is 35 years old and is married with two children age 8 and 13. She also cares for two children orphaned in the war. All her children are in school. Moijama herself was unable to attend school because, although she enjoyed it, the cultural norm was for girls to rely on their husbands to provide, and therefore school was considered unnecessary. Moijama lives in remote city of Kolahu in rural Lofa County, the breadbasket of Liberia.

Moijama’s business is flour and sugar, which she buys wholesale from nearby Guinea and sells in a temporary market stall on the Kolahu-Foya highway. She has run her business for four years and is successful because of the way she treats her customers.

Moijama is taking the loan to increase her inventory to meet increased demand. Her dream is to grow her business so she can one day have the biggest table in the central market. With the profits from her business she dreams of building her own house and sending her kids to university.

loans.use: To purchase flour and sugar to increase her inventory

loans.name: Labour And Achieve Group

texts.en:
Labour and Achieve, led by Massia K., is a group of five borrowers living in Kolahu, Lofa County, Liberia.

Massia is 41 years old and is married with six children age 7 to 30. She also cares for two children who were orphaned in the war. Her younger children are in school. Massia herself was unable to attend school because, although she enjoyed it, the cultural norm was for girls to rely on their husbands to provide, and therefore school was considered unnecessary. Massia lives in the remote city of Kolahu in rural Lofa County, the breadbasket of Liberia.

Massia’s business is retail dry goods, including oil, rice, salt, etc., which she buys wholesale from nearby Guinea and sells in a temporary market stall on the Kolahu-Foya highway. She has run her business for three years and is successful because of the way she treats her customers.

Massia is taking the loan to increase her inventory to meet increased demand. Her dream is to grow her business so she can one day have the biggest table in the central market. With the profits from her business she dreams of building her own house.

loans.use: To purchase oil, rice, and salt to increase her inventory

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 27-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their four children. He has been working as a car electrician.

Ali requested a loan of 1,500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that he has requested a loan.

Ali is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. He decided on doing his business because he likes his work and he also wanted to improve his financial situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 28-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife. Ali has been working as a taxi van driver. He drives from the Bekaa to Beirut (the capital of Lebanon) round-trip, which takes over two hours driving and he does the ride more than once a day.

Ali requested a loan of 3,000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to paint and do some maintenance work on his van. This is his second loan and he has always paid on time.

Ali is special in his work because he knows how to take care of his clients who can be anybody from his region. When he first started his business, he had to pay the rent of the van. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work as well as to improve his financial situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by trading in cars.

loans.use: To paint and do some maintenance work on his van

loans.name: Allah Is God Group

texts.en:
Allah is God, led by Mossiame D., is a group of five borrowers living in Kolahu, Lofa County, Liberia.

Mossiame is 45 years old and is married with five children age 17 to 25. Her youngest is in school but Mossiame was unable to attend school herself because, although she enjoyed it, the cultural norm was for girls to rely on their husbands to provide, and therefore school was considered unnecessary. She lives in the remote city of Kolahu in rural Lofa County, the breadbasket of Liberia.

Mossiame’s business is retail fish which she buys wholesale locally and from nearby Guinea and sells in a market stall in the central Kolahu market. She has run her business for ten years and is successful because of the way she treats her customers.

Mossiame is taking the loan to increase her inventory to meet increased demand. Her dream is to grow her business so she can one day have the biggest table in the central market. With the profits from her business she dreams of sending her youngest to university.

loans.use: To purchase fish wholesale to sell

loans.name: Management Group

texts.en:
Managment Group, led by Mateneh B., is a group of five borrowers living in Kolahu, Lofa County, Liberia.

Mateneh is 28 years old and is single with three children age 3 to 14. All her children are in school but behind due to the schools being closed during the war. Mateneh was unable to attend school herself because, although she enjoyed it, the cultural norm was for girls to rely on their husbands to provide, and therefore school was considered unnecessary. She lives in the remote city of Kolahu in rural Lofa County, the breadbasket of Liberia.

Mateneh’s business is retail housewares, specifically plastic dishes which she buys wholesale from nearby Guinea and sells in a temporary market stall on the Kolahu-Foya highway. She has run her business for two years and is successful because of the way she treats her customers.

Mateneh is taking the loan to increase her inventory of dishes to meet increased demand. Her dream is to grow her business so she can one day have the biggest table in the central market. With the profits from her business she dreams of building her own house.

loans.use: To purchase more dishes wholesale to sell

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
BilA., a 22-year-old man living in the Bekaa, has owned an internet cafe since 2007. BilA. decided on this business because he likes computers and wanted to work independently. His clients are his friends and neighbors. BilA. knows how to treat his clients, and his clients feel at ease. When he first started his business, he had difficulty building a network.

BilA. has requested a loan of $1000 US from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his café and start selling recharge mobile cards. This is the first time that BilA. has requested a loan. In the future, he plans on improving and expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his café and to start selling recharge mobile cards

loans.name: Charif

texts.en:
Charif is a 29 year old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife. Charif has owned a barber shop since 2003. He requested a loan of 2000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase beauty products and arrange the décor of his shop. This is his third cycle and he has always paid on time. 
Charif is special in his work because he knows how to take good care of his clients, like he does than facial masks. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business he didn’t face difficulties. Charif decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products and arrange the décor of his shop.

loans.name: Dib

texts.en:
Dib, a 34-year-old man living in the Bekaa with his wife and five children, works as a carpenter. He has been the owner of a small factory for nine years, producing doors, windows, kitchens, etc. Dib has requested a loan of $2000 US from A. Majmoua in order to purchase an aluminum machine for his work. This is the first time that Dib has requested a loan.

Dib is experienced and does nice work. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Dib decided on doing this business because he wanted to improve his financiA. situation. In the future, he plans on improving his business by purchasing more sophisticated machines.

loans.use: To purchase an aluminum machine for his work.

loans.name: Happy Group

texts.en:
Happy Group consists of five borrowers. The group is led by Kpana K., who lives in Kolahu in rural Lofa county, the breadbasket of Liberia. Kpana is 29 years old and single. She has two children, ages sixteen and seven; the younger child is in third grade. Kpana was able to attend school through the sixth grade but no further due to the war. 

Kpana sells clothing, including slippers, shirts, pants, underwear, etc., which she buys wholesale from nearby Guinea and sells in a market stall along the Kolahu-Foya highway. She has been in business for six years and is successful because of the way she treats her customers. 

Kpana is requesting a loan so as to increase her inventory, which sells well in the rainy season. Her dream is to grow her business so she can one day have the biggest table in the central market and use the profits to build her own house.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of clothes to sell

loans.name: Help Me Go Ahead Group

texts.en:
Help Me Go Ahead is a group of five borrowers. It is headed by Sambi M., who lives in remote Kolahu city in rural Lofa county, the breadbasket of Liberia. Sambi is thirty years old, married, and has two children, ages one and three. She also cares for three children orphaned in the war. Sambi was unable to attend school because, even though she enjoyed it, the cultural norm was for girls to rely on their husbands to provide; therefore, school was considered unnecessary. 

Sambi sells clothes, including slippers, children’s clothing, shirts, pants, etc. She buys her stock wholesale from nearby Guinea and sells it in a market stall along the Kolahu-Foya highway. She has run her business for three years and is successful because of the way she treats her customers. 

Sambi is requesting a loan so as to build up her inventory to meet increased demand. Her ambition is to grow her business so she can one day have the biggest table in the central market. With the profits from her business Sambi dreams of building her own house.

loans.use: To purchase wholesale clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase raw material and merchandise and change the décor of the shop.

loans.name: Husam

texts.en:
Born in Palestine in 1979, Husam owns a computer store. He sells computer software and does computer maintenance and repairs. Husam is an experienced businessman whose customers are his friends and neighbors. 

Husam needs a loan of $1200 in order to buy an extensive variety of computer supplies that will help him to perform his work better so as to satisfy his clients.

loans.use: To buy computer supplies

loans.name: Hasna

texts.en:
Hasna is a 46-year-old woman who lives in the Bekaa Valley where she owns a grocery store. Hasna’s store is a success because she knows how to treat her clientele, who are her friends and neighbors. She decided to go into business in 2002 because she wanted to work.

Hasna has requested a loan of 2000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase more merchandise for her store. This is the first time that she has requested a loan. Hasna plans to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en:
Haidar is a 30 year old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their three children. Haidar has been working as a constructor since 1999. Haidar requested a loan of 500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time. 
Haidar is special in his work because he does a good work and is punctual. His clients can be anybody from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. He decided on doing his business because he of his experience. In the future, he plans on improving his business by purchasing more sophisticated tools.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her work.

loans.name: God Blessing Group

texts.en:
God Blessing is a group of 5 borrowers who are led by Mbowolee S. and live in Kolahu, Lofa County, Liberia. Mbowolee is 31 years old, married, and has 4 children ages 6-12. She also cares for 2 children who were orphaned in the war. Her oldest child is in the 4th grade. Mbowolee was unable to attend school because, although she enjoyed it, the cultural norm was for girls to rely on their husbands to provide and, therefore, school was considered unnecessary. She lives in remote Kolahu City in rural Lofa County, the breadbasket of Liberia. 

Mbowolee’s business is dry goods, including maggi cubes (a soup product), spices, matches, palm oil, etc., which she buys wholesale and sells in a temporary market stall near approximately 100 other vendors of various trades. She has run her business for 8 years and is successful because her customers like her personality and work ethic.  

Mbowolee is taking a loan to buy more inventory to meet increased demand.  Her dream is to expand her business so that, one day, she can have a bigger table in the market. With the profits from her business, Mbowolee dreams of raising her family well and sending her children to school, which she was unable to attend.

loans.use: Purchasing maggi cubes, spices, and matches

loans.name: Abenawa

texts.en: Abenawa A. is a widow and has three children. She sells kenkey: she buys maize, processes it into dough, moulds it into corn husks, and cooks it. She has been in business at Elmina, near Abreshia, since 2006. Abenawa has no formal education. She uses her income to pay fees and utility bills. Abenawa will use this loan to purchase maize in larger quantity for her kenkey. Abenawa plans to save the new profits from her expanded business to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase maize for kenkey

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 27-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa Valley with his wife and their child. Husein has owned shop where he sells spare car parts since 2003. Husein has requested a loan of $2000 USD from Al Majmoua to purchase spare parts for his garage. This is the first time that Husein has requested a loan. 

Husein is special because he knows how to treat his clients and sells good quality products, even thought they are used. His clients can be anybody from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Husein decided to start his business because he likes his work. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase spare car parts for his garage.

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is a 42-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa Valley with his wife and their three children. Jihad has owned a grocery store since 2004. Jihad has requested a loan of $1500 USD from Al Majmoua to purchase merchandise for his store. This is the first time that Jihad has requested a loan.

Jihad is special in his work because of his good reputation in his region. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Jihad decided to start his business because he wanted to improve his family’s financial situation. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 29-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa Valley with his wife and their two children. Khaled has been working in construction since 2000. Khaled requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Jihad has requested a loan.
Khaled is speciA. in his work because he does a good work. His clients can be anybody from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. He decided on doing his business because he of his experience. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Maisaa

texts.en:
Maisaa is a 27 year old woman who lives in the Bekaa with her husband and their child. Maisaa has owned a grocery store for eight years. Maisaa requested a loan of 1500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. This is the first time that Maisaa has requested a loan.
Maisaa is special in her business because she knows how to treat her clients. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she had financial issues. Maisaa decided on doing her businesses because she wanted to work. In the future, she plans on expanding her businesses.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Ransford

texts.en: Ransford A. is a fisherman who catches and sells fresh fish. He goes to the seashore to buy fresh fish to sell at Elmina near the seashore. Ransford has junior high school education. He is married and has two children. His wife is a fishmonger. Ransford has been selling fresh fish since 2004. He is responsible for paying school fees and the settlement of bills. His loan will be used to buy fishing equipment to enhance the quality of his work. He hopes to save the new profits from his business to build his own house.

loans.use: To buy fishing equipment

loans.name: Nahed

texts.en:
Nahed is a 38-year-old woman who lives in the Bekaa Valley with her husband and their two children. Nahed has been working as a seamstress since 2000. She works from her home, but she also visits her clients. Nahed has requested a loan of $1500 USD from Al Majmoua to purchase thread and pay for her car expenses. This is her fourth loan and she has always repaid on time. 

Nahed is special in her business because she knows how to treat her clients and does a good job. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. Nahed decided to her businesses because she wants to supplement her family’s income. In the future, she plans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase thread and pay for her car expenses.

loans.name: Ma'ali

texts.en:
Ma'ali is a woman with a whole lot of dreams to move ahead. Each day, she works hard by doing her best embroidery for each of her clients who are repeat customers. She has been doing this for many years -- since she was a little girl. Ma'ali now lives with her husbend in Palestine. She works while taking care of her two children who give her all the motivation to move ahead. 

She will continue to work with the sole purpose of providing a better future for her family. She is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase more colored thread and fabrics, the basic components of her embroideries. Let's support this young mother who works hard to keep her dreams alive in her mind and in her heart.

loans.use: Purchase more colored thread and fabrics

loans.name: Widad

texts.en:
Widad is a 46-year-old woman who lives in the Bekaa Valley with her husband and their four children. Widad has owned a bakery for a year. She bakes saj bread and mankoucheh. A “saj” is the traditionA. Lebanese dome-shaped metA. oven on which she makes saj bread (like pita), markouk (“thinned”) bread, and doughy confections called mankoucheh. A mankoucheh looks like a folded pizza and is most often topped with are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat these delicacies at any time of the day, but somehow, they taste better in the morning. 

Widad has requested a loan of $1500 USD from A. Majmoua to purchase raw materiA. for her bakery. This is the first time that Widad has requested a loan.

Widad is speciA. in her work because she knows how to treat her clients and bakes good mankoucheh. Her clients are people from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. She decided to start her business because she wanted to supplement her family’s income. In the future, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase raw material for her bakery.

loans.name: Zouheir

texts.en:
Zouheir lives in the Bekaa Valley with his wife and their child. He has been selling tires since 1992. Zouheir has requested a loan of $700 USD from Al Majmoua to purchase tools for his work. This is his fourth loan and he has always repaid on time. 

Zouheir is special because he sells good quality tires. His clients can be anybody from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t have a lot of cash. Zouheir decided to start his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans to expand his business by purchasing a bigger shop.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Mother Blessings #3 Group

texts.en:
Mother Blessings #3 is a group of 5 borrowers led by Mbowolee K.. They live in Kolahu, Lofa County, Liberia.  Mbowolee is 29 years old and married. She has 2 children, ages 3 and 6, and also cares for 2 children who were orphaned in the war. 

Mbowolee was unable to attend school because, although she enjoyed it, the cultural norm was for girls to rely on their husbands to provide and, therefore, school was considered unnecessary. She lives in remote Kolahu in rural Lofa County, the breadbasket of Liberia. 

Mbowolee’s business is retail dry goods, including slippers, children’s clothes, shirts, and pants, which she buys wholesale in nearby Guinea and sells in a temporary market stall on the Kolahu-Foya highway. She has run her business for 3 years and is successful because of the way she treats her customers.

She’s taking a loan to increase her inventory so she can meet increased demand. Her dream is to expand her business so she can, one day, have the biggest table in the central market. With the profits from her business, Mbowolee dreams of building her own house.

loans.use: Purchase clothes and slippers for inventory

loans.name: Ablavi Augustine

texts.fr: Cette femme est célibataire mais a un enfant à sa charge. Elle vend uniquement des tissus légers dans le marché de Hédzranamoé à Lomé ; elle exerce cette activité depuis 2003 et ceci lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins. Elle reçoit ses commandes au Ghana, le pays voisin. Elle revend ensuite ses tissus aux couturières qui la connaissent ainsi qu’à des vendeuses ambulantes de ces tissus. Actuellement elle est très sollicitée par de nombreux clients et a un réel besoin de renouveler son stock ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un prêt de WAGES pour  acheter 02 bals de tissus légers. Elle compte sur son dynamisme et sa maîtrise du marché pour vite rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
This is a woman who is unmarried but with a child in her care.  She sells exclusively light-weight fabrics at the Hédzranamoé market in Lomé. She has been in this business since 2003, and it enables her to support herself.  She receives orders from Ghana, the neighboring country.  She then resells these fabrics to dressmakers who know her, as well as to door-to-door sellers of these fabrics.  Currently, she is much in demand by numerous customers and has a real need to renew her inventory.  For this reason, she's requesting a WAGES loan to buy two bales of light-weight fabrics.  She's counting on her energy and her command of the market to repay the loan quickly.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy light-weight cloth

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther M. sells groceries like Milo, milk, sugar, canned fish and so on at Elmina near Eslem. Esther has received senior high school education. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a trader. Esther has been selling groceries since 2007. She helps with the payment of bills and school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more groceries to sell. She hopes to put the new profits from her business towards building a house.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Amélévi

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier Dabadakondji à Lomé. Elle est mariée et est mère de 04 enfants. Elle a appris la couture, mais elle a compris que c’est plus rentable pour elle  d’exercer le commerce des produits de mercerie à savoir les popelines et divers tissus. Sa boutique se situe à côté d’un grand centre d’apprentissage de la couture à Lomé, ce qui lui permet de réaliser de bonnes affaires. Elle a une clientèle bien assez fournie. Actuellement elle a besoin de renouveler une partie de son stock ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter de petits rouleaux de fils de différentes couleurs, 15 rouleaux de popelines et différents tissus de mercerie.
texts.en:
This is a lady who lives in the Dabadakondji district in Lomé. She is married and the mother of four children. She learned how to sew but has come to understand that it’s more profitable for her to do commerce in sewing supplies, namely poplins and various fabrics. Her store is located next to a large training center for sewing in Lomé, and this enables her to do a good business. She has a rather well-off customer base. Currently, she needs to renew part of her inventory; for this reason, she’s requesting a WAGES loan to buy small spools of thread of different colors, 15 rolls of poplins, and different fabrics.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia A. sells smoked fish and gari at Elmina near Eselem.  Cecilia has no educational background.  She is married and has four children. His wife is a fishmonger. Cecilia has been selling smoked fish and gari since 2004. She supports in the payment of school fees and utility bills. His loan will be used to buy more fish to sell. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to save towards her children education.

loans.use: His loan will be used to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary E. is married and has seven dependants. She has no educational background.  Mary sells cooked banku for sale. She goes to the market buys maize and processes it into banku and fry fish alongside to sell at Elmina near Boatyards, which he has been doing since 1979. His wife is a fisherman.  Mary uses his income to support in the payment of bills and settlement of school fees.  Mary will use the loan to purchase more maize to enable her prepare banku in a large quantity for sale. With the new profits from his expanded business, Mary plans to save towards building of her own house.

loans.use: Mary will use the loan to purchase more maize to enable her prepare banku in a large quantity for sale.

loans.name: Chérifatou

texts.fr: Cette dame vend depuis 2001 dans le Marché de Hédzranawoé à Lomé des chaussures de fabrication chinoise. Cette activité lui permet d’apporter sa contribution financière à son foyer pour l’éducation scolaire de leurs 03 enfants. Elle s’approvisionne auprès d’une dame qui se rend en Chine pour l’achat des chaussures en cartons. Elle revend sa marchandise le plus souvent aux vendeuses ambulantes de Hédzranawoé. Actuellement elle a besoin de renouveler son stock. Elle sollicite pour cela un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 50 cartons de chaussures de différentes gammes. Elle a l’assurance de vite rembourser son crédit à cause de sa longue expérience du marché.
texts.en:
Since 2001, this lady has been selling shoes and Chinese goods at the Hédzranawoé Market in Lomé.  This business enables her financially to do her part at home to educated their three children.  She supplies herself from a lady who goes to China to buy shoes in boxes.  She usually resells her merchandise to door-to-door saleswomen of Hédzranawoé. Currently, she needs to renew her stock.  To do so, she's requesting a WAGES loan to buy 50 boxes of shoes of different ranges.  She's certain of repaying her loan quickly because of her extensive market experience. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boxes of shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Achat de perles, de colliers, de bazins

loans.name: Maliky

texts.en: Maliky N. is married and has five dependants. He has no educational background.  Maliky sells fish. He goes to the sea and fish for himself and sells it to buyers at Elmina, which he has been doing since 2002. His wife is a fishmonger. Manlike uses his income to pay school fees and utility bills.  Maliky will use the loan to purchase fishing equipment and also to fuel his boat. With the new profits from his expanded business, Maliky plans to save towards building of his own house.

loans.use: Maliky will use the loan to purchase fishing equipment and also to fuel his boat.

loans.name: Abed Allah

texts.en:
Abed Allah is a 47 year old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, southern suburbs of Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Abed Allah has owned bakery for over ten years. He does “saj”and “mankoucheh”. The “saj” is the metal oven where you do the saj bread and the saj bread is a traditional Lebanese cooking dome used to make Markouk (“thinned”) bread and doughy confections or Mankoucheh. A mankoucheh looks like a folded pizza, most common toppings are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it anytime of the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning. Abed Allah requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase raw material for his bakery and repair his oven. This is the first time that Abed Allah has requested a loan.
Abed Allah is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients and does good mankoucheh. His clients are people from her region. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. He decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase raw material for his bakery and repair his oven.

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en:
Zahra is a 49-year-old woman who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon, with her husband and their three children. Zahra has been working as flower arrangement designer for nine years. She does flowers, trays and many different types of arrangements for all occasions. 

Zahra has requested a loan of $2000 USD from Al Majmoua to purchase merchandise and a car for her work. She will use the car for delivery. Zahra has been a microcredit client for eight years and has always repaid on time. 

Her previous loans have helped her to improve her work. Zahra is special in her work because she does it well and knows how to satisfy her clients’ needs. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. Zahra decided to start her businesses because she wanted to work independently. In the future, she plans to expand her business by opening a shop.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and a car for her work.

loans.name: Ayawavi

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier de Bè-Kpota à Lomé. Elle exerçait le commerce d’alimentation générale pour aider son mari imprimeur dans l’éducation scolaire de leurs 04 enfants. Malheureusement dans son quartier, après l’ouverture de sa boutique d’alimentation générale, deux nouvelles personnes ont également ouvert deux boutiques de ventes de produits d’alimentation générale. A cause de la forte concurrence, elle n’arrive plus à vendre. C’est pour cette raison qu'elle a pris la décision en Janvier dernier de se lancer dans la vente de planches et de chevrons. Ce commerce lui réussit en ce moment. Elle vend des quantités considérables. Elle  a besoin en ce moment de lancer une nouvelle commande au Ghana ; c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 50 planches de planches et 30 chevrons.

loans.use: Achat  de planches et chevrons

loans.name: Chafika

texts.en:
Chafika is a 54 year old widow woman who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, southern suburbs of Lebanon with her husband and their four children. Chafika has been working as a sewer. Chafika requested a loan of 700 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase thread for her work. This is the first time that Chafika has requested a loan.
Chafika is special in her business because she knows how to treat her clients and does a good job. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she didn’t have enough of cash. Chafika decided on doing her businesses because she wants to supplement her family’s income, as well as she already had a shop for her own. In the future, she plans on improving her business.

loans.use: To purchase thread for her work.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana Y. sells fish at the seashore. She smokes it and sells in Elmina, near Eselem, which she has been doing since 1994. Christiana is married. Her husband is a fisherman. She has no formal education. Christiana uses her income to support the upkeep of the house. Christiana will use this loan to purchase more fish for processing and sale. Christiana plans to save the new profits from her expanded business to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase more fish for processing and sale

loans.name: Anas

texts.en:
Anas is a 28-year-old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Anas has owned laundry for over a year. Anas is requesting a loan of $1500 USD from A. Majmoua to purchase a new dry cleaning machine. This is the first time that Anas has requested a loan.

Anas is speciA. in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he had difficulty paying the rent for his laundry shop. He decided to start his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans to expand his business by opening another laundry.

loans.use: To purchase a new dry cleaning machine.

loans.name: Akouwa

texts.fr: Cette dame vend en gros une boisson alcoolisée très appréciée de la population dénommée « sodabi ». Elle a débuté son activité en 2008 dans le quartier de Bè-Kpota à Lomé ; actuellement elle dispose d’un nombre important de clients, et approvisionne même les bars et restaurants de la place. Elle vend aussi des bidons de sodabi à des vendeuses de détail de cette boisson populaire. Elle doit renouveler en ce moment son stock ; pour cela elle voudrait avoir un crédit de WAGES pour commander 50 bidons de « sodabi » ; le reste du prêt lui servira à couvrir ses frais de transport vers le Bénin, le pays voisin où elle s’approvisionne. Cette femme est mariée et est mère d’un enfant. Elle est fière de ce commerce qui lui réussit en ce moment.
texts.en:
This lady is a wholesale seller of an alcoholic drink called "sodabi" that is much appreciated by the population.  She started her business in 2008 in the Bè-Kpota district in Lomé; currently, she has a significant number of customers and even supplies local bars and restaurants.  She also sells drums of sodabi to retailers of this popular drink.  She must renew her stock now;  to do so, she would like to obtain a WAGES loan to order 50 drums of sodabi;  the rest of the loan will be used to cover the costs of transport to Benin, the neighboring country where she stocks up.  This is a married woman who is the mother of one child.  She is proud of this business, which is successful for her right now.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy containers of alcoholic drinks

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: Cynthia O. sells fish. She buys fish at the seashore, smokes it and sells in Elmina, near Eselem. Cynthia is married and has four children. Her husband is a fish monger. Cynthia has been selling smoked fish since 1999. She has no formal education. She helps her husband with the payment of bills and settlement of school fees. Her loan will enable her to buy more fish to be processed as smoked fish, then sold. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy fish for smoked fish processing and sale

loans.name: Akouvi Essé

texts.fr: Cette dame n’est pas mariée et n’a aucun enfant à sa charge. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenus la vente de sacs et chaussures. C’est une vendeuse ambulante ; et elle exerce ce commerce dans le quartier de Hédzranawoé à Lomé. Cette vente lui permet de satisfaire tous ses besoins et de faire des projections pour l’avenir. Actuellement elle arrive à écouler tous ses stocks car elle dispose d’un large éventail de clientèles. Pour lancer une nouvelle commande au Grand Marché de Lomé, elle sollicite un prêt de WAGES pour acheter 10 cartons de sacs de différentes catégories et 20 cartons de chaussures. Ce prêt lui sera aussi une opportunité pour louer une boutique pour la vente sur place.
texts.en:
This is a lady who is not married and has no children at all to support.  Her income-generating business involves selling bags and shoes.  She is an itinerant salesperson; and she operates in the Hédzranawoé district in Lomé.  Her sales enable her to support herself entirely and to make plans for the future.  Currently, she's managing to sell all of her inventory because she has a wide range of customers.  To initiate a new order at the Grand Market of Lomé, she's requesting a WAGES loan to buy 10 boxes of bags of different categories and 20 boxes of shoes.  This loan will also allow her the opportunity to lease a store for making sales locally.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boxes of bags and shoes

loans.name: Rabab

texts.en: Rabab is a young married woman who lives with her husband and five children in the city of Nablus in Palestine. She sells women clothes. Rabab wants her children to get a good education to have a better chance to succeed in the future. This is what makes her sacrifice worthwhile. She needs a loan of $1200 to buy more and different types of clothes to expand her business.She is grateful for your kindness. Support her!

loans.use: Buy clothes and expand her business

loans.name: Tossou Kokou

texts.fr: Cet homme a investi depuis 2005 le marché très prisé de la vente de boissons locales appelées « sodabi ». Il vend cette boisson dans son quartier Kégué à Lomé où il a beaucoup de clients qui lui sont fidèles. Cette activité lui permet surtout de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Il reçoit même des commandes de la part des bars et restaurants de Lomé. Actuellement dans sa boutique les étalages sont presque vides ; c’est pour cela qu’il sollicite un crédit de WAGES  pour acheter 30 bidons de Sodabi. Il compte sur sa maîtrise du matché pour vite rembourser le prêt dans les délais impartis. Il est célibataire et sans enfant.
texts.en:
In 2005, this man invested in the very popular market of selling a local drink called sodabi. He sells this drink in his district of Kégué in Lomé, where he has many customers loyal to him. This business enables him in particular to provide for his family. He even receives orders from bars and restaurants in Lomé. Right now, the shelves are nearly bare in his shop; this is why he’s requesting a WAGES loan to buy 30 drums of sodabi. He is counting on his mastery of the market in order to repay the loan quickly within the given time frame. He is unmarried and has no children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy alcoholic beverages

loans.name: Maame Esua

texts.en: Maame Esua E. sells red, red, she boils beans and fries plantain for sale at Elmina near Eselem.  Maame Esua has no educational background.  He is single and has two children. Maame Esua has been selling red, red since 1999.She is responsible for paying of school fees and utility bills. His loan will be used to buy more beans and plantain in large quantity to increase the quantity of food she cooks and sells. He hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards her children education.

loans.use: His loan will be used to buy more beans and plantain in large quantity to increase the quantity of food she cooks and sells.

loans.name: Muneer

texts.en:
Muneer operates a grocery store in his neighborhood.He is 58 years old and a father of four kids who are currently in school.He sells products like rice,canned foods and drinks,candies,evaporated milk, etc. 
The money he is asking for will be invested in buying more merchandise for his store ,in turn,will allow him to provide better services to his customers.He thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: buying more merchandise for his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat de charbon de bois

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase wood charcoal.

loans.name: Jorge Joaquim

texts.pt:
Jorge Joaquim A. nasceu no distrito da Moamba, província de Maputo, de 44 anos de idade, casado e pai de 4 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 5 e 16 anos que freqüentam escola na vila do distrito de Boane. Fez o nível superior em metodologias de ensino da língua Portuguesa. Para alem dos filhos, não sustenta mais ninguém.

Cresceu na companhia dos seus progenitores, no distrito da Moamba, e saiu juntamente com os seus pais que trabalham na empresa publica dos caminhos de ferro de Moçambique.
Jorge é funcionário do estado moçambicano exercendo as funções de docência numa das escolas do distrito de boane. Recebe mensalmente 24.000,00MT que aplica no sustento da família, pagamento de uma empregada domestica e pagamento de escola para os filhos. Vive na casa própria e a sua esposa não trabalha, sofre de uma doença a crônica há bastante tempo.

Já teve empréstimo num Banco comercial (BIM) no valor não estimado para construção de muro de vedação do seu espaço habitacional. Após a conclusão, aproxima se a Hluvuku-Adsema solicitando 20.000,00MT para compra de material de construção de casa de alvenaria (rebocar a casa e fazer outros acabamentos). prefere um empréstimo com a Hluvuku-Adsema por oferecer o juro mais baixo da praça e com modalidade flexível de pagamento de credito.

Propõe se a reembolsar sem problemas para poder aceder a mais empréstimos com objectivo de compra de uma viatura para transporte pessoal.
texts.en:
Jorge Joaquim A. was born in Moamba in the province of Maupto. He is 44 years old, married and has 4 children between the ages of 5 and 16. His children go to school in Boane. He attended college to become a Portuguese language teacher. Other than his children, he does not support any other family members. He grew up with his parents in Moamba and he often went to work with his parents, who worked for a public company in Mozambique. Jorge works for the Mozambique government, carrying out his functions as a teacher in the Boane school district. He earns 24.000,00MT each month that allows him to support his family, pay for a helper around the house, and pay for his children’s schooling. He lives in his own home and his wife does not work, as she suffers from a chronic illness. Jorge already had a loan with a commercial bank (BIM) to build a retaining wall near his home. After he was finished, he approached Hluvuku-Adsema for a loan of 20.000,00MT to purchase materials for a adding bricks to the exterior of his home. He prefers Hluvuku-Adsema because they offer a lower interest rate and a flexible repayment schedule. He pledges to repay the loan without problems in order to qualify for more loans in the future. His goal is to purchase a vehicle for personal transport.

Translated from Portuguese by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construction materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: stockage de de marchandises en alimentation générale

loans.name: Ancha Vasco

texts.pt:
Ancha Vasco C. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, tem 35 anos de idade, solteira maior e vive numa casa cedida pelos serviços juntamente com três irmãs que estão sob sua responsabilidade. Nunca teve marido. Estudou ate 12 classe e as irmãs também estudam a sua custa. Também se responsabiliza pela sua mãe que vive na província de Gaza, enviando dinheiro.

Ancha cresceu na companhia dos pais em maputo e mais tarde a sua mãe passou a viver na província de Gaza, onde ela também deslocara no ano de 1986 e tendo regressado vinte anos mais tarde juntamente com as 3 irmãs para o distrito de boane.
É dactilografa na Administração regional das Águas (ARA, sul) recebendo 7.000,00MT.
Antes de trabalhar nesta empresa publica, fez trabalhos na Emissora provincial da Radio Moçambique durante seis anos exercendo as mesmas funções.

Este é o seu segundo empréstimo com a Hluvuku-Adsema no valor de 17.000,00MT para compra de cimento, ferro, pedra e outro material de construção de uma casa de alvenaria. O credito anterior foi para compra de bens de consumo, graças às informações obtidas através de colegas.

Propõe se a pagar o empréstimo sem problemas para poder aceder a mais créditos com objectivo de concluir a sua casa. Sonha, no futuro mais breve, casar e retornar a escola para fazer o nível superior.
texts.en:
Ancha Vasco C. was born in the city of Maputo. She is 35 years old, single and lives in a home that was provided by social services for her and her 3 sisters, whom she cares for. She has never been married. She studied until 12th grade and she also pays for her sisters’ schooling. She also sends money to her mother, who lives in Gaza province. Ancha grew up with her parents in Maputo and later her mother moved to Gaza, where Ancha also moved in 1986. Twenty years later she and her 3 sisters moved back to Boane. She is a typist for the Regional Water Administration (ARA in Portuguese), and receives 7.000,00MT per month. Before she began working for this public company, she worked for Radio Mozambique for six years, in the same capacity. This is her second loan with Hluvuku-Adsema for 17.000,00MT. She will use the money to buy cement, steel, rocks and other materials needed to build a brick home. Her previous loan was used for household items, thanks to information she received from coworkers. She pledges to pay this loan with no problems so she will qualify for loans in the future. In the near future she would like to get married and return to school to attend college.

Translated from Portuguese by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construction materials

loans.name: Ricardo Orlando

texts.pt:
Ricardo nasceu na Província de Inhambane (530 km a norte de Maputo) tem 37 anos de idade, casado e pai de 5 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 1 e 12 anos. Somente o filho mais novo é que não freqüenta escola. Estudou ate 5 classe, tendo parado devido à falta de condições por parte dos seus pro genitores. Para dos filhos e esposa, não sustenta mais ninguém e vive na casa própria.

Saiu de Inhambane a maputo juntamente com seus irmãos mais velhos a procura de melhores condições de vida. Vive no distrito de boane há 8 anos. Foi neste distrito que aprendeu a fazer pequenos negócios, como forma de ganhar dinheiro para sobrevivência. Vende roupa nova que compra na áfrica do sul (calcas e fatos para homens). Compra, por exemplo, um fato a 870.00MT e revende a 1.200,00MT. Consegue vender peças de roupas equivalentes a 16.000,00MT por mês.

Já foi cliente de TCHUMA (instituição homologa concorrente e primeira a se estabelecer em boane). Teve informações sobre a Hluvuku-Adsema através de amigos que lhe falaram das vantagens de juros baixos e flexibilidade de calendário de reembolso. Este é o primeiro credito do Ricardo no valor de 15.000,00MT para compra e venda de roupas novas.

Propõe se a pagar o credito sem problemas para poder a ceder a mais empréstimos com objectivo de concluir a sua obra e comprar uma viatura para transporte pessoal e carga diversa.
texts.en:
Ricardo was born in Inhambane province (530 km north of Maputo). He is 37 years old, married and is the father of 5 children between the ages of 1 and 12. All of his children except the baby attend school. He studied until the 5th grade and stopped due to the financial situation of his family. Aside from his wife and kids, he is not responsible for other family members and he lives in his own home. He left Inhambane for Maputo with his older brothers to seek out a better life. He has lived in the Boane district for 8 years. It was in this area that he learned how to do small jobs as a way of earning money to survive. He sells new clothes that he purchases in South Africa (pants and swimwear). For example, he buys a swimsuit for 870MT and resells it for 1,200MT. He earns about 16,000MT per month with this business. He has already been a client of TCHUMA (a similar loan institution in Boane). He heard about Hluvuku-Adsema through friends that told him about the advantages of a low interest rate and a flexible repayment schedule. This is Ricardo’s first loan [with Hluvuku-Adsema] and it is for 15,000MT to buy more clothing. He pleges to repay this loan without problems so that he will qualify for more loans in the future. He would like to eventually purchase a vehicle for transportation and hauling various cargo.

Translated from Portuguese by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Arfino

texts.pt:
Arfino C. nasceu na província de Nampula (2.800 km a norte de maputo) tem 35 anos de idade, casado e pai de três filhos compreendidos entre dois e seis anos. Somente o mais velho estuda na 2 classe. 
Arfino estudou ate 6 classe tendo parado quando foi chamado para cumprir o serviço militar obrigatório. Treinou na província de Cabo Delgado e nos finais de 1999 foi transferido para província de Maputo no distrito de Boane.

Passou a disponibilidade no ano de 2007 e começou a trabalhar como segurança na empresa de construção civil (C.M. C) onde recebe 3.500,00MT por mês. Vive na casa própria na vila de boane com sua família. Com o salário consegue alimentar a família e poupar um pouco na sua conta bancaria.

Conheceu a hluvuku através de amigos e outros vizinhos, também clientes da instituição.
Este é o terceiro empréstimo do arfino com a Hluvuku-Adsema no valor de 15.000,00MT para compra de material de construção de casa de alvenaria (cimento, barrotes e outros materiais). Os outros dois créditos foram também para o mesmo propósito nos valores de 7.000,00MT e 12.000,00MT, respectivamente.

Propõe a pagar o empréstimo sem problemas para poder aceder a mais créditos com objectivo de concluir a casa de alvenaria e iniciar um negocio.
texts.en:
Arfino C. was born in the province of Nampula (2,800 km north of Maputo) he is 35 years old, he is married and has 3 children who are between 2 and 6 years old. Just the oldest one studies 2nd grade. Arfino studied until the 6th grade and had to stop because of obligatory military service. He trained in the province of Cabo Delgado by the end of 1999 he was transferred to the province of Maputo in the district of Boane. He finished his service in 2007 and started to work as a security officer at a construction company where he receives 3,500MT a month. He lives at his own house in the village of Boane with his family. With his salary he is able to support his family and is able to save a little in his bank account. He learns about Hluvuku thru a friends and neighbors who are clients of the institution. This is Arfino's third loan with Hluvuku-Adsema for the amount of 15,000MT to buy construction material for his masonry house (cement, columns, and other materials). The other two loans were also used for construction and were for 7,000MT and 12,000MT respectively. He expects to pay the loan without any problem and access more credit in order to finish his house and start a business.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Los Alamos De La Estacion Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal se llama “LOS ALAMOS DE LA ESTACION”, este banco está situado en la provincia de Quispicanchis en la comunidad campesina de Urcos, perteneciente al departamento de Cusco.

Nuestros socios son naturales de Urcos, ellos alternan sus actividades del hogar con la agricultura, ellos cultivan, papas en todas sus variedades, maíz, alcachofas, hortalizas, verduras; también se dedican a la ganadería, compran animales mayores y menores, para el engorde y reproducción de los mismos así lo venden a mejor precio. Algunas socias venden comida en el mercado central, aprovechando que este mercado es un paso obligado para los que se dirigen a las ciudades de Puno y Arequipa, nuestros socios desean el préstamo para poder invertir en sus cultivos, puesto que este mes es destinado para la siembra, ellos ararán las tierras para poder fertilizarlas y abonarlas y proseguir al sembrío de los diferentes productos que se cosecharán en el mes de febrero y marzo.

Nuestros socios agradecen el préstamo otorgado y se comprometen en cumplir con el pago total de su deuda en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
This bank is called “The Poplars of the Station” and it is located in the farming community of Urcos, Quispicanchis Province, Cuzco Department.

Our members are natives of Urcos who alternate their activities between home and agriculture. They cultivate potatoes of all varieties, corn, garden crops, vegetables, and they raise livestock, buy large and small animals, for fattening and reproduction, then sell them for profit. Some members sell food in the central market, benefiting from the location of the market along the obligatory route between Puno and Arequipa.

Our members desire this loan to invest in their crops. Since this is the month of sewing, they are plowing their fields in order to fertilize and spread manure for the planting of various crops that will be harvested in the months of February and March.

Our members appreciate the loan and promise to pay it off in the time prescribed.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: INVEST IN PRODUCTION OF NEW SEASONAL CROPS

loans.name: Joane Soquissane

texts.pt:
Joane nasceu na província de inhambane, distrito de panda (onde opera a maior companhia de gás natural), tem 39 anos de idade e é pai de três filhos com idades compreendidas entre 4 e 10 anos que estudam na escola publica local. Estudou ate 7 classe e tendo interrompido forcosamente para cumprir o serviço militar Obrigatório.
Vive somente com a esposa e filhos na casa própria. Tem mandado algum valor para a mãe que vive na cidade de maputo.

Saiu de Panda (inhambane) em 1987 para a cidade de xai-xai, onde cumpriu o serviço militar obrigatório e quatro anos depois passou a disponibilidade. Foi afecto na empresa de caminhos de ferro de Moçambique, onde trabalha ate então como acertador da linha ferra. Para alem de trabalhar para a empresa, joane e a esposa dedicam se a venda de produtos de primeira necessidade (oleio, maionese, açúcar, farinha de milho, bebidas e outros) num estabelecimento comercial próprio. 

Aprendeu a fazer negocio com amigos ha. 19 anos e vende mais oleio alimentar obtendo um lucro mensal de 10.000,00MT. Adquire o produto localmente. Na sua empresa recebe 7.500,00MT, como salário mensal, que aplica no sustento da família e pagamento de credito. Nunca teve créditos com outros bancos.

Este é o quarto empréstimo de joane no valor de 12.000,00MT para compra e venda de produtos de primeira necessidade. Os anteriores créditos foram de 5.200,00MT, 8.000,00MT e 9.000,00MT todos para a mesma actividade e pagos sem problemas. Propõe se apagar o credito o mais urgente possível para poder aceder a mais empréstimos com objectivo de ampliar o seu estabelecimento comercial.
texts.en:
Joane was born in the province of Inhambane in the district of Panda (where the largest natural gas company operates). He is 39 and is the father of three children, whose ages range from 4 to 10 years old. They study in the local public scool. He studied until seventh grade but inevitably had to stop to fulfill his obligatory military service. He lives with his wife and children in their own home. He has sent some money to his mother, who lives in the city of Maputo. He left Panda (and Inhambane) in 1987 to go to the city of Xai-Xai, where he fulfilled his obligatory military service, and four years later, he was able to leave the service. He now works for a train company in Mozambique. In addition to working for this company, Joane and his wife sell basic goods (oil, mayonnaise, sugar, corn flour, beverages, etc.) in their own location. He learned to run his business from friends 19 years ago. He sells mostly cooking oil and earns monthly wages of 10,000 Mozambique meticais. He acquires his product locally. In his company, he received a monthly salary of 7,500 meticais, which he uses to feed his family and will use to make his payments. He has never had credits from another bank. This is Joane's fourth loan, and it is in the amount of 12,000 meticais. He will use it to buy basic goods to sell. His previous credits were for 5200, 8000, and 9000 meticais, which were all for the same activity and were paid back without any problems. He proposes to pay his credit back as soon as possible to be able to receive more loans with the objective of expanding his location.

Translated from Portuguese by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell merchandise (cooking oil, beverages, etc.)

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Maria de los Angeles R. tiene 25 años de edad. Ella es una joven esforzada que desde sus 10 años de edad tuvo que empezar a trabajar en la elaboración y venta de refrescos. Ella es una madre soltera que a través de esta actividad ha logrado mantener a su pequeña hija, además ha podido hacerle algunas mejoras a su vivienda. El financiamiento que Maria solicita es con el único motivo de comprar materia prima y aumentar sus ventas, ya que por la inflación de la moneda cada día las cosas están mas inalcanzables y su hija va creciendo lo que le mueve a hacer mejor y mas auto sostenible su negocio, pues su sueño siempre ha sido que su hija logre lo que ella no pudo.
texts.en:
Maria de los Angeles R. is 25. She is a hard working young woman. Since she was ten years old she had to start working by making and selling soft drinks. She is a single mother, and through this work she has supported her small daughter. She has also been able to make some improvements to her house. The loan that Maria is asking for is to buy raw material to increase her sales. The inflation of money makes things more unattainable every day. Her daughter is growing, which moves her to do better and to make her business self-sustainable. Her dream has always been for her daughter to achieve what she could not.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Filomena

texts.pt:
Filomena nasceu na província central de Sofala, de 53 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 4 filhos todos com mais de 18 anos. Estudou ate 4 classe, no tempo colonial português e tendo parado por falta de condições financeiras por parte dos progenitores.
Vive somente com os filhos e sem ninguém na sua responsabilidade financeira.

Saiu de Sofala no ano de 1978 com o marido para Maputo. Filomena foi militar e saiu da tropa no ano de 1981com direito a pensão no valor de 5.500,00MT que aplica no sustento da família e construção da sua casa de alvenaria, não consegue poupar.
Filomena ouviu falar da Hluvuku-Adsema através de amigas e outros vizinhos que lhe encorajaram no sentido de contraiu empréstimo para acelerar com a construção da sua casa. Nunca teve empréstimos em bancos. Este vai ser o primeiro empréstimo no valor de 10.000,00MT para compra de cimento, areia e pedra para avançar com outra fase se construção na sua casa.

Propõe se a pagar o empréstimo sem problemas para poder aceder a mais empréstimos e sonha ver a sua casa terminada e sua família confortada.
texts.en:
Filomena was born in Sofala, in central Mozambique. She is a 53 year old single mom of 4, all of them over 18. She finished 4th grade during the Portuguese colonial times, and had to drop school because of her parents financial problems. She lives with her children and no one helps her financially. Filomena was in the military, and when she retired in 1981 she earned a pension in the value of 5.500,00MT (around U$ 180) per month, money that she uses to support her family and build her house, and she is not able to save any money. Filomena heard of Hluvuku-Adsema from friends and other neighbors that incentivated her to apply for a loan, in order to finish the work on her house. She has never borrowed money from banks. This is going to be her first loan, in the amount of $350 to buy cement, sand and rocks. She dreams of seeing her house finished, and her family living there comfortably.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction supplies (concrete, rock, sand)

loans.name: Jiguiseme. Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe Jiguiseme sont mariés avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans  et 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles polygames à Kaboïla  dans la commune  du même nom, 3ème région administrative du Mali (Sikasso). 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur vingtième  prêt solidaire  tous les passés  se sont  bien dénoués. Elles font comme activité entre autres  la vente de tissus, du sounbala,  des layettes etc.
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 5 emballages de tissus, 5 sacs de graine de néré pour en faire du sounbala et 10 bobines de laine pour faire des layettes. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages de la commune de kaboïla. Elles vendent à domicile, dans les différents quartiers de Sikasso au comptant, souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 40.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Certaines d’entre elles comptent acheter un terrain à usage d’habitation à Sikasso ville et d’autres d’acheter un âne et une charrette pour le transport de leurs marchandises.

loans.use: Achat d’articles divers.

loans.name: Sousa Helena

texts.pt:
Sousa Helena M. nasceu na província de Maputo, distrito de Boane, tem 33 anos de idade, casado e pai de 2 filhos de doze e catorze anos de idades. Estudou ate 6 classe. Parou de estudar quando teve que começar a trabalhar e não consegue conciliar as duas actividades. Vive com a esposa e filhos na casa própria e ainda sustenta a sua mãe que vive na cidade de maputo. A esposa faz pequenos negócios para incremento da renda familiar.

Sousa nasceu, cresceu e vive em boane e é pedreiro profissional afecto na empresa publica de Administração Regional das Águas (ARA, sul) há mais de 14 anos e recebe mensalmente 2.452,00MT. Tem feito prestação de serviços de pedreiro para terceiros residentes da sua zona nos finais de semana, como forma de ganhar mais dinheiro.
Ganha de biscates cerca de 3.000,00MT por mês e ate consegue poupar algum dinheiro na sua conta bancaria.

Nunca teve créditos em outros bancos e este é o segundo empréstimo do Sousa na Hluvuku-Adsema no valor de 10.000,00MT para compra de material de construção de casa de alvenaria (cimento, pedra e barrotes). O primeiro credito foi de 6.000,00MT com o mesmo propósito.
Propõe se a pagar o empréstimo sem problemas para poder aceder a mais créditos. Quer ver a sua casa finalizada para sonhar em outros projectos.
texts.en:
Sousa Helena M. was born in Maputo, district of Boane, in Mozambique. He is 33 years old, married with two children aged 12 and 14. He finished 6th grade but had to drop school to get a job. He lives with his wife and children and supports his mother who lives in Maputo. His wife does some occasional work to help with household expenses. Sousa has been working as a construction worker for the same company for 14 years and makes 2.452,00MT (about U$90) per month. He also does construction jobs in the weekends for people in his neighborhood, in order to make more money. He makes around 3.000,00MT (about U$ 110) per month with freelance work and he is even able to save some money. This is Sousa's second loan from Hluvuku-Adsema, and he asks for $375 in order to buy construction supplies (cement, rocks). His first loan was in the amount of $218 for the same reason . He wants to finish his house so he can work in other projects.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction supplies (concrete, rock, sand)

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est marié et a 02 enfants à sa charge. Pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, il s’est lancé en 2006 dans le commerce des planches. Cette activité lui permet de réaliser de très bonnes affaires grâce aux relations qu’il a tissées avec plusieurs chantiers d’ameublement à Lomé. Il fait de telle sorte qu’en cas de pénurie de planches à Lomé, il en dispose toujours des réserves. C’est pour constituer une nouvelle réserve en stock qu’il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour commander 50 planches. Actuellement cet homme dispose d’un bon réseau de distribution pour vite rembourser son prêt. Son honnêteté fait que ses clients ont toujours confiance en lui ; il tient toujours ses engagements.

loans.use: Achat de planches

loans.name: Kotognogontala Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe Kotognogontala (composé de 3 femmes mariées et de 2 veuves) avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent majoritairement dans des  familles polygames à Kaboïla  dans la commune rurale  du même nom relevant de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur vingtième  prêt solidaire et tous les passés se sont bien dénoués. Elles font  toutes  la vente de tasses en plastiques, de sounbala et du charbon de bois. 
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 4 douzaines de tasses en plastiques, 5 sacs de graine de néré pour en faire du sounbala et 80 sacs de charbons de bois . Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages de la commune de kaboïla.  Elles vendent au comptant, en détail souvent à crédit, aux marchés et à domicile  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 37.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Certaines d’entre elles comptent acheter un terrain à usage d’habitation à Sikasso ville et d’autres d’acheter un âne et une charrette pour le transport de leur marchandises.

loans.use: Achat d’articles divers.

loans.name: Romao Luis

texts.pt:
Romão Luis B. nasceu na provincial de inahmbane no distrito de Zavala, tem 45 anos de idade, casado e pai de 3 filhos com idades compreendidos entre 16 e 22 anos dois dos quais freqüentam escola. Estudou ate 7 classe tendo parado para começar a trabalhar ainda muito cedo devido à falta de condições financeiras por parte dos seus progenitores. Vivem com a esposa, filhos e enteada na casa própria no distrito de boane.
