Mudou se de inhambane para maputo em casa dos tios no ano de 1981, sozinho, com intuito de encontrar melhores condições de vida. Logo conseguiu emprego e casou se no ano de 1992. Neste momento é funcionário do estado desempenhando as funções de dactilografo há mais de 23 anos. Recebe mensalmente 2.895,00MT, como salário. Aplica no sustento da família, construção da casa e pagamento de credito.

A esposa faz trabalhos caseiros. Este é o terceiro empréstimo do Romão com a instituição no valor de 10.000,00MT para compra de material de construção (cimento, barrotes e outros materiais) de uma casa de alvenaria.
Os primeiros créditos foram para o mesmo propósito nos valores de 3.000,00MT e 6.000,00MT, respectivamente.

Nunca tinha recebido credito em outros bancos e propõe se a pagar o presente empréstimo, tal como os outros passados, sem problemas para poder aceder a mais créditos. Sonha ver a casa finalizada.
texts.en:
Romão Luis B. was born in Inahmbane in the district of Zavale. He is 45 years old, married and a father of three children between the ages 16 and 22, two of them students. He finished 7th grade but had to drop school to start working and help his parents. He lives with his wife, children and stepdaughter at their house in the district of Boane. He left Inhambane for Maputo in 1981 and lived with his uncle and aunt, trying to find better life conditions. Soon after that he got a job and got married in 1992. He's been working as a typist for over 23 years, and makes 2.895,00 (about U$105) per month. With this money he supports his family, builds his house and pays loans. This is Romão's third loan, in the amount of $375, which he'll use to buy construction supplies. His first loans were for the same purpose, in the amounts of $110 and $220. He's committed to pay this loan like he's paid the ones in the past. He dreams of seeing his house finished.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction supplies (concrete, rock, sand)

loans.name: Michael

texts.es:
Michael es chofer asalariado de trufi 88 del sindicato Eduardo Abaroa, grupo  Correcaminos y también trabaja como taxista en las noches con movilidad propia siendo estas actividades su fuente de ingreso con la que cubre la manutención de su  hija pequeña que depende de el; es casado y su esposa no cuenta con un trabajo, vive en alquiler en una casa ubicada en la Zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para el mantenimiento de su taxi y así poder mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Michael.
texts.en:
Michael is a salaried driver of Trufi 88 (a trufi is a taxi with a fixed route) for the Eduardo Abaroa union, Roadrunner group. He also works as a taxi driver at night, but not on a fixed route. These activities are his source of income, which covers the support of his small daughter who is dependent upon him. He is married, and his wife does not have a job. They live in a rented house in the Tembladerani region of the city of La Paz. The loan is for maintenance of his taxi. That way he can improve his income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cost of maintenance of his taxi

loans.name: G.s. Las Flores Gonzalez Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Las F. González está conformado por Julia Maria González F. y Lilliam del Carmen González F.. Ambas tienen diferentes actividades económicas. Doña Julia se dedica a la venta de ropa, y lo hace con mucho esfuerzo para mantener a su familia. Lilliam se dedica a la venta de tortillas. Hace más de 18 años que se dedica a este negocio. En cambio Julia tiene 20 años que se dedica a este negocio pero le gustaría trabajar más horas y así generar ingresos para su familia. El financiamiento que solicitan es para capital de trabajo ya que ambos necesitan invertir en sus negocios. El sueño de ambas es salir adelante con sus negocios y lograr grandes mejorías en sus viviendas.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en: Matilda is forty-eight years old. She is widowed and has given birth to six children, a son and five daughters, who are all in school. She works very hard to be able to provide for the family. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Konongo in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She is a baker. She bakes bread that she supplies to retailers, supermarket stores, and beverage sellers in her community. Matilda buys her raw materials in Kumasi at moderate prices. She has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour

loans.name: Lafia Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Lafia sont toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et 3 enfants. Elles  vivent dans des  familles monogames à Kamalen Sirakoro I’ un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur onzième  prêt solidaire, tous les passés ont été bien remboursés.  Elles font la vente de tasses, de pomme de terre, de  condiments alimentaires, de pommes  et de tissus.
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 10 colis de tasses, 15 sacs de pomme de terre, 20 cartons de pomme, des condiments alimentaires et 20 pièces de pagne wax.
Elles s’approvisionnent à Bamako et dans le grand marché de Sikasso ville et  vendent à domicile, dans  les différents marchés de Sikasso au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes, d’hommes et de quelques  forains.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Certaines d’entre elles ambitionnent d’aider leur mari dans la prise en charge des enfants et d’autres pour acheter une moto pour leur déplacement.
texts.en:
The women of the Lafia group are all married and have an average age of 33 and on average, 3 children. They live in monogamous families in Kamalen Sirakoro I, one of the neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of Mali.

They work together with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution so as to satisfy the needs of their clientele, and they are on the 11th solidarity loan, all past loans having been reimbursed correctly. They sell basins, potatoes, condiments, apples and fabrics.

With their new loan, they intend to buy 10 packs of basins, 15 sacks of potatoes, 20 cartons of apples, some condiments, and 20 lengths of African “wax cloth”.

They do their buying in Bamako and in the big market of Sikasso town and they sell out of their homes and in the various marketplaces of Sikasso, for cash, retail, and for credit to a clientele composed of women, men, and some itinerant merchants. They expect to make a monthly average profit of 35,000 F CFA, of which a part will be used for savings and family needs and the rest invested back into their businesses.

Some of them aspire to help their husbands in supporting the children; others hope to buy a motorbike to use as transport.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale

loans.name: Afivi

texts.fr: Afivi est une dame qui a appris la couture mais qui s’est spécialisée dans les surfilages et les plinthes. La situation géographique de son atelier de couture est localisée dans le quartier de Kégué à Lomé. Elle a débuté cette activité depuis 2000 et elle est très connue de beaucoup de personnes. Aussi, profite-t-elle pour vendre certains articles de mercerie comme les popelines, les vicelines, les rubans, des fils à coudre. Elle a besoin actuellement de renouveler quelques articles manquants ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle voudrait un crédit de WAGES pour acheter des fils de surfilage et des fils de plinthe. Cette femme est mariée et mère de 04 enfants.

loans.use: Achat des fils de surfilage et des fils de plinthe

loans.name: Cristina Jose

texts.pt:
Cristina nasceu na cidade de Maputo, têm 35 anos de idade, casado e mãe dois filhos de dois e sete anos de idade. O mais velho freqüenta escola. Freqüenta segundo ano no Instituto de formação de Professores Primários a distancia. O marido é motorista e vive na casa própria no distrito de boane, bairro Mussubluluko, sem ninguém mais sob sua responsabilidade.

Mudou se para boane no ano de 2006 com seu marido e passou a viver apenas com seu marido (vivia em casa dos sogros). Trabalha como auxiliar administrativa na Escola primaria local há mais de 9 anos com salário mensal de 2.373,00MT. Feitas as despesas domesticas, consegue poupar algum valor com os colegas num circuito rotativo de poupança e credito obrigatório (xitique).

Através de vizinhos e outros colegas clientes, teve informações sobre as actividades da Hluvuku-Adsema e tendo aproximado, solicitado e pago os primeiros dois empréstimos de 1.500,00MT e 1.800,00MT para compra de bens de consumo (eletrodomésticos).

Já tinha se beneficiado de 2 empréstimos em outras instituições (ex-GGLS, actual FDM) nos valores de 10.300,00MT e 12.000,00MT, respectivamente para habitação (compra de material de construção de casa de alvenaria). Pagou sem problemas, apenas reclamou o juro alto.

Com o presente credito de 10.000,00MT pretende continuar com a construção da sua casa, comprando cimento e outros materiais para finalizar a obra.
Propõe se a pagar o empréstimo sem problemas e sonha com mais créditos para compra de mais bens de consumo
texts.en:
Cristina was born in the city of Maputo, is 35, and is married. She is the mother of two children, who are 2 and 7. The oldest one goes to school and is in her second year in primary school. Cristina's husband is a driver, and they live in their own home in the district of Boane, in the neighborhood of Mussubluluk. They aren't financially responsible for anyone else besides their children. Cristina moved to Boane in 2006 to live with her husband (they used to live in her inlaws' home). She has worked as an administrative assistant in the local primary school for 9 months and has a monthly salary of 2,373 meticais. Due to her living expenses, she is saving some money along the other members of her bank. She learned about Hluvuku-Adsema through other members and neighbors. Her first two loans were for 1,500 and 1,800 meticais so she could purchase products (household appliances). She has has two loans from other institutions (for construction materials to build a house out of bricks). She paid them back without any problems and barely complained about the high interest rate. With this current credit of 10,000 meticais, she will continue with construction on her home and will buy cement and other materials to finalize it. She proposes to pay back this loan without any problems and dreams about having more credits to buy more goods.

Translated from Portuguese by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction material (cement, stone, and sand)

loans.name: Adzo

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée à un enseignant d’une école primaire et privée de la capitale. Le couple a 02 enfants à sa charge. Les ressources financières du mari n’arrivant plus à couvrir tous les besoins financiers du foyer, cette dame a pris la décision en 2003 de vendre des produits de quincaillerie dans une boutique louée à Hédzranawoé. Cette activité lui permet désormais d’apporter sa contribution financière au foyer. Sa longue expérience du domaine fait qu’elle est à présent connue de beaucoup de clients. Elle réalise ces temps-ci de très bonnes affaires. Elle a un besoin pressant de renouveler certains articles ; c’est pourquoi elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 15 kg  cloues, 50 contre-plaqués, 25 pinceaux, plusieurs boîtes de peintures en poudre et 20 peintures huiles.
texts.en:
This woman is married to a teacher in a private primary school in the capital. The couple is raising two children. The husband's financial resources are not sufficient to support the family, so, in 2003, the lady decided to sell hardware in a rented shop in Hédzranawoé.

This business allows her to contribute to household expenses. Her long experience in this field means that she now has lots of customers. At this time, her business is going well. She urgently needs to replenish certain items, and that is why she is asking WAGES for a loan to buy 15 kg of nails, 50 pieces of plywood, 25 brushes, several tins of powdered paint, and 20 of oil paint.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of hardware items for re-sale

loans.name: Mougnou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Mougnou est constitué de  sept femmes mariées   ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et  2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à KAMELEN SIRAKORO  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur troisième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dont le but  est de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de  condiments,  de chaussures,   des poissons,  de l’essence etc.  
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter,  25 paniers de condiments, 40 paires de chaussures et 20 cartons de poissons. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages environnants. 
Les marchandises sont vendues au marché de façon ambulante dans les quartiers, dans la famille ou sur commande, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes et la plupart au comptant.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 18.000 FCFA dont une partie sera investie dans les activités et l’autre partie en épargne.
texts.en:
The Mougnou group is made up of 7 women, married, with an average age of 32 and on average, 2 children. They mostly live in monogamous families in Kamalen Sirakoro, one of the neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of Mali. They work with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, and they are on their 3rd loan, with the intention of satisfying their customers’ needs.

They have various businesses, among others, selling condiments, shoes, fish, gasoline, etc. With this new loan, they intend to buy 25 baskets of condiments, 40 pairs of shoes, and 20 cartons of fish. They do their buying in the big market of Sikasso town and in the surrounding villages. The goods are sold in the markets, on foot around the area, within their families, or to order, to a clientele composed of men and women, and mostly for cash.

They each expect to make a monthly average profit of 18,000 F CFA, of which a part will be invested back into their businesses and the rest used for savings.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various items for resale

loans.name: Jose Amos

texts.pt:
Jose Amos D. nasceu na provincial de Tete, tem 44 anos de idade, casado e pai de 6 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 04 e 17 anos, todos a estudarem com excepção dos dois menores de 6 anos. Estudou ate 4 classe tendo parado quando saiu o seu nome para cumprir o serviço militar obrigatório. Vive em boane na casa própria com família constituída.

Foi assim que chegou a maputo na companhia de outros colegas em 1981. Após a passagem a disponibilidade, no ano dos acordos gerais da paz, da guerra dos 16 anos, no ano de 1992, fixou sua residência no distrito de boane. Sofreu acidente ainda na tropa tendo perdido seus membros superiores. É deficiente físico e visual e recebe pensão de invalidez permanente no valor de 7.800,00MT que aplica no sustento da família e, juntando com outros rendimentos provenientes de negócios, consegue poupar algum valor no banco.  
A esposa também dedica se a pratica de pequenos negócios (vende produtos de primeira necessidade).

Nunca tinha contraído empréstimo em outros bancos e com a Hluvuku-Adsema este é o seu quarto credito no valor de 25.000,00MT para compra de materiais de construção (cimento, pedra e barrotes) para edificar um estabelecimento comercial de pequena escala. Os outros empréstimos foram para compra de bens de consumo e habitação nos valores de 6.500,00MT; 15.000,00MT e 20.000,00MT, respectivamente.

Sonha ver terminado o seu estabelecimento comercial e aceder a mais empréstimos para compra de produtos para revender e para tal, espera pagar o credito sem problemas.
texts.en:
Jose Amos D. was born in Tete. He is 44, married and the father of six children between the ages 4 and 17. All of them students, except for the two little ones under 6. Jose finished 4th grade but had to drop school when he was drafted to the army. He lost his upper limbs while serving in the military, and he also has vision disabilities. He earns a monthly disability check of 7.800,00MT (about U$284) that he uses to support his family, and makes extra money working different businesses. His wife sells basic commodities to help with household expenses. Jose never applied for a loan from other banks and this is his 4th loan with Hluvuku-Adsema. He asks for $950 to buy construction supplies and build a small store. The other loans were to buy basic items and food and were in the amount of $235, $550 and $730. He dreams of seeing his store finished and be able to get more loans to get the merchandise he is going to be selling.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction supplies (concrete, rock, sand)

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en: Jacob is fifty-one years old. He is married and has six children, a son and five daughters, who are all in school. He works very hard to be able to provide for the family. Jacob lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Konongo in the Ashanti region of Ghana. He sells tents and umbrellas. He rents them out and also mends damaged canopies in his community. Jacob wants a loan to buy working materials like tarpaulin, etc. to expand his business. He has been in business for over fifteen years.

loans.use: To buy water-repellent textiles

loans.name: Jose Benito

texts.es: José Benito M. tiene El Nombre del Señor José Benito B. M. tiene la edad de 52 años, su compañera de vida labora en una tienda llamada Brodway. No es el primer préstamo que ha realizado en Fundación León 2000 ya que es por medio de ellos que ha logrado salir adelante. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es joyero en lo que realiza el siguiente trabajo anillos, pulsera, cadenas, chapas. Sus inicios se dan a la edad de 16 años y más tarde decide ingresar a un taller y al paso del tiempo decide instalar su mismo negocio e inicia con las siguientes herramientas una mesa, sopletes y balanza más tarde decide obtener su propio negocio. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que tiene que comprar  el oro y tiene que buscar donde se lo oferten de forma más factible para realizar cada uno de sus productos.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
SABALI est un regroupement de six femmes, toutes mariées, ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans  et  4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à KAMELEN SIRAKORO  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dont le but  est de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de  condiments,  de chaussures,  de  poisson fumé,  de pomme de terre etc.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 20 paniers de condiments alimentaires ,35 paires de chaussures, 12 cartons de poissons fumés et 10 sacs de 50 kg de pomme de terre.  Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages voisins. 
Les marchandises sont vendues  en détail au marché et de façon ambulante dans les quartiers, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes et généralement au comptant.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22.000 FCFA dont une partie sera investie dans les activités et l’autre partie en épargne.
texts.en:
Sabali is a group of 6 women, all married, with an average age of 33 and on average, 4 children. They mostly live in monogamous families in Kamelen Sirakoro, one of the neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are on their 9th loan, working together with Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, with the intention of satisfying their customers’ needs.

They have various businesses among others, selling condiments, shoes, smoked fish, potatoes, etc. With this new loan, they intend to buy 20 baskets of condiments, 35 pairs of shoes, 12 cartons of smoked fish, and 10 sacks of 50 kg of potatoes. They do their buying in the big market of Sikasso town and in the surrounding villages. The goods are sold retail in the markets and on foot around the area, to a clientele composed of women, men, and generally for cash.

They each expect to make a average monthly profit of 22,000 F CFA, of which a part will be invested back into their businesses and the rest put into savings.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Matilda is forty-two years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, a son and two daughters, who are all in school. She works very hard to support her husband and to be able to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Konongo in the Ashanti region of Ghana. 

Monica sells smoked fish. She supplies to retailers and food vendors in her community. She buys her goods in the north at moderate prices. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy smoked fish

loans.name: Jiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe Jiguiya (4 femmes mariées et une veuve) avec une moyenne d’âge de 38ans ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent en majorité dans des  familles monogames à Mancourani Natien un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur quatrième  prêt de groupe après avoir correctement remboursés les trois précédents. 
Elles vont entre autres les ventes de piments, de pommes de terre, de tomates, de pommes d’acajou et d’oranges.
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 6 panier de tomates, 7 sacs de piments, 5 sacs de  pomme d’acajou, 2 chargements de charrette en orange et 8 cartons de pommes . Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans la commune rurale de kaboïla. 
Elles vendent le plus souvent sur place à des clients venant d’autres grandes villes telles que: Bamako, Koutiala mais aussi à la population locale. Elles vendent au comptant, en gros et en détail, quelques fois à crédit.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 42.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Certaines d’entre elles comptent acheter un terrain à usage d’habitation et d’autres d’acheter un attelage pour les déplacements dans les villages avoisinants.

loans.use: Achat de divers produits alimentaires.

loans.name: Mother Blessings Group

texts.en:
Mother Blessings is a group of 5 borrowers led by Watta M.. They live in Kolahu, Lofa County, Liberia. Watta is 38 years old and married. She has 3 children, ages 3-9. Watta was unable to attend school because, although she enjoyed it, the cultural norm was for girls to rely on their husbands to provide and, therefore, school was considered unnecessary. She lives in the remote city of Kolahu in rural Lofa County, the breadbasket of Liberia. 

Watta’s sells dry goods, including slippers, children’s clothes, shirts, and pants, which she buys wholesale in nearby Guinea and sells in a temporary market stall at the Kolahu central market, Kissi quarter. She has run her business for 3 years and is successful because of the way she treats her customers. She’s taking the loan to increase her inventory to meet increased demand. Her dream is to expand her business so she can one day have the biggest table in the central market. With the profits from her business, Watta dreams of building her own house and sending all her children to school.

loans.use: Purchase shirts, pants, and slippers for inventory

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is thirty-eight years old. She is divorced and has given birth to four children, a son and three daughters, who are all in school. She works very hard to be able to provide for the family. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Konongo in the Ashanti region of Ghana. 

Margaret sells palm oil. She prepares and supplies the oil to retailers and food vendors in her community. She buys the palm fruit in nearby communities. Margaret has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy palm fruits in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy palm fruit

loans.name: Sabaly Group

texts.fr:
Sabaly est un regroupement composé de  5 femmes mariées, une veuve et une femme divorcée qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 38ans ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivent dans des  familles monogames à Mancourani Natien un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur septième  prêt solidaire après avoir remboursés les six précédents. 
Elles font comme activités économiques la vente de pagnes real, des jus de fabrication locale, des tomates et de divers articles de boutique (huile, sucre, savons etc).
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 6 paniers de tomates, 10 sacs de gingembre, 1 sac de sucre, 1 bidon de 20 litres d’huile alimentaire et 3 cartons de savons . Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville le jour de foire auprès des grossistes. 
Elles vendent au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à la maison et aux marchés, à une clientèle composée de forains mais aussi  de la population locale.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 45.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Certaines d’entre elles comptent acheter un terrain à usage d’habitation et d’autres d’acheter un attelage pour les déplacements dans les villages avoisinants.
texts.en:
Sabaly is a group of 5 married women, one widow and one divorced woman, with an average age of 38 and on average, 4 children. They mostly live in monogamous families in Mancourani Natien, one of the neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are on their 7th solidarity loan, working together with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, with the intention of satisfying their customers’ needs. Their previous 6 loans were correctly reimbursed.

They have various businesses such as selling “Real” African waxcloth, locally produced juices, tomatoes, and various dry goods (oil, sugar, soap, etc.) With their new loan, they intend to buy 6 baskets of tomatoes, 10 sacks of ginger, 1 sack of sugar, 1 jerrycan of 20 liters of cooking oil, and 3 cartons of soaps. They do their buying in the big market of Sikasso town, on weekly marketdays, from wholesalers. The goods are sold for cash, retail, and for credit, out of their homes and in the markets, to a clientele composed itinerant merchants but also of local people.

They each expect to make a monthly average profit of 45,000 F CFA, of which a part will be used for savings and for family expenses and the rest invested back into their businesses. Certain members intend to buy a lot to use to build a family house on and others hope to buy a donkey cart to use when they go to neighboring villages.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth W. sells smoked fish. She buys fish from the fishermen and smokes them at Elmina near Eselem. Elizabeth has received junior high school education. She is single and has three children. Elizabeth has been selling smoked fish since 1989. She is responsible for paying the school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more fish for processing and sale. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to put towards building a house.

loans.use: To buy more fish for processing and sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: General merchandise and food sales.

loans.name: Luisa Argentina

texts.es: Luisa Agustina Martínez B. tiene 46 años. Es casada y tiene 2 hijos y todos son mayores de edad. La señora tiene 9 años de dedicarse de tener su negocio de mercadería en general, ubicada en su casa de habitación. Ella empezó  hace 9 años con la venta de ropa, cosméticos y zapatos, y con el tiempo fue que ella adquirió el capital necesario para establecer su negocio, a la que le ha estado invirtiendo todos los créditos solicitados. El crédito será invertido en la compra de mercadearía. El sueño siempre ha sido llegar a tener una distribuidora en la cual emplee a otras personas y sea un ingreso fuerte para el sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
Luisa Agustina Martínez B., 46, is married and has two grown children. For nine years she has had a business, which is located in her house, selling general merchandise. Nine years ago she started selling clothes, cosmetics, and shoes. With time, she got the necessary capital to establish her business. She has been investing all of the loans she has asked for in the business. The loan is to buy merchandise. Her dream has always been to have a distributorship in which she employs other people. That would be a strong income to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is twenty – seven years old. He is single and has no child. He is a hardworking young man. Paul lives alone in a rented apartment in Konongo in the Ashanti region of Ghana. He is a fitting mechanic by profession. He repairs faulty vehicles. He has a workshop in his community. He also deals in car spare parts. Paul wants a loan to buy working materials and spare parts to expand his business. He has been in business for three years.

loans.use: To buy vehicle spare parts

loans.name: Remember #2 Group

texts.en:
Remember #2 is a group of 5 borrowers led by Sambah K.. They live in Kolahu, Lofa County, Liberia.  Sambah is 35 years old and married. She has 2 children, ages 2 and 7.  Her oldest child is in 1st grade. Sambah was unable to attend school because, although she enjoyed it, the cultural norm was for girls to rely on their husbands to provide and, therefore, school was considered unnecessary.  She lives in remote Kolahu City in rural Lofa County, the breadbasket of Liberia. 

Sambah’s runs a cookshop, a fast-food roadside café for workers in the fields and other general laborers. She has run her business for 2 years and is successful because her customers like her personality and work ethic – she stays open long hours for them – and the way she prepares the food. She’s taking a loan to increase her food stores of rice, oil, mapo, and soup to meet the demand of the growing economy. Her dream is to expand her business so she can one day have a real restaurant in town. With the profits from her business, Sambah dreams of sending her kids to college.

loans.use: Purchase rice, oil, mapo and soup

loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Badegna constitué de  5 femmes mariées ayant en  moyenne  32 ans, 2 enfants,  vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à Médine un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dont le but  est de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de  fruits et légumes.  
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 20 chargements de charrette en fruits et 15 chargements de charrette en légumes.  
Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans  les  villages environnants. Les marchandises sont vendues aux marchés, de façon ambulante dans les quartiers, dans la famille ou sur commande à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes et la plupart au comptant.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 23.000 FCFA dont une partie sera investie dans les activités et l’autre partie en épargne.
texts.en:
The Badegna group is made up of 5 married women, with an average age of 32 and on average, 2 children. They mostly live in monogamous families in Médine, one of the neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are on their 6th loan, working together with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, with the intention of satisfying their customers’ needs.

They have various businesses, among others selling fruit and vegetables. With this new loan, they intend to buy 20 wagonloads of fruit and 15 wagonloads of vegetables. They do their buying in the big market of Sikasso town and in surrounding villages. The goods are sold in the markets, out of their homes, walking around the neighborhoods or to order, to a clientele composed of men and women, and mostly for cash.

They each expect to make an average monthly profit of 23,000 F CFA, of which a part will be invested back into their businesses and the rest for savings.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fruit and  vegetables for resale

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia B. sells dried fish (koobi) and snails at Elmina near Ayisa. She is a widow and has six dependents. She has no educational background. She is responsible for paying school fees and utility bills.

Cecilia has been selling dried fish since 2006. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to be dried for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fish to be dried for sale

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is thirty-one years old. He is married and the father of two children, a boy and a girl. Both of his children are in school. Moses works very hard to be able to provide for the family. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Konongo in the Ashanti region of Ghana. He is a fitting mechanic by profession. Moses repairs faulty vehicles. He has a workshop in his community. He also deals in spare car parts. Moses wants a loan to buy working materials and spare parts to expand his business. He has been in business for two years.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for vehicles

loans.name: Jiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe JIGUISSEME de l’association Sinjiya est constitué de  4 femmes mariées   ayant  une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans et  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à Médine un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de  fruits.  
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter,  25 chargements de charrette en fruits (orange et banane). Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages environnants. 
Les marchandises sont vendues au marché, de façon ambulante dans les quartiers, dans la famille,  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes et la plupart au comptant.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 23.000 FCFA dont une partie sera réinvestie dans les activités et l’autre partie servira d’épargne.
texts.en:
The group named Jiguisseme of the Sinjiya association consists of 4 married women, with an average age of 28 years, and they each have 3 children. Most of them live in with their families in Medine, a quarter in the city of Sikasso, the 3rd administratrive region of Mali.

They are currentlyh on their sixth loan with the microfinance institution of Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner). Their goal is to meet the demands of their clientele.

They carry out various activities, amoung which, is the sale of fruit.

With this new loan they plan on purchasing 25 crates of fruit (oranges and bananas). They are merchants in the large market in the city of Sikasso and in the surrounding villages. They sell their merchandise in the market, or throughout the city quarters, and among family. Their clientele is made up of men and women and they mostly pay in cash.

They forsee having a monthly earning of 23.000 FCFA where a portion will be reinvested back into the business and another portion will be used as savings.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruit.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa is 45 years old. She is divorced and has given birth to two children, a son and a daughter who are both in school. She works very hard to be able to provide for the family. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Konongo in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She is a trader. She trades in crates of eggs. Theresa supplies to retailers and food vendors in her community. She procures the eggs from nearby poultry-farming communities. She has been in business for 10 years and wants a loan to buy crates of eggs in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy crates of eggs

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Danaya est constitué de  6 femmes mariées ayant en moyenne  28 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à Médine un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de  pagnes wax, savons, produits de beauté etc.  
 Après avoir correctement remboursés  les quatre prêts précédents, elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Le  remboursement du prêt précédent a été anticipé de trois semaines. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 20 pièces de pagnes wax,  30 cartons de savons et 10 douzaines de produits de beauté. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les localités avoisinantes. Les marchandises sont vendues au marché, de façon ambulante dans les quartiers, dans la famille, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes et la plupart au comptant.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 23.000 FCFA dont une partie sera réinvestie dans les activités et l’autre partie en épargne.
texts.en:
The Danaya group is made up of 6 married women, with an average age of 28 and on average, 3 children. They mostly live in monogamous families in Médine, one of the neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of Mali. They have various businesses, among others selling African “waxcloth”, soap, cosmetics, etc. After having correctly reimbursed the four preceding loans, they are on their 5th loan, working together with Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, with the intention of satisfying their customers’ needs. They paid back their previous loan three week early. With this new loan, they intend to buy 20 lengths of African “waxcloth”, 30 cartons of soaps and 10 dozen cosmetic items. They do their buying in the big market of Sikasso town and surrounding areas. The goods are sold in the markets, walking around the neighborhoods, or in their families, to a clientele composed of men and women, and mostly for cash. They each expect to make an average monthly profit of 23,000 F CFA, of which a part will be invested back into their businesses and the rest put away as savings.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various items: waxcloth, soap, cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase general food items.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa is 70 years old. She is widowed and has given birth to four children, a son and three daughters who are all out of school. Though aged, she is still a hardworking woman. She lives with some of her grandchildren in a rented apartment in Konongo in the Ashanti region of Ghana. 

She is a trader. Adwoa trades in second-hand textiles – bed sheets and clothing for both males and females. She sells in her community market and treks to other towns to sell as well. She procures her goods from Kumasi. Adwoa has been in business for a number of years and wants a loan to buy bales of textiles in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothes

loans.name: Soro Yiriwaso Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Soro Yiriwaso est constitué de  6 femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à Médine un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de  pagnes wax, fruits, pomme de terre, chaussures etc.  
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 25 pièces de pagnes wax,  40 paires de chaussures, 20 sacs de pomme de terre. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et  dans les localités avoisinantes. 
Les marchandises sont vendues au marché, de façon ambulante dans les quartiers, dans la famille, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes et la plupart au comptant.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 23.000 FCFA dont une partie sera investie dans les activités et l’autre partie en épargne.
texts.en:
The Soro Yiriwaso group is made up of 6 married women, who have an average age of 32 and on average, 2 children. They mostly live in monogamous families in Médine, one of the neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are on their 5th loan, working together with Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, with the intention of satisfying their customers’ needs. They have various businesses, among others selling African “waxcloth”, fruit, potatoes, shoes, etc..

With this new loan, they intend to buy 25 lengths of African “waxcloth”, 40 pairs of shoes, and 20 sacks of potatoes. They do their buying in the big market of Sikasso town and in surrounding areas. The goods are sold in the market, walking around the neighborhoods, or in their families, to a clientele composed of men and women, and mostly for cash.

They each expect to make an average monthly profit of 23,000 F CFA, of which a part will be invested back into their businesses and the rest put away as savings.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 56 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, a son and three daughters who are all in school. She works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Konongo in the Ashanti region of Ghana. 

She is a trader. Janet trades in footwear and ladies dressing bags. She sells in her community market and treks to other towns to sell as well. Janet procures her goods from Kumasi. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy footwear

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is thirty–eight years old, divorced and a hardworking woman. She has four children a son and three daughters—who are all in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Konongo in the Ashanti region of Ghana. 

Comfort prepares and sells rice and stew in the mornings by the roadside in her community. She procures her raw materials from Kumasi. Comfort has been in business for five years and is requesting a loan to buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business. She dreams to provide good education for the children from the business proceeds and would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice, spices, ingredients in bulk.

loans.name: Mujeres De Superacion 1 Group

texts.en:
Raquel is the group coordinator of the group Mujeres en Superacion (Women Overcoming) which is based in Los Alcarrizos, an industrial town north of Santo Domingo. Here she makes her home with her husband and six children who are between the ages of six and eighteen and in school. The family lives in a modest house made of concrete blocks. Despite the town’s industrial base, running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable at best.

Raquel runs a beauty salon out of her home. She is requesting a loan to purchase two hairdryers for her business. She came to Esperanza for its reasonable financial services and its interest rates that are much lower than her local moneylenders. This is her first loan from Esperanza.

Raquel believes that hard work combined with her technical training will make her business a success. With hairdryers in her salon, she envisions greater profits with which she can purchase an inverter charger. With this, she can charge her batteries when the power is on and then use the charged batteries to run her hairdryers and other electrical appliances in her house when the power is out. Additionally, she would like to purchase school supplies for her children.

In the long term, she views her prospects as good, and she dreams of having a successful salon with many clients that will provide a steady income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase two hair dryers

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is twenty–five years old, married and has one child, a boy who is in basic school. He lives with his wife and son in a rented apartment in Konongo in the Ashanti region of Ghana. He is a carpenter by profession. His handwork are of a class therefore he has attracted lots of customers who order furniture goods from him. Andrew makes all kinds of furniture for sale in his workshop in his community. He works very hard to be able to provide for his family.

Andrew has been in business for four years. He is requesting a loan to buy materials such as wood, glue, etc. to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy more woodworking materials

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is 60 years old. He is married and has six children, three sons and three daughters. Some of his children are still in school. He works very hard to be able to provide for the family. Richard lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Konongo in the Ashanti region of Ghana. He runs a drug store in his community. He sells all kinds of drugs – tablets, syrups, etc. His shop is by the roadside. Richard wants a loan to buy drugs in bulk to expand his business. He has been in business for four years.

loans.use: To procure drugs in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mill to grind spices.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita Jirón tiene 79 años. Ella se ha dedicado durante mucho tiempo al destace de cerdo, por lo que siempre ha buscado la forma de cómo ganarse el pan de cada día, desafortunadamente Margarita solo logro finalizar sus estudios de primaria. Actualmente esto no fue impedimento para salir adelante, por medio de su familia que siempre se han dedicado a esta actividad fue que ella decide por cuenta propia establecer su propio negocio, en su humilde vivienda. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de cerdos. Su mayor aspiración es mantener este negocio porque ya a su edad es muy difícil segur trabajando.
texts.en:
Margarita Jirón is 79-years-old. For a long time she has earned her living butchering pigs, so she's always looked for ways make ends meet. Unfortunately, she managed to complete only a primary school education. This did not stop her from getting ahead now, though. Because her family had always been in this business, she made the decision to start her own business in her modest home. She is seeking a loan for working capital to buy pigs. Her greatest aspiration to to keep up her business because at her age it's very hard to keep working.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is 54 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, a son and three daughters who are all in school. She is a hardworking woman. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Konongo in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Abena is a trader. She trades in foodstuffs like plantain and maize. She supplies food vendors and retailers in her community. She procures her goods from Kumasi. Abena has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy bags of maize and plantain in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy maize and plantain in bulk

loans.name: Ebenezer

texts.en:
Ebenezer M. sells fish. He goes to sea for fish and sells them at Elmina. Ebenezer has no educational background. He is married and has three children. His wife is a trader.

Ebenezer has been selling fish since 2005. He is responsible for paying school fees and settlement of utility bills. His loan will be used to buy to fishing net, fuel and other things for fishing. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to save to towards building a house.

loans.use: To buy fishing net, fuel and other things for fishing.

loans.name: Elea

texts.en: Elea is 58 years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, two sons and three daughters who are all in school. She is a hardworking woman. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Konongo in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Elea is a trader. She prepares and sells palm oil in her community. She procures her raw materials from nearby communities. Elea has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy palm nuts in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts in bulk

loans.name: Jamilet De Rosario

texts.es: La Señora Jamilet del Rosario C. F. tiene la edad de 38 años. Es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 6 años que posee este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda. Por lo que sus inicios surgen con muy poco capital, pero con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Por lo que tenía que pagar las cuentas de su vivienda y además proporcionarles a sus hijos estudios y alimentación. Poco a poco fue incrementando su inventario con las pocas ganancias que su negocio le generaba, sus clientes recurrían a su negocio ya que la atención  de Jamilet es muy buena y además atiende a sus clientes con una sonrisa en sus labios. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa nueva, calzado, ropa interior y bolsos. Su mayor sueño es que cada uno de sus hijos logre finalizar sus estudios y que sigan adelante con esta actividad que les ayudo a salir adelante.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Carmen Magdalena

texts.es:
La microempresaria Carmen Magdalena M. W. tiene 61 años de edad, es madre soltera de la etnia creole tiene dos hijos adultos los cuales ya tiene formados su propio hogar, la señora M. se dedica desde hace mas de 10 años a vender fritos y principalmente comidas típicas de la región como es el caso de la sopa mixta de mariscos como el rondón (comida hecha a base de coco, yuca, quequisques y otros productos).

Esta actividad la realiza dos o tres veces a la semana y es visitada por habitantes de barrios negros de esta ciudad quienes llegan a comprar sus comidas y se las llevan empacadas a sus casas. En la venta de estos productos ofrece un día la sopa mixta y otro día el rondón.

La señora M. ya fue beneficiada con un crédito de kiva y aprovecha para agradecer a los prestamistas que hicieron realidad este préstamo el cual lo pago en tiempo y forma y a la vez solicita se le financie para comprar los siguientes productos:

80 libras de Pollo le cuesta a US 1.90 cada libra, 55 unidades de cocos le cuesta a US 0.60 cada coco, 80 libras de carne de res le cuesta a US 2.00 cada libra, 50 libras de pescado le cuesta a US 2.00 cada libra, 30 libras de camarón le cuesta a US 5.50 cada libra, 1 quintal de arroz americano le cuesta a US 45.00 cada quintal, 1 quintal de azúcar le cuesta a US 35.00 cada quintal, 35 sacos de carbón le cuesta a US 5.00 cada saco, 1 bidón de aceite le cuesta a US 35.00 cada bidón, 80 libras de quequisque le cuesta a US 0.40 cada libra, 100 unidades de plátanos le cuesta a US 0.40 cada plátano y 80 libras de  yuca le cuesta a US 0.35 cada libra.
texts.en:
Small businesswoman Carmen Magdalena M. W. is 61 years old, and is a single mother of Creole ethnicity. She has two grown children who have their own homes. Señora M. has sold fried foods and other dishes that are typical of the region such as mixed seafood soup and rondón (a dish made with coconut, yucca root, taro root, and other products) for over 10 years. She carries out this activity 2 or 3 times per week, and is visited by the inhabitants of black neighborhoods of this city who come to buy her meals and take them in containers to their houses. One day she will offer the mixed seafood soup, and the other day the rondón.

Señora M. was already the beneficiary of a Kiva loan which she paid off on time, and she wants to take this opportunity to thank the lenders who made her this loan. At the same time she requests additional funding in order to purchase the following products: 80 pounds of chicken that costs US$ 1.90 per pound, 55 coconuts that cost US$ 0.60 each, 80 pounds of beef that costs US$ 2.00 per pound, 50 pounds of fish that costs US$2.00 per pound, 30 pounds of shrimp that costs US$5.50 per pound, 100 pounds of American rice that costs US$ 45.00, 100 pounds of sugar that costs US$35.00, 35 bags of coal that costs US$ 5.00 per bag, a drum of cooking oil that costs US$ 35.00, 80 pounds of taro root that costs US$ 0.40 per pound, 100 bananas that cost US$ 0.40 per banana, and 80 pounds of yucca root that costs US$ 0.35 per pound.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy chicken, coconuts, beef, fish, shrimp, American rice, sugar, coal, cooking oil, taro root, bananas and yucca root

loans.name: Victor Francisco

texts.es: El señor Víctor Francisco vive con su esposa la señora Rocío Marisol son una familia muy unida tienen dos hijos en edad escolar; el señor Víctor Francisco trabaja para una óptica reconocida en la ciudad como laboratorista desde hace 8 años, su esposa se dedica al hogar y al cuidado de la familia. Ellos están solicitando este crédito para construir una losa en el frente de su vivienda para mayor comodidad de su familia.
texts.en:
Víctor Franciscolives with his wife, Rocío Marisol, and their two school-aged children. They are a very united family and for the past eight years Víctor Francisco has worked in a recognized optician’s laboratory in the city. His wife takes care of the home and family. They are requesting a loan to construct a concrete slab in front of their home to make the family more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to construct a concrete slab in front of their home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase pottery and sandals.

loans.name: Cenelia Del Carmen

texts.es: Cenelia del Carmen A. F. tiene la edad de 36 años. Es madre soltera. Tiene 5 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta y elaboración de tortillas. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Doña Cenelia obtuvo este negocio por su Mama ya que, tenía que mantener a su familia por lo que, no tenía el apoyo de sus padres y decidió luchar, con esfuerzo propio, pero al fallecer su Mama fue ella quien se hizo cargo del negocio, ya que esto le ayudo para que sus hijos pudieran estudiar y aspirar por otros niveles académicos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de maíz, cal y otros productos. El deseo de ella es lograr que sus hijas culminen sus estudios.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Martín

texts.es:
El señor Martín B. tiene ya más de dos años dedicándose a la venta de aceites para autos, este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de su familia.
Al negocio le está haciendo falta más variedad de mercancía para autos, pero en esté momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder surtir. 
Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo y así su negocio tendrá más variedad de producto para vender y también  ingreso a su familia y con el cual planea pagar el crédito.

loans.use: Comprar de mercancía

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase men's shirts, rubber boots, rice, sugar, and charcoal

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 48 years old. She is widowed and has given birth to five children, all daughters and all in school. She is a hardworking woman. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Konongo in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Esther is a trader. She trades in jewels. She hawks and treks to other communities to sell. Esther procures her goods from Kumasi. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy jewels in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy jewels in bulk

loans.name: Carla Patricia

texts.es: La joven de nombre Carla Patricia L. Dávila tiene la edad de 27 años, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos todos son menores de edad. Sus propósitos son de mantener su negocio activo por lo que tiene que sacar adelante a su familia ya que son su mayor prioridad. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación hace mas 5años que se dedica este medio de vida. Sus inicios se dan con otro tipo de negocio ella inicia vendiendo refrescos ya que tenía que hacerse cargo de sus hijos ya que no tenía ninguna ayuda de parte d su esposo, pero no le gustaba salir y dejar a sus hijos por lo que decide establecer una pulpería en su casa de habitación y fue con la ayuda Dios que salió adelante. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita realizar las compras de los productos como son granos básicos, golosinas y otros productos que son necesarios por sus clientes.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is fifty – two years old. She is widowed and has given birth to five children, two sons and three daughters who are all in school. She is a hardworking woman. Victoria lives with her children in a rented apartment in Konongo in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She is a trader. She trades in fuel – charcoal and firewood. She supplies to food vendors and restaurant operators in her community. Victoria buys her goods from nearby communities. She has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to buy bags of charcoal and firewood in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: A. Ablavi est une femme âgée de 40 ans mariée et mère de 3 enfants.Elle habite à lomé,la capitale du TOGO. Ablavi est une commerçante dévouée. Elle a une boutique d’alimentation générale. Avec une partie de son crédit elle voudrait s'approvisionner en produits d'alimentation générale comme le riz,le lait,le sucre,les tomates,les savons détergents, les sardines etc...en gros et ensuite avec le reste de son crédit elle voudrait bien acheter un moulin qui écrasera les épices. Avec les bénéfices qu’elle obtiendra, elle pourra subvenir aux besoins de ses trois enfants.
texts.en:
A. Ablavi est une femme âgée de 40 ans mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Ablavi est une commerçante dévouée. Elle à une boutique d’alimentation générale. Avec une partie de son crédit elle veut acheter les produits pour sa boutique et ensuite avec le reste de son crédit elle voudrait bien acheter un moulin qui écrasera les épices. Avec les bénéfices qu’elle obtiendra, elle voudrait bien acheter un autre moulin qui écrasera les céréales.

Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: achat de produits d'alimentation générale et achat de moulin.

loans.name: Noel Antonio

texts.es: Noel Antonio A. M. tiene 46 años, tiene 2 hijos que asisten a una escuela. La actividad económica de Noel es una pulpería. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio. Inicio con solamente con  muy poco capital y con las ganancias obtenidas fue invirtiendo en la compra de mas productos, además con la ayuda de los financiamientos logro reunir el dinero que le hacía falta. En Fundación León 2000 encontró la oportunidad de crecer en su negocio ya que por medio de Fundación obtiene la ayuda de las organizaciones amigas. Por lo que el dinero lo solicita es para la compra de golosinas, pan, refrescos naturales y jugos. Los sueños de Noel son de seguir mejorando su vivienda para que sus hijos tengan un lugar adecuado para vivir.
texts.en:
Noel is a 46-year-old father of two school-age children. For over 3 years he has owned and run a small corner shop. He started it with very little capital and invested his gains in the purchase of even more products. This form of financing has helped him raise the money that he was lacking. With Fundación León 2000 he found the opportunity to grow his business and has also found help from the organization’s friends. The loan he requests is for the purchase of candies, bread, sodas, and juices. Noel’s dreams are to improve his housing so that his children can have a suitable place to live.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Claudia Julieta

texts.es:
La señora Claudia M. es madre soltera y tiene tres hijas adolescentes bajo su responsabilidad, que actual mente están estudiando.
Está solicitando un préstamo para pagar las colegiaturas y comprar los uniformes de sus hijas ya que no pueden entrar a la escuela si no tiene liquidada la inscripción, y para la señora Claudia es muy importante que sus niñas tenga los estudios necesarios para su futuro. 
Es por eso que está solicitando el crédito y piensa pagarlos con el ingreso que genera de su empleo, en una tienda donde vende accesorios de plata en el departamento de administradora. Esté es el ingreso que tiene para su familia y con el cual un parte será para pagar el crédito.
(La persona que aparece en la foto es una de sus hijas ya que la señora Claudia se encontraba en su trabaja cuando realizamos la visita.)

loans.use: Pagar la inscripción y comprar los útiles escolares

loans.name: Felicita Hortencia

texts.es: Felicita Hortencia Jiménez L. tiene 25 años de edad, tiene 1 hijo y estudia. Felicita se dedica a la compra y venta de tortillas, ella ha logrado obtener clientes fijos desde que inicio su negocio y esto le ha permitido obtener ganancias que le han ayudado a solventar gastos en su hogar pues ella es madre y padre para sus hijos quienes han sabido corresponder al esfuerzo de su madre. Actualmente solicita un financiamiento que le permita comprar materia prima, pues ella desea aumentar sus ventas. El deseo de ella es mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Felicita is a 25-year-old mother of one child who is in school. Felicita buys and sells tortillas and has been successful in obtaining a fixed clientele ever since she began her business. This has allowed her to make an income and cover household expenses since she plays mother and father for her children, who have come to know the great effort that their mother puts forth. Currently she is requesting a loan to purchase raw materials, which she will use to increase her sales. Her wish is to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es: L. señora MarceL. D. L. C. es una señora trabajadora que junto con su esposo han ido construyendo su casa, ellos ya son personas grandes y aunque sus hijos ya formaron su vida quieren dejar un buen patrimonio para cuando ellos falten. L. casa L. han levantado poco a poco ahora solo necesita un enjarre y pintarL. por fuera para esto están pidiendo un préstamo para comprar el material y pagar L. mano D. obra. MarceL. y su esposo estan satisfechos por que con su esfuerzo y tantos años D. trabajar tiene un techo donD. vivir y para su vejez no estén viviendo en casa D. sus hijos y causar molestia.
texts.en:
MarceL. D. L. C. is a hard working woman who, together with her husband, has been building her house. They are senior citizens, and even though their children have their own lives, MarceL. and her husband would like to leave them a good inheritance for when they are not here. They have raised the house little by little. Now, they only need the stucco and to paint the outsiD.. That is why they are asking for a loan to buy the material and pay for the work. MarceL. and her husband are satisfied because, through their efforts and so many years of working, they have a place to live. In their old age they will not be living in their children’s house and bothering them.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stucco the front of the house

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana tiene 56 años, en la actualidad vive sola (en su casa propia) porque su esposo, quien es agricultor radica mayormente en su chacra donde cultiva diferentes productos. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de dulces diversos, en forma ambulatoria. Sin embargo no duda en aprovechar su salida por los diferentes lugares para vender otros artículos hechos a base de madera como: cuadros, espejos, sillas, etc. Éstos son fabricados por uno de sus sobrinos, a quien crió y considera como su hijo, pero por su mala conducta se encuentra recluido en un penal, es ahí donde aprendió el arte de trabajar con la madera y abastece a Ana de todo lo que fabrica para que ella lo venda y solvente sus gastos. A ella le gusta mucho su trabajo porque se siente útil, además que le es rentable porque tanto los dulces, como la artesanía en madera son productos de mucho agrado para las personas. Posteriormente, Ana quiere tener una tienda en su casa donde venda abarrotes.
Ella es parte de un banco comunal y lo que más le gusta es que se distrae y aprende muchas cosas a lado de sus compañeros, quienes son muy unidos y responsables en sus pagos. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará más dulces para seguir activa en su negocio, pero también invertirá en la compra de madera para llevarla a su sobrino para que fabrique los nuevos artículos que aprendió a elaborar.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería y compra de madera

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Araceli

texts.es:
Araceli tiene 23 años, es madre de una niña de 3 añitos y vive con su esposo, quien se dedica al transporte de pasajeros. Desde hace 6 meses cuenta en su casa con un pequeño galpón que mandó a construir para criar pollos. En este negocio le está yendo muy bien, ya que tiene buena orientación por parte de un tío, quien le enseña cómo criar a los pollos para que obtengan el peso y tamaño adecuado. Cada 35 días los pollos ya están listos para salir al mercado y cuando los vende obtiene buenas ganancias. Sin embargo, Araceli no se queda atrás, porque también es propietaria de un motocarro, con el que trabaja su esposo en el transporte de pasajeros y ella es la encargada de administrar las ganancias. A Araceli le gustan sus labores porque aprende cosas nuevas y se mantiene ocupada, sobre todo es un gran apoyo para su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
Ella es parte de un banco comunal en MFP y lo que le gusta de su grupo es que son personas solidarias y responsables en sus pagos.
Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará más pollos bebés y suficiente alimento para su crianza, así seguirá activa en este negocio donde le va muy bien.
texts.en:
Araceli is 23 and has a three year old daughter. She lives with her husband who works at transporting passengers. Six months ago she had a small shed built at her house to raise chickens. The business is going very well for her. She has good training from an uncle who teaches her how to raise chickens to be the right size and weight. Every 35 days the chickens are ready to go to market. When she sells them she gets good income. Nevertheless, Araceli does not stop there because she also owns a “motocarro” (a three wheeled motorized cart). He husband works with it to transport passengers. She is in charge of administering the earnings. Araceli likes her jobs because she learns new thing, and they keep her busy. Above all, it is a great help to her husband with the household expenses. She is part of a communal bank in MFP. What she likes most about her group is that they are supportive people, and they are responsible with their payments. With the money she is asking for she will buy more baby chickens and enough food to raise them. This way she will continue to be active in this business, which is going very well for her.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy baby chickens and food for them

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela tiene 26 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos que están estudiando. Desde hace 2 años tiene un pequeño puesto donde vende todo tipo de celulares, aunque no tiene un punto de venta estable, con su negocio obtiene ganancias regulares. Graciela trabaja al lado de su esposo, quien es el encargado de la reparación de los celulares y a la venta de repuestos para éstos. Adicionalmente, Graciela vende diversos productos de panadería a las personas que viven por su zona, negocio que lo viene realizando hace 8 meses y le va muy bien. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es estar activa y dar un buen trato a sus clientes, pues gracias a su trabajo está solventando los gastos educativos de sus hijos.
Este es su 5to crédito con MFP y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su grupo es que luego de algunos problemas, han quedado en su banco comunal sólo las personas más responsables y trabajadoras. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará más celulares, calcula un gasto de mil soles; con el resto comprará algunos repuestos para el trabajo de su esposo.
texts.en:
Graciela is 26 years old and lives with her husband and their two children who are in school. For the last two years, she has had a small booth where she sells a variety of cellphones. Although she does not have a fixed location to sell from, her business generates profits regularly. Graciela works alongside her husband who is in charge of cellphone repairs and of selling replacement parts for the phones. Also, Graciela sells bakery goods to the people who live in her area, a business sideline that she has been working on for 8 months and which is going very well. What she likes about her work is being active and treating her customers well. Thanks to her business, she can pay for her children's education. This is her fifth loan with MFP. What she likes about working with her group is that after some problems earlier, only the most hard-working and responsible people remain part of her Village Bank. With her loan, she will use 1000 soles to buy more cellphones. With the rest, she will buy more replacement parts for her husband's side of the business.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jalia

texts.es:
Jalia tiene 41 años, es madre soltera y vive con sus 3 hijos, quienes estudian y la apoyan mucho. Desde hace 3 años tiene una pequeña bodega, la cual implementó en un espacio al frente de su casa; allí vende abarrotes, productos comestibles de primera necesidad y bebidas. Jalia atiende durante todo el día y le va muy bien, debido a encontrarse en una zona muy transitada y concurrida de su localidad. Por ello, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es dar una buena atención a todos sus clientes y sobre todo, aprender cada día más sobre el comercio. Para el futuro, Jalia desea ampliar su tienda y convertirla en un minimarket donde no falte nada y pueda abastecer a sus clientes con lo necesario.
Este es su 7mo préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que todos sus compañeros son puntuales en sus pagos y no le gustaría dejar de trabajar con ellos. El dinero que viene solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de más productos para seguir incrementando el stock de su bodega.
texts.en:
Jalia is 41 years old and is a single mother. She lives with her 3 children who are in school and who help her out a lot. For the last 3 years, she has had a small store in the space in front of her house. There she sells groceries, basic staples and drinks. Jalia keeps the store open all day and it does very well since it is in a high traffic area. Because of this, what she likes the most about her work is treating her customers well and, above all, learning more each day about running a business. For the future, Jalia would like to enlarge her store and convert it into a minimarket that has everything and that can supply her customers with what they need. This is her 7th loan with MFP. What she likes about her Village Bank is that all of her companions are punctual with their payments and she would like to keep working with them. The loan will be used to purchase more products to continue increasing her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Claudia Azucena

texts.es: La señora emprendedora Claudia Azucena C. P. tiene la edad de 38 años, su estado civil es casada, esta señora tiene 2 hijos de los cuales dependen de ella. Tiene sueños de instalar su negocio en un lugar más cómodo para sus clientes. Su actividad económica es la  venta de mercadearía en general. Hace más de 5 años, sus inicios empiezan desde que tiene la edad de 20 años por  lo que el negocio le pertenecía  a su mama ya que Doña Claudia ayudaba a su mama  y más tarde decide dejarle el negocio a ella,  para que este no pierda los antecedentes familiares y desde entonces es ella quien ha tenido a cargo este negocio. El financiamiento  es para la compra de capital de trabajo ya que necesita realizar la compra de calzado, bolsos, cosméticos y perfumes.
texts.en:
Claudia Azucena C. P. is an enterprising woman. She is 38, married, and has two children who are dependent upon her. Her dream is to set up her business in a place that is more comfortable for her customers. She sells general merchandise. She has been doing this for over five years. She started when she was 20, when the business belonged to her mother. Claudia helped her mother, and later her mother decided to leave the business to Claudia so that it would stay in the family. From then on she has been in charge of the business. The loan is for working capital to buy footwear, handbags, cosmetics, and perfumes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Fulberto Antonio

texts.es: Fulberto Antonio M. Pérez tiene la edad de 41 años. Es un hombre casado y tiene 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. El se dedica a una pulpería. El tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000, ya que todos los financiamientos que ha realizado han servido de mucha ayuda para su negocio. El es un hombre muy trabajador y disfruta mucho de su trabajo. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas, jugos, gaseosas y pan. A pesar de las dificultades que atravesó como fueron la falta de de capital propio. Su deseo es ampliar su negocio para que el día de mañana logre ser una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Fulberto Antonio is a 41-year-old married father of three dependent children. He owns and manages a small corner shop and has worked a lot with Fundación León 2000, since all of his repaid loans have helped his business a great deal. He is a very hard-working man and really enjoys his work. The loan that he requests is for working capital to buy sweets, juices, sodas, and bread. Despite the difficulties that he has encountered, such as a lack of capital, his wish is to expand his business so that in the future he can be a distributor.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Claudia Yojana

texts.es:
la señora Claudia Yojana D. R. tiene 26 años de edad, vive en barrio Victoria de San Lorenzo. vive en union libre con el señor Jesus Alberto Aguirre R. quien labora en el area de ventas 
de Aguazul San Lorenzo.
Tienen un hijo que esta en el kinder.
 
Claudia se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva en diferentes barrios y colonias de San Lorenzo, tambien viaja a un lugar que se llama monjaras para vender su producto.

Claudia se transporta en autobus, a demas tiene otra persona que la ayuda con las ventas.
Claudia necesita el prestamo para comprar mas ropa para niños, ya que muchos padres compran ropa para vertirlos para la celebracion del dia del niño que esta proximo en venir.
texts.en:
Claudia Yojana D. R. is 26, and she lives in the Victoria de San Lorenzo neighborhood. She is in a common law marriage with Jesus Alberto Aguiree R.. He works in the area of sales in Aguazule San Lorenzo. They have a son who is in kindergarten. Claudia sells new clothes in different neighborhoods and sectors of San Lorenzo. She also travels to a place called Monjaras to sell her product. Claudia goes buy bus. She also has another person who helps her with the sales. Claudia needs a loan to buy children’s clothes. Lots of parents buy clothes for their children to wear for the celebration of Children’s Day, which is coming soon.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy children's clothing like jeans, blouses, shirts, and T-shirts

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Yolanda Isabel

texts.es: Yolanda Isabel Hernández Ávila tiene la edad de 46 años, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. La actividad económica es un cafetín. Doña Yolanda es una mujer muy luchadora y emprendedora, por lo que disfruta mucho de su negocio. Hace más de 6 años que  se dedica a este negocio. Doña Yolanda dio inicio su pequeño negocio por el deseo de superación ya que tenía que mantener a sus hijos. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo y el dinero será utilizado para la compra de golosinas, café, jugos, refrescos naturales, pan y galletas. El deseo de ella es de proporcionarles a sus hijos la educación necesaria para que sean  buenos profesionales.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Jose Hernan

texts.es:
el sr. Jose Hernan N. M. tiene 38 años de edad, el radica en la colonia Buena Vista desde hace 14 años. vive en union libre con la señora Brenda Ebelia Pavon Fuentes con quien ha tenido 04 hijos,  los cuales estan en el colegio.
