su compañera se dedica a su hogar y cuidar de sus hijos. 
Jose trabaja vendiendo materiales para la construccion, labor con la cual trae el sustento a su familia, el tiene su propia volqueta y necesita el prestamo para comprar materiales y almacenarlos ya que en estos tiempos de lluvia es dificil sacar el material por el monton de lodo que se hace a las orillas de los rios.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose Hernan N. M. is a 38-year-old man who has been living in the Buena Vista housing development for 14 years. He lives with his common-law spouse, Ms. Brenda Ebelia Pavon Fuentes, and their 4 school age children.

His partner is a homemaker, so she looks after the children.

Jose sells construction supplies for a living. This job is his family’s source of income. He has his own dump truck, but he needs this loan in order to purchase building materials and store them as it is difficult to extract those materials during the rainy season because of all the mud along the riverbanks.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sand, rocks and gravel

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Yudith Antonieta

texts.es:
La señora Antonieta es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de J., Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 24 años de edad, estado civil soltera sin hijos, educación superior Tecnológico agropecuario, vive en Chacachaca  Buena Vista.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 4 años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invirtió comprando ganado ovino.

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de combustible que es el actual negocio de la Sra. Antonieta y comenta que le va muy bien.

Su sueño es poner un grifo en su lugar de venta.

A ella le gustan las charlas y las orientaciones.

loans.use: Para la compra de combustible.

loans.name: Eufemia Elizabet

texts.es:
la señora Eufemia Elizabet H. tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive en el barrio San Jose de San Lorenzo, tiene tres hijos de los cuales los tres estan en la escuela.
Eufemia se dedica a la venta de leña y tortillas tiene 4 años de dedicarse a esta labor. 
Eufemia esta solicitando crédito para comprar maiz, cal y leña. 
su sueño es que sus hijos se graduen de la univercidad.
texts.en:
Eufemia Elizabet H., 34, is a single mother. She lives in the San Jose de San Lorenzo neighborhood. She has three children who go to school. Eufemia sells wood and tortillas. She has been doing this for four years. Eufemia is asking for a loan to buy corn, lime, and wood. Her dream is for her children to graduate from the university.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn, wood, lime, and water

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La señora Elsa pertenece al Banco Comunal “Señor D. la Caña”  que esta ubicado D. el distrito D. Plateria, Provincia D. Puno, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 53 años D. edad, estado civil casada y es madre D. 04 hijos y tiene estudios D. primaria completa, vive en el centro poblado D. Ccota.

La señora trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 01 año,  con un préstamo inicial D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles  para la compra D. lanas para elaboración D. artesanías. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo D. S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra D. lana acrílica D. diferentes colores, para la elaboración D. artesanías en miniatura las cuales las venD. en las ferias D. Plateria.

Su mayor sueño es poner una tienda D. abarrotes en su centro poblado.

A ella le gustan las reuniones.
texts.en:
Elsa belongs to the Señor D. la Caña Comunal Bank, which is located in the Plateria district, Puno province, Puno department. She is 53, married, and has four children. She has an elementary school education. She lives in the Ccota town center. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for one year. With her initial loan for 500 PEN she bought wool to make her handicrafts. She is now asking for a loan for 800 PEN to buy different colors of acrylic wool to make her handicraft miniatures. She will sell them in the fairs in Plateria. Her biggest dream is to have a grocery store in her town center. She likes the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy different colors of acrylic wool

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Carmen Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “Señor de la Caña”  que esta ubicado de el distrito de Plateria, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 34 años de edad, estado civil casada y es madre de 02 hijos y tiene estudios de primaria completa, vive en la comunidad de la Rinconada.

La señora trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 01 año,  con un préstamo inicial de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles  para la compra de lanas para elaboración de artesanías. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de ganado menor ovinos para engorde, la Sra. Carmen Rosa también se ayuda elaborando artesanías a palitos.

Su mayor sueño es poner una tienda grande de abarrotes.

A ella le gustan las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
Ms. Carmen Rosa C. is a member of the “Señor de la Caña” Communal Bank, located in the Plateria district of the Puno province, department of Puno. She is a 34-year-old married mother with 2 children. She lives in the Rinconada community and has a high school diploma. Ms. C. has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for a year. She used her initial 500.00 PEN loan to purchase wool to make her handicrafts. At this time, she is requesting a 500.00 PEN loan to purchase sheep to raise for meat. Carmen Rosa also earns a little extra money by making stick handicrafts. Her biggest dream is to set up her own general store. She likes the training offered by her microfinance institute.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep

loans.name: Benedicta Filomena

texts.es:
La señora Benedicta es socia del Banco Comunal “Señor de la Caña”  que esta ubicado de el distrito de Plateria, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 53 años de edad, estado civil casada y es madre de 05 hijos y tiene estudios de secundaria completa, vive en el distrito de Plateria.

La señora trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 02 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  para  aumentar  a su capital de fabricación  de gaseosas. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de gaseosas, Benedicta es fabricante  y distribuye su producto en las tiendas de la zona.

Su mayor sueño que su negocio sea una industria grande.

A ella le gustan las facilidades en los préstamos y los pagos.

loans.use: Para la compra de insumos para la elaboracion de  gaceosas.

loans.name: Hayde Veronica

texts.es:
La señora Hayde es socia del Banco Comunal “Señor de la Caña”  que esta ubicado de el distrito de Plateria, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 29 años de edad, estado civil soltera y es madre de 03 hijos y tiene estudios de secundaria completa, vive en el distrito de Plateria.

La señora trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 02 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  este dinero lo invirtió en la compra de lana para elaboración de artesanías. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 600.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de lana de diferentes colores para la elaboración de artesanías, el mismo que los vende en las ferias.

Su mayor sueño tener una pequeña empresa de artesanía.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las facilidades en los préstamos
texts.en:
Ms. Hayde A. is a member of the “Señor de la Caña” Communal Bank, located in the Plateria district of the Puno province, department of Puno. She is a 29-year-old single mother with 3 children who lives in Plateria and has a high school diploma. Ms. A. has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for 2 years. She used her initial loan in the amount of 300.00 PEN to purchase wool to make handicrafts. At this time, she is requesting a 600.00 PEN loan to purchase wool in assorted colors to make handicrafts, which she will then sell at different markets. Her biggest dream is to have her own small handicraft company. She likes the savings offered by her bank, and the ease of obtaining loans.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool

loans.name: Lola

texts.es:
La señora Lola es socia del Banco Comunal “Señor de la Caña”  que esta ubicado de el distrito de Plateria, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 32 años de edad, estado civil casada y es madre de 03 hijos y tiene estudios de secundaria completa, vive en la comunidad de la rinconada.

La señora trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 02 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  para la compra de ganado menor. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de lana de diferentes colores para la elaboración de artesanías, el mismo que los vende en las ferias, también se dedica a la cría de ganado menor.

Su mayor sueño tener una pequeña empresa de artesanía.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las facilidades en los préstamos

loans.use: Para la compra de lana de diferentes colores.

loans.name: Leyla

texts.es:
Leyla es socia del Banco Comunal “Señor de la Caña”  que esta ubicado de el distrito de Plateria, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 21 años de edad, estado civil soltera, no tiene hijos y estudio educación superior incompleta (Administración de empresas), vive en Plateria.

Leyla trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 02 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  para la compra de lanas de diferentes colores. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de lana de alpaca y acrílica de diferentes colores para la elaboración de artesanías ella se dedica a la elaboración de prendas de vestir como chompas, chalecos, chalinas, etc.

Su mayor sueño es terminar su carrera.
A ella le gustan los ahorros y las facilidades en los préstamos
texts.en:
Leyla is a member of the “Señor de la Caña” Communal Bank, located in the Plateria district of the Puno province, department of Puno. She is a 21-year-old sing woman with no children who lives in Plateria. She has not yet finished her degree in Business Administration. Leyla has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for 2 years. She used her initial loan, in the amount of 300.00 PEN, to purchase wool of various colors. At this time, she is requesting a 500.00 PEN loan to purchase alpaca wool and acrylic yarn in different colors so that she can make her handicrafts. She weaves clothing, such as sweaters, vests, scarves, etc. for a living.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase acrylic and alpaca yarn

loans.name: Tania Aspacia

texts.es:
La señora Tania es socia del Banco Comunal “Señor de la Caña”  que esta ubicado de el distrito de Plateria, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 28 años de edad, estado civil conviviente, tiene estudios superiores (ing., Industria Alimentaría), y es madre de 01 hijo,  vive en Plateria.

La señora trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 02 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  para la compra de insumos para la fabricación de néctares. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 1100.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de edulcorantes, botellas,  estabilizantes, zaborisantes, etc. Para su negocio de fabricación de néctares, los cuales los distribuye en las tiendas de la zona.

Su mayor sueño es terminar su carrera.
A ella le gustan los ahorros y las facilidades en los préstamos
texts.en:
Ms. Tania Q. is a member of the “Señor de la Caña” Communal Bank, located in the Plateria district of the Puno province, department of Puno. She is a 28-year-old woman with a live-in partner and a child. She lives in Plateria, and is pursuing a degree in the Foodstuff Industry. Ms. Q. has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 2 years. Her initial loan, which she used to purchase supplies to make fruit nectar, was for 300.00 PEN. At this time, she is requesting a 1,100.00 PEN loan so that she can purchase sweeteners, bottles, stabilizers, flavorings etc. to make juice, which she then distributes throughout several stores in the area. Her biggest dream is to finish her studies. She likes the savings offered by her bank, and the ease of obtaining loans.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sweeteners, bottles, stabilizers, flavorings etc.

loans.name: Zuely Del Pilar

texts.es:
Zuely es socia del Banco Comunal “Señor de la Caña”  que esta ubicado de el distrito de Plateria, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 24 años de edad, estado civil soltera, no tiene hijos y estudio educación superior incompleta (Contabilidad ultimo siglo), vive en Plateria.

Zuley trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 02 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  para la compra de golosinas. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 700.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de galletas, chocolates, caramelos, gaseosas, etc. Para vender en su tienda.

Su mayor sueño es terminar su carrera.
A ella le gustan los ahorros y las facilidades en los préstamos
texts.en:
Zuely es socia del Banco Comunal “Señor de la Caña” que esta ubicado de el distrito de Plateria, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 24 años de edad, estado civil soltera, no tiene hijos y estudio educación superior incompleta (Contabilidad ultimo siglo), vive en Plateria. Zuley trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 02 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles para la compra de golosinas. En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 700.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de galletas, chocolates, caramelos, gaseosas, etc. Para vender en su tienda. Su mayor sueño es terminar su carrera. A ella le gustan los ahorros y las facilidades en los préstamos Zuely is a member of the Community Bank "Senor de la Cana" that is located in the Plateria district, Puno Province, Puno Department. She is 24, single, with no children. She didn't complete her high school (last term of Accounting). She lives in Plateria. Zuely has worked with the Manual Ramos organization for 2 years. Her first loan was 300 new sols to buy candy. Presently she is requesting a loan of 700 new sols to buy cookies, chocolates, candy, soft drinks, etc, to sell in her store. Her greatest dream is to finish her studies. She likes the savings and the loan terms.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cookies, chocolates, soft drinks, etc to sell in her store

loans.name: Rosa Delia

texts.es: La Señora Rosa Delia A. M. es cliente de Fundación León 2000. Es una mujer casada tiene 40 años y es madre de 4 hijos, Todos ellos ya independientes. Ella emprende su negocio de cafetín, el capital con el que dio inicio fue propio por lo que  no fue muy fácil, a pesar de su edad es una mujer que le gusta mucho su trabajo, por lo que a su edad esta es una actividad muy cansada, todos los días ella se levanta muy temprano para ofrecer sus productos a sus clientes, pues ella tiene ciertos clientes que son estables. Con este financiamiento comprara café, azúcar, golosinas, refrescos naturales. Su deseo es establecer su negocio en su humilde vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosa Delia A. M. is a client of Fundación León 2000. She is 40, married, and has four independent children. She began her snack bar with her own money, which was not easy. In spite of her age, she is a woman who really likes her work. This is very tiring work for someone her age. Every day she gets up very early to offer her products to her customers. She has some steady customers. With this loan she will buy coffee, sugar, sweets, and natural soft drinks. Her wish is to establish her business in her humble home.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Layli

texts.es:
Layli tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo, quien es agricultor y cultiva la palma aceitera, tienen 3 hijos que vienen cursando estudios primarios. Ella se levanta muy temprano para ir al puerto fluvial pesquero donde compra pescado salado, inmediatamente después coge otro bote para viajar una hora, río arriba, hacia un caserío llamado “Mashangay”, donde vende los pescados o los cambia con otros productos como plátanos, yucas u otras cosas, los cuales al regresar vende. En esta actividad ya tiene un periodo de un año y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es apreciar el paisaje cuando viaja por el río, además aprender nuevas costumbres de los poblados que visita. Por ello, Layli está muy contenta, pues la venta de sus productos le brinda las ganancias suficientes para el sostenimiento de su familia.
Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP y menciona que lo que más le agrada de su banco comunal es que todos trabajan organizadamente y no tienen problemas de falta de pago. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará más pescado para incrementar sus ventas.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz tiene 47 años, vive con su esposo, quien trabaja en una empresa petrolera, tienen 6 hijos varones, 4 de ellos ya son mayores de edad y trabajan independientemente, y los dos últimos aun son estudiantes. Desde hace 8 años tiene un pequeño puesto en un mercado de su localidad donde vende ropa y gracias a todos estos años ya cuenta con una clientela regular y puede obtener ganancias diarias. Adicionalmente; hace 3 años compró un motocarro y posteriormente otro, hace un año, con estos vehículos trabajan dos de sus hijos realizando transporte de pasajeros, es así que cada día entregan las ganancias obtenidas a Luz para que ella las administre. 
Este es su 8vo crédito con MFP y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su banco comunal es que todos sus compañeros son muy responsables y trabajadores. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará más ropa en un monto aproximado de 2000 soles, con el resto planea adquirir repuestos para mandar a reparar sus motocarros.
texts.en:
Luz, 47, lives with her husband who works for an oil business. She has six sons. Four of them are adults who work independently, and the last two are students. For eight years she has had a small stall in her regional market where she sells clothes. Thanks to all of these years, she has regular customers and she can get daily income. Also, three years ago she bought a “motocarro” (a three wheeled motorized cart). A year later she bought another one. Two of her sons work with these vehicles transporting passengers. Every day they give their earnings to Luz to manage. This is her eighth loan with MFP. What she likes about working with her communal bank is that all of her colleagues are very responsible and hard working. She will use the money she is asking for to buy more clothes for approximately 2,000 PEN. With the rest she plans to get spare parts to have her motocarros repaired.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marlinda

texts.es:
Marlinda tiene 29 años, es madre de 3 hijos, quienes son estudiantes y vive junto a su esposo que es agricultor. Hace 3 años se dedica al comercio de diversos productos, pero en su mayoría comestibles (abarrotes, bebidas, carnes, verduras, etc.), para ello mandó construir un local en su casa. Marlinda se levanta muy temprano para abrir su negocio, atiende durante todo el día y todos los días, esta actividad le permite solventar sus gastos familiares, en especial la educación de sus hijos y lo más satisfactorio para ella, es que ya cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes regulares quienes acuden a su tienda constantemente.
Este es su 9no crédito con MFP y en todo este tiempo comenta que lo que más le gusta de su banco comunal es que sus compañeros son personas ordenadas y muy solidarias. Con el dinero que viene solicitando ampliará el local de su negocio para seguir creciendo, además de comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería.
texts.en:
Marlinda is 29 years old and the mother of 3 children who are students. Her husband is a farmer. For the past 3 years, she has dedicated herself to her business of selling diverse products, mostly food (groceries, beverages, meats, vegetables, etc.). She built a room in her house exclusively for her business. Marlena wakes up early in the morning to open her store and manages it the entire day and every day. Her business enables her to provide for the household expenses, especially her children’s education. The work provides her great satisfaction. She has several regular customers who come by her store constantly to shop.

Marlinda is requesting her 9th loan from MFP. The things she likes most about her Communal Bank are that the members work well together and are organized. With the money she requested, she will expand her store so that the business will continue to grow. She will also buy more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise & expand her store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Roly

texts.es:
Roly tiene 36 años, es madre de una pequeña de 7 añitos, vive con su esposo en su casa propia. Desde hace un año se viene dedicando a la crianza de pollos, tiene un pequeño galpón acondicionado en su misma casa y para este negocio cuenta con el apoyo de toda su familia. A Roly le gusta cuidar muy bien de sus pollos para que lleguen a su tamaño y peso adecuado para su comercialización. Adicionalmente, vende pescado a otras ciudades, esta labor la viene ejerciendo desde hace 5 meses y también le está yendo muy bien. Para el futuro, Roly quiere comprar un terreno para mandar a construir galpones más grandes y mejor implementados que alberguen a una gran cantidad de pollos.
Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP y lo que más le gusta de su banco comunal, es que hay mucha armonía entre todos los integrantes y están bien comprometidos con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará más pollos y suficiente alimento para su crianza.
texts.en:
Roly is 36 years old, mother of a 7 year-old daughter, and lives with her husband in their own house. For the past year, she has been dedicated to breeding chickens, and she has a small, well equipped shed in her own house. The whole family helps to take care of the chickens. Roly enjoys taking good care of her chickens so that they reach the proper size and weight for selling them. As a side job, she sells fish to other cites, and she has been doing this for 5 months and this is also going very well for her. As for the future, Roly wants to buy land that she can use to build larger, better equipped sheds that will accommodate a larger population of chickens. This is her third loan with MFP, and the thing she likes the most about her community bank is that there is a lot of harmony between all the members, and they are very committed to punctuality of their balances. With the money that she has asked for, she will buy more chickens and sufficient food for their growth.

Translated from Spanish by Mitchell Usher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chickens and their food

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 31 años, es madre de una niña de 3 añitos y vive con su esposo, quien es profesor, en su casa propia. Hace un año implementó en casa un espacio para la venta de comida, negocio que atiende sólo por las noches y ofrece platillos al paso acompañados de bebidas gaseosas. La rentabilidad de esta actividad se debe a su casa está ubicada en una muy transitada y todas las noches vende todas las porciones esperadas. Adicionalmente, por las tardes trabaja con su esposo en su taller de carpintería, donde fabrican diversos muebles a solicitud de sus clientes. El deseo de Rosa para el futuro es lograr ahorrar lo necesario para tener un restaurante especializado en pollo a la brasa (platillo muy popular en la región) a estos establecimientos se les llama “pollerías”.
Con MFP, ya tiene 7 préstamos, y está muy contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus compañeros son cumplidos con sus pagos y prima el respeto entre todos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará utensilios de cocina; también invertirá en el taller de carpintería, comprando mayor cantidad de madera para fabricar los muebles últimamente solicitados.
texts.en:
Rosa tiene 31 años, es madre de una niña de 3 añitos y vive con su esposo, quien es profesor, en su casa propia. Hace un año implementó en casa un espacio para la venta de comida, negocio que atiende sólo por las noches y ofrece platillos al paso acompañados de bebidas gaseosas. La rentabilidad de esta actividad se debe a su casa está ubicada en una muy transitada y todas las noches vende todas las porciones esperadas. Adicionalmente, por las tardes trabaja con su esposo en su taller de carpintería, donde fabrican diversos muebles a solicitud de sus clientes. El deseo de Rosa para el futuro es lograr ahorrar lo necesario para tener un restaurante especializado en pollo a la brasa (platillo muy popular en la región) a estos establecimientos se les llama “pollerías”. Con MFP, ya tiene 7 préstamos, y está muy contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus compañeros son cumplidos con sus pagos y prima el respeto entre todos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará utensilios de cocina; también invertirá en el taller de carpintería, comprando mayor cantidad de madera para fabricar los muebles últimamente solicitados. Rosa is 31, mother of a 3-year old daughter, and lives in her own home with her husband, a teacher. A year ago she set aside a space in her home to sell take home food and soft drinks in the evenings. The profitability of this business is due to the the location of her home in a heavily trafficked area. Every night she sells all the food that she prepares. Additionally, in the afternoons she works with her husband in his carpentry shop, where they make different types of furniture to order. Rosa's wish for the future is to be able to save enough money to have a restaurant that specializes in roasted chickens (a popular dish in her area)-they are called "pollerias" (roast chicken shops). With MFP, she has already had 7 loans. She is very happy to be part of her community bank because all of the members are reliable with their payments and the respect they show for each other. With the money that she is currently requesting she will buy kitchen utensils; also she will invest in the carpentry shop, buying a larger amount of wood to make the furniture that has been ordered recently.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy kitchen utensils for her take out food business and wood for her husband's carpentry shop

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma tiene 39 años, es madre de 3 hijos que están siguiendo estudios superiores y también trabajan, vive con su esposo, quien es trabajador de la municipalidad de su localidad. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de carne de pollo. Vilma compra diariamente 20 pollos, posteriormente ella misma los mata y limpia para venderlos por los distintos lugares de su zona. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es relacionarse con muchas personas, por ello da un buen trato a todos sus clientes para que le compren regularmente y la recomienden. Por otro parte, este negocio logra que Vilma se sienta útil y un sostén de su familia, apoyando a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Su deseo a futuro es lograr implementar un pequeño minimarket donde pueda ofrecer todo tipo de productos a sus vecinos y clientes.
Con MFP, este sería su 6to préstamo, es parte de un banco comunal y lo que más le gusta de esta metodología de trabajo es que entre todos los integrantes se apoyan y trabajan responsablemente para el puntual pago de sus cuotas. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará un triciclo para movilizar su producto. También adquirirá pollos bebés y suficiente alimento para su alimentación, puesto que ha decidido dejar de comprarlos y criar sus propios pollos.
texts.en:
Vilma is 39 years old and is the mother of 3 children who are in college and also work. She lives with her husband who is a city worker in their town. For the last 3 years, she has sold meat and chicken. Each day, Vilma buys 20 chickens, then butchers and cleans them so that she can sell them in different locations in her area. What she most enjoys about her work is connecting with many different people and providing good customer service so that they keep coming back and recommending her to others. Also, her business makes Vilma feel useful and supports her family, helping her husband with household expenses. Her hope for the future is to open a minimarket where she can offer a wide variety of products to her neighbors and customers. This will be her sixth loan with MFP as part of a Village Bank. What she likes the most about this method is that all of the participants support each other and work responsibly to pay back their loans on time. With the money from the loan she is requesting she will buy a tricycle to transport her products. She will also buy baby chicks and enough feed for them as she has decided to stop buying and to raise her own chickens.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a tricycle, chickens and chickenfeed

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mayanapa Group

texts.es:
Ernestina N. de 70 años trabaja con Pro Mujer hace aproximadamente 4 años, su comadre la habìa invitado a formar parte del grupo “Mayanapa” que a su vez pertence al Centro Focal “Collpani”. Ella tiene 4 hijos todos casados y cuida de sus dos nietas que son huérfanas, su actividad económica es vender  jugos (plátano, papaya, zanahoria) en diferentes ferias, trae su mercaderia de los tambos (lugar donde se compra fruta al por mayor), ahora necesita el préstamo para comprar sumidora y licuadora.  A Ernestina le gusta participar de las reuniones porque se distrae y comparte con sus compañeras. 
Las demás integrantes de Mayanapa tambien tienen sus propios negocios como la venta de calzados, chompas, comida, colchas y necesitan el préstamo para comprar  mercaderia.

loans.use: COMPRA DE HERRAMIENTAS Y MERCADERIA

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: El señor Jorge L. de 34 años de edad, es cadete de taxi en la ciudad de Managua con dos turnos diferente una semana de 5 a 2pm de la tarde y otra de 2pm hasta ahoras de la noche, muy cansado y a veces pocos clientes, pero otros días muy buenos. Reside en el barrio Villa Venezuela con una hija de once años de edad estudia el taxi es de su propiedad, lo cual compro con ahorros. Ante de comprar el vehiculo trabajaba en estesa técnica. Sus planes es  poder comprar un terreno para hacer su casa ya que vive en casa de su suegra, a si como dar estudio a su hija para que tenga mejores oportunidades de vida. Con este préstamo dará mantenimiento a su vehiculo como comprar llantas y reparación de la velocidades para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Da las gracias Afodenic por la oportunidad del financiamiento para hacer posible sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Mr. Jorge L. is 34 years old, and is a txi driver in Managua. He works two different shifts during the week, from 5am until 2 pm, and another from 2 pm until the middle of the night. Afterwards he is naturally quite tired, and sometimes he has very few customers. However, some days he gets many customers. He lives in the Villa Venezuela neighborhood with an 11 year old daughter who studies his taxi, the very one he bought with savings. Before he bought his taxi cab, he worked with precision control panels. His plans are to be able to buy land to turn the house his mother-in-law lives in into a study so that his daughter will have better opporotunities for life. With this loan, he will have maintenance done to his car, such as buying wheels, and to repair the speedometer in his car, to give his customers better service. He thanks AFODENIC for giving him the opportunity to make his goals possible by loaning him money.

Translated from Spanish by Mitchell Usher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying wheels and paying for repairs for his taxi

loans.name: Sol De Verano-Piscis Group

texts.es: Cuatro son las integrantes del grupo Sol de Verano-Piscis, que a su vez pertenecen al Centro Focal Juan Pablo, Hilaria C. de 54 vende remedios naturales, Maria Luz M. de 38 años elabora dulces en su domicilio, Esperanza R. de 40 años vende repuestos electrónicos y Elisa R. que tambien produce dulces. Todas necesitan del préstamo para comprar mercaderia e incrementar sus productos, tambien comprar materia prima como el azúcar.
texts.en:
The Sol de Verano-Piscis group, a branch of the Juan Pablo headquarters, is comprised of 4 members. Hilaria C., age 54, sells natural remedies. Maria Luz M., age 38, makes homemade candy. Esperanza R., age 40, sells spare parts for electronics, while Elisa R. also makes homemade candy. They all need a loan to purchase merchandise and increase their products. They also need to purchase raw materials, such as sugar.


Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Jhonny Antonio

texts.es: El joven Jhonny de 29 años de edad, casado, reside en el barrio Riguero en la capital de Managua, el se caso a los 20 años el cual se ha dedicado a trabaja su esposa le tiene una hija de 9 años de edad, comenzó con la venta de ropa, pero luego decidió buscar un trabajo para tener un ingreso seguro y solo en tiempos libres seguir con la venta de ropa, trabaja como guarda de seguridad y las ventas la hace su esposa. Ha crecido en inventario gracias a los prestamos que Afodenic a otorgado es el segundo ciclo y esta sastifecho por lograr incrementar su inventario, con este préstamo comprara ropa, zapatos para aumentar el volumen de venta lo cual le dará mejores ganancias para poder hacer mejora a su vivienda.
texts.en:
El joven Jhonny de 29 años de edad, casado, reside en el barrio Riguero en la capital de Managua, el se caso a los 20 años el cual se ha dedicado a trabaja su esposa le tiene una hija de 9 años de edad, comenzó con la venta de ropa, pero luego decidió buscar un trabajo para tener un ingreso seguro y solo en tiempos libres seguir con la venta de ropa, trabaja como guarda de seguridad y las ventas la hace su esposa. Ha crecido en inventario gracias a los prestamos que Afodenic a otorgado es el segundo ciclo y esta sastifecho por lograr incrementar su inventario, con este préstamo comprara ropa, zapatos para aumentar el volumen de venta lo cual le dará mejores ganancias para poder hacer mejora a su vivienda. Jhonny is a young man of 29 years of age, living in the Riguero neighborhood in the capital, Managua. He married at 20 and began to work with his wife selling clothing. He has a 9-year old daughter. He soon decided to look for work where he would have a more secure income and now he only sells clothing in his spare time. He works as a security guard and his wife does the selling. His inventory has grown thanks to the loan that Afodenic has issued in the second cycle. He is content because with this loan he will buy clothing and shoes to increase sales. With the better earnings they will be able to live better.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and shoes

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: Doña Juana Francisca de 51 años de edad, es una mujer esforzada que desde joven a trabajado para apoyar a su familia tiene cinco hijos cuatro trabajan y una estudia, su esposo es técnico en aluminio y vidrio. Su negocio es el alquiler de sillas y mesas y tiene 17 años en este trabajo, es su tercer ciclo en Afodenic y con ellos ha hecho mejoras a su vivienda como comprado sillas para incrementar su negocio. Con este préstamo comprara materiales de construcción para hacer divisiones de cuarto y poder tener privacidad. Sus planes es poder ayudar a sus hijas a que termine sus estudios. Da las gracias a la institución por la oportunidad de estos créditos.
texts.en:
Doña Juana Francisca is 51 years old and is a strong woman who since she was young has worked to support her five children (four work and one is in school). Her husband works with aluminum and glass. Her business is renting chairs and tables and she has been in business for 17 years. This is her third loan with Afodenic and with the loans she has made improvements to her home such as buying chairs to grow her business. With this loan, she will buy construction materials to create room dividers and be able to have privacy. Her plan is to help her daughters finish their studies. She is grateful for the opportunity to get these loans.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to make room dividers

loans.name: Jose Guadalupe

texts.es: El señor José Guadalupe vive en nuestra ciudad con su esposa la señora Francisca quien se dedica a las labores domesticas y atiende su negocio que aun es pequeño porque debido a una enfermedad de su hija la mas pequeña dejo de surtir, pero cuenta con el apoyo del otro ingreso del señor José ya que el labora para una empresa de venta de gas domestico en el puesto de chofer desde hace un año, ellos están solicitando este crédito para surtir mas mercancía para su negocio de nombre “Abarrotes ADLITH” ya que la tienen establecida desde hace3 años y no dejan de vender pero les hace falta producto y mercancías para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Jose Guadalupe lives in our city with his wife Francisca, who takes care of the domestic chores and attends to her business, which is small still due to their youngest daughter's illness. She counts on the support of Jose's income, since he has worked for one year as a chauffeur for a company that sells gas cylinders. They are requesting this credit in order to stock more merchandise in their business, called "Abarrotes ADLITH". They established it three years ago and although they haven't stopped selling, they are lacking products and merchandise to satisfy the needs of their clients.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in his business (the purchase of merchandise)

loans.name: Alma Alexandra

texts.es: La señora Alma Alexandra es casada, vive con sus 2 hijos y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo el señor Marco Antonio  quien labora para una empresa como asistente de gerencia desde hace 2 años, ellos tiene un negocio en casa  que su giro es de un ciber café de nombre “ San Isidro “donde tienen un total de 5 computadoras; las renta por horas a todos los estudiantes y personas que deseen utilizarlas, con tal negocio ellos están solicitando este crédito para la compra de teclados y otros tipos de accesorios para las computadoras ya que desean ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
La señora Alma Alexandra es casada, vive con sus 2 hijos y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo el señor Marco Antonio quien labora para una empresa como asistente de gerencia desde hace 2 años, ellos tiene un negocio en casa que su giro es de un ciber café de nombre “ San Isidro “donde tienen un total de 5 computadoras; las renta por horas a todos los estudiantes y personas que deseen utilizarlas, con tal negocio ellos están solicitando este crédito para la compra de teclados y otros tipos de accesorios para las computadoras ya que desean ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Mrs. Alma Alexandra is married and lives with her two sons and is supported by her husband Marco Antonio. He has worked in a business as the assistant manager for the last 2 years. She has a cyber cafe business at home named "San Isidro" where she has 5 computers that she rents hourly to students and people who want to use them. She is requesting a loan for her business to buy keyboards and other types of computer accessories so she can offer better service to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy computer accessories (invest in her business)

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es: La señora Juana María vive sola en su casa y trabaja para una empresa en el área de operadora desde hace 5 años,ella cuenta tambien con el apoyo de sus hijos que ya estan casados pero la apoyan economicamente.Ella esta tramitando este crédito para la construcción de una barda en el frente de su vivienda para mayor protección y seguridad de ella ya que vive sola y desea sentir mayor tranquilidad.
texts.en:
La señora Juana María vive sola en su casa y trabaja para una empresa en el área de operadora desde hace 5 años,ella cuenta tambien con el apoyo de sus hijos que ya estan casados pero la apoyan economicamente.Ella esta tramitando este crédito para la construcción de una barda en el frente de su vivienda para mayor protección y seguridad de ella ya que vive sola y desea sentir mayor tranquilidad. Mrs. Juana Maria lives by herself in her home and has been employed in a local business as a worker for the past 5 years. She also receives financial supprt from her children who are married. She is using this loan to build a fence in front of her home for better protection and security since she lives alone, and wants to have more peace of mind.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a fence for her home

loans.name: Berenice

texts.es:
Berenice tiene 65 años D. edad, vive junto a su esposo y un nieto D. 19 años D. edad en el caserío Sime, distrito D. Pítipo, ubicado a 30 minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

DesD. hace más D. 20 años se dedica a la venta D. aves D. corral, usualmente cría pavos y gallinas, pero hace algunas semanas una extraña peste mató a todas sus gallinas quedándose sólo con los pocos pavos que cría actualente.

Los ingresos que percibe D. este negocio son utilizados habitualmente en su salud y en la D. su esposo, ambos, debido a su edad avanzada y por la gran cantidad D. esfuerzo físico que realizaron durante su juventud trabajando en la agricultura, tienen la necesidad D. acudir constantemente al doctor ya que sufren D. diversas dolencias.

Su nieto estudia en un Instituto D. la zona y durante sus vacaciones también trabaja para ayudar a solventar los gastos del hogar; ella desea invertir en la compra D. más aves D. corral para su engorD. y posterior venta y D. esta manera seguir ayudando a su nieto en sus estudios, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar a nuestra Institución un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr sus objetivos.

Su más granD. anhelo es ver a su nieto convertido en un profesional y trabajador responsable, esta es la segunda vez que trabaja con nosotros y ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos por lo que es considerada como una cliente excelente.
texts.en:
Berenice, 65 years old, lives with her husband and 19 year old grandson in the village of Sime, part of the Pitipo district, located 30 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For more than 20 years, she has raised and sold fowl -- usually turkeys and chickens. However, a few weeks ago, a strange plague killed all her chickens so now she is left only with a few turkeys. The money her business makes is used to pay for the costs needed to maintain both her and her husband's health now that since they are growing older. The high level of physical labor and farm work they performed in their earlier years has maD. it necessary for them go to the doctor on a regular basis to treat their various ailments. Her grandson attends a local high school and during his vacations, he too works to help pay for household costs. Berenice wishes to invest in the the purchase of more fowl so she can raise and sell them and therefore allow their grandson to continue on with his studies. She requests a loan of 1500 nuevos soles that will allow her to carry out her objectives. Her biggest wish is to see her grandson become a responsible worker in a professional job setting. This is the second time that Berenice has worked with us and has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality in her payments and for this reason, considered as an excellent client.

Translated from Spanish by Colleen Godfrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of farm fowl (to raise and then sell)

loans.name: Yesenia Esmeralda

texts.es:
Yesenia tiene 34 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y tres de sus hijos en el distrito pesquero de San José, ubicado a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Lleva 3 años vendiendo pescado fresco en los exteriores del Mercado de San José, eventualmente también procesa pescado y lo vende como pescado seco – salado en el mercado Moshoqueque (mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Chiclayo).

Compra su mercadería todos los días en el terminal pesquero del distrito de Santa Rosa, y luego retorna a San José a ofrecérselo a sus clientes; su esposo, al igual que la mayoría de hombres de la zona, se dedica eventualmente a la pesca, pero lo recaudado por esta actividad no abastece para solventar los gastos económicos de su familia.

Actualmente el precio del pescado es muy caro debido a la temporada de veda y a la baja cantidad que se pesca a diario, además ella tiene que gastar en movilidad todos los días para transportar su mercancía, esta situación le ha llevado a la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a nuestra Institución un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de pescado para su venta o eventual procesamiento.

Su más grande anhelo es hacer crecer gradualmente su negocio empezando por vender su producto dentro del mercado, y posteriormente comprarse un auto para poder movilizar su mercadería con mayor facilidad, otra de sus metas es ahorrar el dinero suficiente para asegurarle a sus hijos una educación de calidad en el futuro.

Yesenia es muy conocida por sus vecinos que la consideran una mujer luchadora, responsable y que siempre trata de sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Yesenia is a 34-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and three of her children in the fishing district of San José, located 20 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

She has been selling fresh fish on the outskirts of the San José Market for 3 years. She also processes fish and sells it as dried and salted fish in the Moshoqueque Market—the city of Chiclayo’s wholesale market.

She purchases fish every day at the fish market in the Santa Rosa district. She then returns to San José to sell it to her customers. Her husband, like most other men in the area, is a fisherman. However, the money that he earns is not enough to cover all the family expenses.

As it is the closed season and fish quantities are low, the price of fish is currently high. Furthermore, Yesenia needs to spend money on transporting her merchandise. This situation has led her to request a loan from our institute for the very first time. She is requesting a 1,200.00 PEN loan to invest it in purchasing fish to be sold or processed.

Her biggest wish is to expand her business gradually, starting by selling fish inside the market, and subsequently purchasing a vehicle so that she can transport her merchandise with greater ease. Another one of her goals is to save enough money to offer her children a quality education in the future.

Yesenia is very well-known by her neighbors, who consider her to be a hard-working and responsible who is always trying to help her family get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fresh fish

loans.name: Doris Marely

texts.es:
Doris tiene 36 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive junto a su hija, de 8 años de edad, su madre y su hermana menor en el centro poblado Saltur, distrto de Zaña, ubicado a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella es propietaria de una pequeña bodega - tienda en su casa, allí vende golosinas y bebidas, este negocio le está dando buenos resultados y poco a poco lo ha ido ampliando, siendo esta actividad la única fuente de ingreso familiar.

Ella desea terminar de ampliar su negocio con la compra de abarrotes y productos de cuidado personal (jaboncillo, crema dental, cepillos dentales, etc.) por este motivo está solicitando por primera vez a nuestra Institución un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Su más grande anhelo es ahorrar el dinero suficiente para asegurarle a su hija una buena  educación así como brindarle a su madre una mejor calidad de vida; Doris es muy conocida y estimada por sus vecinos que la toman por una mujer responsable y preocupada por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Doris is a 36-year-old single mother who lives with her 8-year-old daughter, her mother, and her youngest sister in the town of Saltur, district of Zaña, located some 30 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She owns a small in-home general store, where she sells drinks and candy. This business has yielded great results for her, and she has been able to expand it little by little. This is her family’s sole source of income. She would like to finish expanding her business by purchasing provisions and personal care products (soap, toothpaste, toothbrushes, etc.). For this reason, she is requesting her first loan of 500.00 PEN from our institute.

Her greatest wish is to be able to save enough money to give her daughter a good education, as well as offer her mother a better quality of life. Doris is well-known and esteemed by her neighbors, who view her as a responsible woman who cares about her family’s well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase provisions and personal care products to sell

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita M. is from the village of Tipan, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 65 years old. Rosita is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Rosita owns & operates a business selling charcoal to local community members. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from GDMPC. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rosita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: San

texts.en: San C. is a 42-year-old farmer and married woman. She also collects palm sugar in bulk on credit from palm climbers who live around her community and then she sells it, gaining a profit. San C. is married with eight children; three of them are working in a garment factory, while the other five are students. Her husband is a taxi driver and carpenter as well. In addition, San C. is pursuing a loan as capital, which will enable her to maintain her palm sugar trade for a longer time. She will use some of her loan to widen the size of her existing house.

loans.use: As capital

loans.name: Khloak

texts.en: Khloak D., 30, is a married woman and mother. She retails both new and used clothes that she orders in bulk from wherever it is sold at a reasonable price. She is married to Koy Sarim, age 30, who is a motor taxi rider. They have two minor children. Khloak D. conducts her investment very smoothly. She has a lot of regular customers who need to buy her clothes because she is skilled in public relations. To earn extra income and in order to satisfy more customers' needs, Khloak D. would like a loan from Kiva’s partner HKL to be used to accumulate more clothing to continue retailing.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth A. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 28 years old. Ruth is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Ruth owns & operates a business weaving and selling "sawali" or woven bamboo wall to local businesses and community members. Ruth has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ruth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruth is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ruth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Tho's Group

texts.en: This group loan is for two low-income people. Its leader, Tho L., 57, is a single mother who is blessed with six children. One of her sons works in construction and provides his little income for the family. Tho L. was married, but her husband died of senility years ago. She currently owns a small trade; she sells beef soup for villagers at the evening. To make a daily additional income, she is looking for a loan as capital to order bamboo baskets in bulk from weavers and then re-sell to raise profits. The other borrower is Mrs. Sos P., 24, a basket maker, who is asking for a loan to buy more raw materials.

loans.use: To order bamboo baskets in bulk from weavers

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
X. Nguyễn Thị (20213050010) is a 35-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  X. is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Đức Lân 01 (1).


X. is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, X. works in a family member's business raising pigs for sale.  X. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2.200.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, X. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  X. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.704.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. She is now requesting a new loan of 6.048.000 VND, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. The loan will be the third loan taken out by X. from SEDA.  X. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Trần Thị T. (20213050011) is a 47-year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


2.  Nguyễn Thị S. (20213050012) is a 43-year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her business running a general store.


3.  Đỗ Thị H. (20213050013) is a 31-year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.


4.  Vũ Thị T. (20213050014) is a 36-year-old male who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support his business making & selling food.


5.  Đăng Thị D. (20213050015) is a 43-year-old female who is requesting a 1.120.000 VND loan to support her tailoring business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


X. Nguyễn Thị (20213050010) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  X. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Đức Lân 01 (1).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán.  X. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, X. kiếm được khoảng 2.200.000 VND.  Vào 2008, X. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  X. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.704.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.048.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Trần Thị T. (20213050011) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Nguyễn Thị S. (20213050012) là 43 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


3.  Đỗ Thị H. (20213050013) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


4.  Vũ Thị T. (20213050014) là 36 tuổi nam.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


5.  Đăng Thị D. (20213050015) là 43 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1.120.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Son

texts.en: S., 30, is a cooking supply trader. She sells items such as firewood, charcoal, and some groceries to citizens in the village. Another income source is from her husband who works driving a car taxi for a salary. The couple is blessed with two teenage children who are enrolled in school. Recently, some parts of S.’s stock have been exhausted; she hopes to increase her stock supply with a loan from HKL to purchase extra charcoal and firewood to sell. This loan will allow S. to increase her income and maintain her family’s expenses more easily.

loans.use: To purchase extra charcoal and firewood to sell

loans.name: Son

texts.en: To meet the needs of his own small family, this man has had a carpentry business years ago because it's a sector growing in profitability. Beside his currently work, he and his wife also cultivate rice. His name is Son S., age 30, a married man and father. Son S. now lives with three kids who attend school. He will be used his first loan to buy a plot of forestial land which he will use to greatly grow a various crop on it.

loans.use: To buy a plot of forestial land which he will use to greatly grow a various crop on it

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is already 46 years old.  She is married to Delfin and they have three children: Ronie, Alex, and Lorna. Their two eldest children only finished elementary level while their youngest is a high school graduate.   All of their children are already married. 

Adelaida helps her husband earn a living by retailing goods  helps her husband by managing their village store.  They used their income for their daily needs and also for the maintenance of their farm and to provide their farming needs such as fertilizers. The couple is doing their best to cope with the economic crisis that they are now experiencing.  The couple also wanted to help the education of their grandchildren and this is the reason why she would like to improve her business.  Her store is open from 6:00 in the morning until 9:00 in the evening.  Her desire of making the business successful motivated her to request a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP10, 000 that will serve as her additional business capital.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Bùi's Group

texts.en:
L. Bùi Thị (20213050016) is a 40-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  L. is the group leader of a nine-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Đức Lân 03 (3).


L. is married and has three school-aged children.  To make a living, L. owns & operates a business selling dried goods in the local community.  L. has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 2.500.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, L. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  L. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.704.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6.048.000 VND, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  The loan will be the third loan taken out by L. from SEDA.  L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Tô Thị X. (20213050017) is a 32-year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.


2.  Vũ Thị T. (20213050018) is a 34-year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her business making & selling food.


3.  Vũ Thị H. (20213050019) is a 33-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business making & selling food.


4.  Tô Thị L. (20213050020) is a 33-year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.


5.  Chu Thị T. (20213050021) is a 35-year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.


6.  Bùi Thị T. (20213050022) is a 25-year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her furniture-making business.


7.  Nghiêm Thị H. (20213050023) is a 27-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.


8.  Tô Thị Phương (20213050024) is a 32-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


L. Bùi Thị (20213050016) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở T. phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  L. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 9 các T. viên.  Mặc dù mỗi T. viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các T. viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Đức Lân 03 (3).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm sấy khô trong cộng đồng địa phương.  L. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 6 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, L. kiếm được khoảng 2.500.000 VND.  Vào 2008, L. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  L. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.704.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các T. phần thô cần thiết để chế tạo sản phẩm để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.048.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Tô Thị X. (20213050017) là 32 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.
